title: The word problem for double categories
abstract: we solve the word problem for free double category without equation between generator by translate it to the word problem for 2 - category . this yield a quadratic algorithm decide the equality of diagram in a free double category . the translation be of interest in its own right since and can for instance be use to reason about double category with the language of 2 - category , sidestep the pinwheel problem . it also show that although double category be formally more general than 2 - category , they be not actually more expressive , explain the rarity of application of this notion .

title: Multiple vector bundles: cores, splittings and decompositions
authors: Malte Heuer and Madeleine Jotz Lean
abstract: this paper introduce ∞- and n - fold vector bundle as special functor from the ∞- and n - cube category to the category of smooth manifold . we study the core and " n - pullback " of n - fold vector bundle and we prove that any n - fold vector bundle admit a non - canonical isomorphism to a decompose n - fold vector bundle . a colimit argument then show that ∞-fold vector bundle admit as well non - canonical decomposition . for the convenience of the reader , the case of triple vector bundle be discuss in detail .

title: Orbifolds of Reshetikhin-Turaev TQFTs
authors: Nils Carqueville, Ingo Runkel, Gregor Schaumann
abstract: we construct three class of generalised orbifold of Reshetikhin - Turaev theory for a modular tensor category C , use the language of defect tqft : ( i ) spherical fusion category give orbifold for the " trivial " defect tqft associate to Vect , ( ii ) g - cross extension of C give group orbifold for any finite group g , and ( iii ) we construct orbifold from commutative Δ - separable Frobenius algebra in C. we also explain how the Turaev - Viro state sum construction fit into our framework by prove that it be isomorphic to the orbifold of case ( i ) . moreover , we treat the case ( ii ) and ( iii ) in the more general setting of ribbon tensor category . for case ( ii ) we show how Morita equivalence lead to isomorphic orbifold , and we discuss Tambara - Yamagami category as particular example .

title: Fibrations of AU-contexts beget fibrations of toposes
abstract: suppose an extension map u : t_1 -&gt ; t_0 in the 2 - category Con of context for arithmetic universe satisfy a Chevalley criterion for be an ( op)fibration in Con . if M be a model of t_0 in an elementary topos S with nno , then the classifier p : s[t_1 / m ] -&gt ; S satisfy the representable definition of be an ( op)fibration in the 2 - category ETop of elementary topos ( with nno ) and geometric morphism .

title: Symmetric monoidal categories and Γ-categories
abstract: in this paper we construct a symmetric monoidal closed model category of coherently commutative monoidal category . the main aim of this paper be to establish a Quillen equivalence between a model category of coherently commutative monoidal category and a natural model category of permutative ( or strict symmetric monoidal ) category , Perm , which be not a symmetric monoidal closed model category . the right adjoint of this Quillen equivalence be the classical Segal 's Nerve functor .

title: Exact sequences in the enchilada category
authors: M. Eryüzlü, S. Kaliszewski, and John Quigg
abstract: we define exact sequence in the enchilada category of c*-algebra and correspondence , and prove that the reduce - cross - product functor be not exact for the enchilada category . our motivation be to determine whether we can have a well understanding of the Baum - Connes conjecture by use enchilada category . along the way we prove numerous result show that the enchilada category be rather strange .

title: Homotopy theory with marked additive categories
authors: Ulrich Bunke, Alexander Engel, Daniel Kasprowski, and Christoph Winges
abstract: we construct combinatorial model category structure on the category of ( marked ) category and ( marked ) preadditive category , and we characterize ( marked ) additive category as fibrant object in a Bousfield localization of preadditive category . these model category structure be use to present the correspond infinity - category obtain by invert equivalence . we apply these result to explicitly calculate limit and colimit in these infinity - category . the motivate application be a systematic construction of the equivariant coarse algebraic K - homology with coefficient in an additive category from its non - equivariant version .

title: Shifted double Lie-Rinehart algebras
abstract: we generalize the notion of shift double poisson and shift double Lie - rinehart structure to monoid in a symmetric monoidal abelian category . the main result be that an n - shift double Lie - rinehart structure on a pair ( a , m ) be equivalent to a non - shifted double Lie - rinehart structure on the pair ( a , m[-n ] ) .

title: Cubical model categories and quasi-categories
abstract: the goal of this article be to emphasize the role of cubical set in enrich category theory and infinity - category theory . we show in particular that category enrich in cubical set provide a convenient way to describe many infinity - category appear in the context of homological algebra .

title: A new Galois structure in the category of internal preorders
authors: Alberto Facchini, Carmelo Finocchiaro and Marino Gran
abstract: let PreOrd(C ) be the category of internal preorder in an exact category C. we show that the pair ( Eq(C),ParOrd(C ) ) be a pretorsion theory in PreOrd(C ) , where Eq(C ) and ParOrd(C ) be the full subcategorie of internal equivalence relation and of internal partial order in C , respectively . we observe that ParOrd(C ) be a reflective subcategory of PreOrd(C ) such that each component of the unit of the adjunction be a pullback - stable regular epimorphism . the reflector f : PreOrd(C ) -&gt ; PardOrd(C ) turn out to have stable unit in the sense of Cassidy , Hébert and Kelly , thus induce an admissible categorical Galois structure . in particular , when C be the category Set of set , we show that this reflection induce a monotone - light factorization system ( in the sense of Carboni , Janelidze , Kelly and Paré ) in PreOrd(Set ) . a topological interpretation of our result in the category of Alexandroff - discrete space be also give , via the well - know isomorphism between this latter category and PreOrd(Set ) .

title: Augmented virtual double categories
abstract: in this article the notion of virtual double category ( also know as fc - multicategory ) be extend as follow . while cell in a virtual double category classically have a horizontal multi - source and single horizontal target , the notion of augment virtual double category introduce here extend the latter notion by include cell with empty horizontal target as well . any augment virtual double category come with a build - in notion of " locally small object " and we describe advantage of use augment virtual double category as a setting for formal category rather than 2 - category , which be classically equip with a notion of " admissible object " by mean of a yoneda structure in the sense of Street and Walters . an object be locally small precisely if it admit a horizontal unit , and we show that the notion of augment virtual double category and virtual double category coincide in the presence of all horizontal unit . without assume the existence of horizontal unit we show that most of the basic theory for virtual double category , such as that of restriction and composition of horizontal morphism , extend to augment virtual double category . we introduce and study in augment virtual double category the notion of " pointwise " composition of horizontal morphism , which formalise the classical composition of profunctor give by the coend formula .

title: Spec(Z) and the Gromov Norm
abstract: we define the homology of a simplicial set with coefficient in a Segal 's gamma - set ( s - module ) . we show the relevance of this new homology with value in s - module by prove that take as coefficient the s - module at the archimedean place over the structure sheaf on Spec(Z ) , one obtain on the singular homology with real coefficient of a topological space x , a norm equivalent to the Gromov norm . moreover , we prove that the two norm agree when x be an oriented compact Riemann surface .

title: Small categories of homological dimension one
authors: Karimah Sweet and Charles Ching-An Cheng
abstract: we derive three equivalent necessary condition for a small category to have homological dimension one , generalize a result of Novikov . as a consequence , any small cancellative category of homological dimension one be embeddable in a groupoid .

title: Finite products in partial morphism categories
authors: S.N. Hosseini, A.R. Shir Ali Nasab
abstract: in this article we give necessary and sufficient condition for a binary product to exist in a partial morphism category . we also give necessary and sufficient condition for the existence of a productive terminal in such category .

title: Rank-based persistence
authors: Mattia G. Bergomi and Pietro Vertechi
abstract: persistence have prove to be a valuable tool to analyze real world datum robustly . several approach to persistence have be attempt over time , some topological in flavor , base on the vector space - value homology functor , other combinatorial , base on arbitrary set - value functor . to unify the study of topological and combinatorial persistence in a common categorical framework , we give axiom for a generalize rank function on object in a target category so that functor to that category induce persistence function . we port the interleave and bottleneck distance to this novel framework and generalize classical equality and inequality . unlike set and vector space , in many category the rank of an object do not identify it up to isomorphism : to preserve information about the structure of persistence module , we define colorable rank , persistence diagram and prove the equality between multicolored bottleneck distance and interleave distance in semisimple abelian category . to illustrate our framework in practice , we give example of multicolored persistent homology on filter topological space with a group action and label point cloud datum .

title: L'-localization in an ∞-topos
abstract: we prove that , give any reflective subfibration l on an ∞-topo E , there exist a reflective subfibration l ' on E whose local map be the l - separate map , that be , the map whose diagonal be l - local .

title: Morita invariance of equivariant Lusternik-Schnirelmann category and  invariant topological complexity
authors: A. Angel, H. Colman, M. Grant and J. Oprea
abstract: we use the homotopy invariance of equivariant principal bundle to prove that the equivariant a - category of Clapp and Puppe be invariant under Morita equivalence . as a corollary , we obtain that both the equivariant Lusternik - Schnirelmann category of a group action and the invariant topological complexity be invariant under Morita equivalence . this allow a definition of topological complexity for orbifold .

title: On the axiomatisation of Boolean categories  with and without medial
abstract: the term ` ` boolean category '' should be use for describe an object that be to category what a boolean algebra be to poset . more specifically , a boolean category should provide the abstract algebraic structure underlie the proof in Boolean Logic , in the same sense as a cartesian closed category capture the proof in intuitionistic logic and a * -autonomous category capture the proof in linear logic . however , recent work have show that there be no canonical axiomatisation of a boolean category . in this work , we will see a series ( with increase strength ) of possible such axiomatisation , all base on the notion of * -autonomous category . we will particularly focus on the medial map , which have its origin in an inference rule in KS , a cut - free deductive system for boolean logic in the calculus of structure . finally , we will present a category of proof net as a particularly well - behaved example of a boolean category .

title: Preserving homology
abstract: we raise the question of say what it mean for a functor between abelian category to preserve homology . we give a kind of answer and explore the reason it be unsatisfactory in general ( although fine for left or right exact functor ) .

title: Points of affine categories and additivity
abstract: a category c be additive if and only if , for every object b of C , the category pt(c , b ) of pointed object in the comma category ( c , b ) be canonically equivalent to C. we reformulate the proof of this know result in order to obtain a strong one that use not all object of B of C , but only a conveniently define generating class S. if C be a variety of universal algebra , then one can take S to be the class consist of any single free algebra on a non - empty set .

title: Every Grothendieck topos has a one-way site
abstract: Lawvere have urge a project of characterize petit topos which have the character of generalized space and gros topos which have the character of category of space . etendue and locally decidable topos be seemingly petit and have a natural common generalization in site with all idempotent identity . this note show every Grothendieck topos have such a site . more , it define slanted product which take any site to an equivalent one way site , a site where all endomorphism be identity . on the other hand subcanonical one - way site be very special . a site criterion for petit topos will probably require subcanonical site .

title: Frobenius algebras and ambidextrous adjunctions
abstract: in this paper we explain the relationship between Frobenius object in monoidal category and adjunction in 2 - category . specifically , we show that every Frobenius object in a monoidal category $ m$ arise from an ambijunction ( simultaneous left and right adjoint ) in some 2 - category $ \mathcal{d}$ into which $ m$ fully and faithfully embed . since a 2d topological quantum field theory be equivalent to a commutative Frobenius algebra , this result also show that every 2d tqft be obtain from an ambijunction in some 2 - category . our theorem be prove by extend the theory of adjoint monad to the context of an arbitrary 2 - category and utilize the free completion under Eilenberg - Moore object . we then categorify this theorem by replace the monoidal category $ m$ with a semistrict monoidal 2 - category $ m$ , and replace the 2 - category $ \mathcal{d}$ into which it embed by a semistrict 3 - category . to state this more powerful result , we must first define the notion of a ` Frobenius pseudomonoid ' , which categorifie that of a Frobenius object . we then define the notion of a ` pseudo ambijunction ' , categorifye that of an ambijunction . in each case , the idea be that all the usual axiom now hold only up to coherent isomorphism . finally , we show that every Frobenius pseudomonoid in a semistrict monoidal 2 - category arise from a pseudo ambijunction in some semistrict 3 - category .

title: Inverting weak dihomotopy equivalence using homotopy continuous flow
abstract: a flow be homotopy continuous if it be indefinitely divisible up to s - homotopy . the full subcategory of cofibrant homotopy continuous flow have nice feature . not only it be big enough to contain all dihomotopy type , but also a morphism between they be a weak dihomotopy equivalence if and only if it be invertible up to dihomotopy . thus , the category of cofibrant homotopy continuous flow provide an implementation of Whitehead 's theorem for the full dihomotopy relation , and not only for s - homotopy as in previous work of the author . this fact be not the consequence of the existence of a model structure on the category of flow because it be know that there do not exist any model structure on it whose weak equivalence be exactly the weak dihomotopy equivalence . this fact be an application of a general result for the localization of a model category with respect to a weak factorization system .

title: Action groupoid in protomodular categories
abstract: we give here some example of non pointed protomodular category $ \mathbb c$ satisfy a property similar to the property of representation of action which hold for the pointed protomodular category $ gp$ of group : any slice category of $ gp$ , any category of groupoid with a fix set of object , any essentially affine category . this property give rise to an internal construction of the center of any object $ x$ , and consequently to a specific characterization of the abelian object in $ \mathbb c$ .

title: Generalized congruences -- Epimorphisms in Cat
authors: Marek A. Bednarczyk,         Andrzej M. Borzyszkowski,         Wieslaw Pawlowski
abstract: the paper generalize the notion of a congruence on a category and pursue some of its application . in particular , generalized congruence be use to provide a concrete construction of coequalizer in $ { \cal c}at$. extremal , regular and various other class of epimorphic functor be characterize and inter - relate .

title: Aspects of fractional exponent functors
authors: Anders Kock and Gonzalo E. Reyes
abstract: we prove that certain category arise from atom in a Grothendieck topo be themselves Grothendieck topos . we also investigate enrichment of these category over the base topo ; there be in fact often two distinct enrichment .

title: On property-like structures
authors: G. M. Kelly and Stephen Lack
abstract: a category may bear many monoidal structure , but ( to within a unique isomorphism ) only one structure of ` category with finite product ' . to capture such distinction , we consider on a 2 - category those 2 - monad for which algebra structure be essentially unique if it exist , give a precise mathematical definition of ` essentially unique ' and investigate its consequence . we call such 2 - monad property - like . we far consider the more restricted class of fully property - like 2 - monad , consist of those property - like 2 - monad for which all 2 - cell between ( even lax ) algebra morphism be algebra 2 - cell . the consideration of lax morphism lead we to a new characterization of those monad , study by Kock and Zoberlein , for which ` structure be adjoint to unit ' , and which we now call lax - idempotent 2 - monad : both these and their colax - idempotent dual be fully property - like . we end by show that ( at least for finitary 2 - monad ) the class of property - like , fully property - like , and lax - idempotent be each coreflective among all 2 - monad .

title: Monads and interpolads in bicategories
abstract: give a bicategory , 2 , with stable local coequalizer , we construct a bicategory of monad y - mnd by use lax functor from the generic 0 - cell , 1 - cell and 2 - cell , respectively , into Y. any lax functor into Y factor through y - mnd and the 1 - cell turn out to be the familiar bimodule . the locally order bicategory rel and its bicategory of monad both fail to be Cauchy - complete , but have a well - know Cauchy - completion in common . this prompt we to formulate a concept of Cauchy - completeness for bicategorie that be not locally order and suggest a weakening of the notion of monad . for this purpose , we develop a calculus of general module between unstructured endo-1 - cell . these behave well with respect to composition , but in general fail to have identity . to overcome this problem , we do not need to impose the full structure of a monad on endo-1 - cell . we show that associative coequalize multiplication suffice and call the result structure interpolad . together with structure - preserve i - module these form a bicategory y - int that be indeed cauchy - complete , in our sense , and contain the bicategory of monad as a not necessarily full sub - bicategory . interpolad over rel be idempotent relation , over the suspension of set they correspond to interpolative semi - group , and over spn they lead to a notion of ` ` category without identity '' also know as ` ` taxonomy '' . if Y locally have equalizer , then module in general , and the bicategorie y - mnd and Y - int in particular , inherit the property of be close with respect to 1 - cell composition .

title: Closed model categories for $[n,m]$-types
authors: J. Ignacio Extremiana Aldana, Luis J. Hernandez Paricio, Maria T. Rivas Rodriguez
abstract: for m & gt;= n & gt ; 0 , a map f between pointed space be say to be a weak [ n , m]-equivalence if f induce isomorphism of the homotopy group \pi_k for n & lt;= k & lt;= m~. associate with this notion we give two different closed model category structure to the category of pointed space . both structure have the same class of weak equivalence but different class of fibration and therefore of cofibration . use one of these structure , one obtain that the localize category be equivalent to the category of n - reduce cw - complex with dimension less than or equal to m+1 and m - homotopy class of cellular pointed map . use the other structure we see that the localize category be also equivalent to the homotopy category of ( n-1)-connected ( m+1)-coconnecte CW - complex .

title: Crossed squares and 2-crossed modules of commutative algebras
abstract: in this paper , we construct a neat description of the passage from cross square of commutative algebra to 2 - crossed module analogous to that give by Conduche in the group case . we also give an analogue , for commutative algebra , of T. Porter 's simplicial group to n - cube of group which imply an inverse functor to Conduche 's one .

title: Multilinearity of Sketches
abstract: we give a precise characterization for when the model of the tensor product of sketch be structurally isomorphic to the model of either sketch in the model of the other . for each base category K call the just mention property ( sketch ) k - multilinearity . say that two sketch be k - compatible with respect to base category K just in case in each k - model , the limit for each limit specification in each sketch commute with the colimit for each colimit specification in the other sketch and all limit and colimit be pointwise . two sketch be k - multilinear if and only if the two sketch be k - compatible . this property then extend to strong colimit of sketch . we shall use the technically useful property of limited completeness and completeness of every category of model of sketch . that is , category of sketch model have all limit commute with the sketch colimit and and all colimit commute with the sketch limit . often use implicitly , the precise statement of this property and its proof appear here .

title: The reflectiveness of covering morphisms in algebra and geometry
authors: G. Janelidze and G. M. Kelly
abstract: each full reflective subcategory x of a finitely - complete category c give rise to a factorization system ( e , m ) on C , where e consist of the morphism of C invert by the reflexion i : c --&gt ; X. under a simplify assumption which be satisfy in many practical example , a morphism f : a --&gt ; b lie in M precisely when it be the pullback along the unit \etab : b --&gt ; ib of its reflexion if : ia --&gt ; ib ; whereupon f be say to be a trivial covering of B. finally , the morphism f : a --&gt ; b be say to be a covering of B if , for some effective descent morphism p : e --&gt ; b , the pullback p^*f of f along p be a trivial covering of E. this be the absolute notion of covering ; there be also a more general relative one , where some class \theta of morphism of C be give , and the class cov(b ) of covering of B be a subclass -- or rather a subcategory -- of the category c \downarrow b \subset c / b whose object be those f : a --&gt ; b with f in \theta . many question in mathematic can be reduce to ask whether cov(b ) be reflective in c \downarrow b ; and we give a number of disparate condition , each sufficient for this to be so . in this way we recapture old result and establish new one on the reflexion of local homeomorphism into covering , on the Galois theory of commutative ring , and on generalized central extension of universal algebra .

title: Remarks on Quintessential and Persistent Localizations
abstract: we define a localization L of a category e to be quintessential if the left adjoint to the inclusion functor be also right adjoint to it , and persistent if L be close under subobject in E. we show that quintessential localization of an arbitrary Cauchy - complete category correspond to idempotent natural endomorphism of its identity functor , and that they be necessarily persistent . our investigation of persistent localization be largely restrict to the case when E be a topos : we show that persistence be equivalence to the closure of L under finite coproduct and quotient , and that it imply that L be coreflective as well as reflective , at least provide E admit a geometric morphism to a boolean topos . however , we provide example to show that the reflector and coreflector need not coincide .

title: Combinatorics of curvature, and the Bianchi identity
abstract: we analyze the Bianchi Identity as an instance of a basic fact of combinatorial groupoid theory , relate to the Homotopy Addition Lemma . here it becomes formulate in term of 2 - form with value in the gauge group bundle of a groupoid , and lead in particular to the ( Chern - Weil ) construction of characteristic class . the method be that of synthetic differential geometry , use " the first neighbourhood of the diagonal " of a manifold as its basic combinatorial structure . we introduce as a tool a new and simple description of wedge (= exterior ) product of differential form in this context .

title: On finite induced crossed modules and the homotopy 2-type of mapping cones,
authors: Ronald Brown and Christopher D. Wensley
abstract: result on the finiteness of induce cross module be prove both algebraically and topologically . use the Van Kampen type theorem for the fundamental cross module , application be give to the 2 - type of map cone of classify space of group . calculation of the cohomology class of some finite cross module be give , use cross complex method .

title: Symmetric monoidal categories model all connective spectra
abstract: the classical infinite loopspace machine in fact induce an equivalence of category between a localization of the category of symmetric monoidal category and the stable homotopy category of -1 - connective spectra .

title: Kan extensions along promonoidal functors
abstract: strong promonoidal functor be define . left Kan extension ( also call " existential quantification " ) along a strong promonoidal functor be show to be a strong monoidal functor . a construction for the free monoidal category on a promonoidal category be provide . a fourier - like transform of presheave be define and show to take convolution product to cartesian product .

title: On quantic conuclei on orthomodular lattices
authors: Leopoldo Roman and Rita E. Zuazua
abstract: in this paper we study the lattice of quantic conuclei for orthomudular lattice . we show that under certain condition we can get a complete characterization of all quantic conuclei . the thing to note be we use a non commutative , non associative disjunction operation which can be think of as non commutative , non associative linear logic .

title: A Counterexample to a Conjecture of Barr
abstract: we discuss two version of a conjecture attribute to M. Barr . the Harrison cohomology of a commutative algebra be know to coincide with the Andre / Quillen cohomology over a field of characteristic zero but not in prime characteristic . the conjecture be that a modify version of Harrison cohomology , take into account torsion , always agree with Andre / Quillen cohomology . we give a counterexample .

title: On the Size of Categories
abstract: the purpose be to give a simple proof that a category be equivalent to a small category if and only if both it and its presheaf category be locally small .

title: Categorical Data-Specifications
abstract: we introduce md - sketch , which be a particular kind of Finite Sum sketch . two interesting result about md - sketch be prove . first , we show that , give two md - sketch , it be algorithmically decidable whether their model category be equivalent . next we show that data - specification , as use in database - design and software engineering , can be translate to md - sketch . as a corollary , we obtain that equivalence of datum - specification be decidable .

title: Exploring the gap between linear and classical logic
abstract: the medial rule be first devise as a deduction rule in the Calculus of Structures . in this paper we explore it from the point of view of category theory , as additional structure on a * -autonomous category . this give we some insight on the denotational semantic of classical propositional logic , and allow we to construct new model for it , base on suitable generalization of the theory of coherence space .

title: A forbidden-suborder characterization of binarily-composable diagrams in double categories
abstract: tiling of rectangle with rectangle , and tileorder ( the associate double order structure ) be useful as ` ` template '' for composition in double category . in this context , it be particularly relevant to ask which tiling may be join together , two rectangle at a time , to form one large rectangle . we characterize such tiling via forbidden suborder , in a manner analogous to Kuratowski 's characterization of planar graph .

title: Oriented Singular Homology
abstract: we formulate three slightly different notion of orient singular chain complex and show that all three be naturally homotopic to ordinary singular chain complex .

title: Functorial and algebraic properties of Browns P functor
abstract: in 1975 E. M. Brown construct a functor $ \cal p$ which carry the tower of fundamental group of the end of a ( nice ) space to the Brown - Grossman fundamental group . in this work , we study this functor and its extension and analogue define for pro - set , pro - pointed set , pro - group and pro - abelian group . the new version of the $ \cal p$ functor be provide with more algebraic structure . example give in the paper prove that in general the $ \cal p$ functor be not faithful , however , one of our main result establish that the restriction of the correspond $ \cal p$ functor to the full subcategorie of tower be faithful . we also prove that the restriction of the $ \cal p$ functor to the corresponding full subcategorie of finitely generate tower be also full . consequently , in these case , the tower of object in the category of set , pointed set , group and abelian group , can be replace by adequate algebraic model ( $ m$-set , $ m$-pointed set , near - module and module . ) the article also contain the construction of left adjoint for the $ \cal p$ functor .

title: A note on free regular and exact completions and their infinitary generalizations
abstract: free regular and exact completion of category with various rank of weak limit be present as subcategorie of presheaf category . their universal property can then be derive with standard technique as use in duality theory .

title: Distributive Adjoint Strings
authors: R. Rosebrugh and R. J. Wood
abstract: for an adjoint string v -| W -| x -| y : b --&gt ; C , with Y fully faithful , it be frequently , but not always , the case that the composite vy underlie an idempotent monad . when it do , we call the string distributive . we also study short and long ` distributive ' adjoint string and how to generate they . these provide a new construction of the simplicial 2 - category , Delta .

title: Glueing Analysis for Complemented Subtoposes
abstract: we prove how any ( elementary ) topo may be reconstruct from the datum of two complement subtopose together with a pair of left exact ` ` glueing functor '' . this generalize the classical glueing theorem for topos , which deal with the special case of an open subtopos and its closed complement . our glueing analysis apply in a particularly simple form to a locally closed subtopos and its complement , and one of the important property ( prolongation by zero for abelian group ) can be succinctly describe in term of it .

title: An algebraic description of locally multipresentable categories
abstract: locally finitely presentable category be know to be precisely the category of model of essentially algebraic theory , i.e. , category of partial algebra whose domain of definition be determine by equation in total operation . here we show an analogous description of locally finitely multipresentable category . we also prove that locally finitely multipresentable category be precisely category of model of sketch with finite limit and countable coproduct specification , and we present an example of a locally finitely multipresentable category not sketchable by a sketch with finite limit and finite colimit specification .

title: Finiteness of a Non-abelian Tensor Product of Groups
abstract: some sufficient condition for finiteness of a generalized non - abelian tensor product of group be establish extend Ellis ' result for compatible action .

title: The Chu construction
abstract: we take another look at the Chu construction and show how to simplify it by look at it as a module category in a trivial Chu category . this simplify the construction substantially , especially in the case of a non - symmetric biclosed monoidal category . we also show that if the original category be accessible , then for any of a large class of ` ` polynomial - like '' functor , the category of coalgebra have cofree object .

title: Computing crossed modules induced by an inclusion of a normal subgroup,  with applications to homotopy 2-types
authors: Ronald Brown and Christopher D. Wensley
abstract: we obtain some explicit calculation of cross q - module induce from a cross module over a normal subgroup p of q. by virtue of theorem of Brown and Higgins , this enable the computation of the homotopy 2 - type and second homotopy module of certain homotopy pushout of map of classify space of discrete group .

title: Proof theory for full intuitionistic linear logic,  bilinear logic, and MIX categories
abstract: this note apply technique we have develop to study coherence in monoidal category with two tensor , correspond to the tensor - par fragment of linear logic , to several new situation , include Hyland and de Paiva 's Full Intuitionistic Linear Logic ( FILL ) , and Lambek 's Bilinear Logic ( BILL ) . note that the latter be a noncommutative logic ; we also consider the noncommutative version of FILL . the essential difference between FILL and BILL lie in require that a certain tensorial strength be an isomorphism . in any FILL category , it be possible to isolate a full subcategory of object ( the ` ` nucleus '' ) for which this transformation be an isomorphism . in addition , we define and study the appropriate categorical structure underlie the MIX rule . for all these structure , we do not restrict consideration to the ` ` pure '' logic as we allow non - logical axiom . we define the appropriate notion of proof net for these logic , and use they to describe coherence result for the correspond categorical structure .

title: Lax Operad Actions and Coherence for Monoidal  n-Categories, A_{\infty} Rings  and Modules
abstract: we establish a general coherence theorem for lax operad action on an n - category which imply that an n - category with such an action be lax equivalent to one with a strict action . this include familiar coherence result ( e.g. for symmetric monoidal category ) and many new one . in particular , any braid monoidal n - category be lax equivalent to a strict braided monoidal n - category . we also obtain coherence theorem for a_{\infty } and e_{\infty } ring and for lax module over such ring . use these result we give an extension of Morita equivalence to a_{\infty } ring and some application to infinite loop space and algebraic k - theory .

title: Note on a  theorem of Putnam's
abstract: in a 1981 book , H. Putnam claim that in a pure relational language without equality , for any model of a relation that be neither empty nor full , there be another model that satisfy the same first order sentence . Ed Keenan observe that this be false for finite model since equality be a definable predicate in such case . this note show that Putnam 's claim be true for infinite model , although it require a more sophisticated proof than the one outline by Putnam .

title: Doctrines whose structure forms a fully faithful adjoint string

title: Modules

abstract: this paper study lax higher dimensional structure over bicategorie . the general notion of a module between two morphism of bicategorie be describe . these module together with their ( multi-)2 - cell , which we call modulation , organize themselves into a multi - bicategory . the usual notion of a module can be recover from this general notion by simply choose the domain bicategory to be the terminal or final bicategory . the composite of two such module need not exist . however , when the domain bicategory be small and the codomain bicategory be locally cocomplete then the composite of any two module do exist and have a simple construction use the local colimit . these module and their modulation then give rise to a bicategory . recall that neither transformation nor optransformation ( respectively lax natural transformation and oplax natural transformation ) between morphism of bicategorie give rise to a smooth 3 - dimensional structure . however , there be a smooth 3 - dimensional structure for module , and both transformation and optransformation give rise to associate module . furthermore , the modulation between two module associate with transformation can then be describe directly as a new sort of modification between the transformation . this provide a locally full and faithful homomorphism from transformation and modification into the bicategory of module . finally , if each 1 - cell component of a transformation be a left - adjoint then the right - adjoint provide an optransformation . in the module bicategory the module associate with this optransformation be right - adjoint to the module associate with the transformation . therefore the inclusion of transformation whose 1 - cell have left adjoint into the ( multi-)bicategory of module provide a source of proarrow equipment .

title: Partial Toposes
abstract: we introduce various notion of partial topo , i.e. ` topo without terminal object ' . the strong one , call local topo , be motivate by the key example of finite tree and sheaf with compact support . local topos satisfy all the usual exactness property of topos but be neither cartesian closed nor have a subobject classifier . example for the weak notion be local homeomorphism and discrete fibration . finally , for partial topos with support we show how they can be complete to topos via an inverse limit construction .

title: Ring epimorphisms and
authors: Michael Barr, W.D. Burgess and R. Raphael
abstract: this paper study the homomorphism of ring of continuous function $ \rho : c(x)\to c(y)$ , $ y$ a subspace of a Tychonoff space $ x$ , induce by restriction . we ask when $ \rho$ be an epimorphism in the categorical sense . there be several appropriate category : we look at CR , all commutative ring , and r / n , all reduced commutative ring . when $ x$ be first countable and perfectly normal ( e.g. , a metric space ) , $ \rho$ be a CR -epimorphism if and only if it be a r / n - epimorphism if and only if $ y$ be locally close in $ x$. it be also show that the restriction of $ \rho$ to $ c^*(x)\to c^*(y)$ , when $ x$ be normal , be a cr - epimorphism if and only if it be a surjection . in general space the picture be more complicated , as be show by various example . information about $ spec \rho$ and $ spec \rho$ restrict to the proconstructible set of prime z - ideal be give .

title: The branching nerve of HDA and the Kan condition
abstract: one can associate to any strict globular $ \omega$-category three augment simplicial nerve call the globular nerve , the branching and the merge semi - cubical nerve . if this strict globular $ \omega$-category be freely generate by a precubical set , then the correspond homology theory contain different information about the geometry of the higher dimensional automaton model by the precubical set . add inverse in this $ \omega$-category to any morphism of dimension great than 2 and with respect to any composition law of dimension great than 1 do not change these homology theory . in such a framework , the globular nerve always satisfy the Kan condition . on the other hand , both branch and merge nerve never satisfy it , except in some very particular and uninteresting situation . in this paper , we introduce two new nerve ( the branch and merge semi - globular nerve ) satisfy the Kan condition and have conjecturally the same simplicial homology as the branch and merge semi - cubical nerve respectively in such framework . the latter conjecture be relate to the thin element conjecture already introduce in our previous paper .

title: The Wirthmuller isomorphism revisited
abstract: we show how the formal Wirthmuller isomorphism theorem simplify the proof of the Wirthmuller isomorphism in equivariant stable homotopy theory . other example from equivariant stable homotopy theory show that the hypothesis of the formal Wirthmuller and formal Grothendieck isomorphism theorem can not be weaken .

title: Isomorphisms between left and right adjoints
authors: H. Fausk, P. Hu, and J.P. May
abstract: there be many context in algebraic geometry , algebraic topology , and homological algebra where one encounter a functor that have both a left and right adjoint , with the right adjoint be isomorphic to a shift of the left adjoint specify by an appropriate ` dualize object ' . typically the left adjoint be well understand while the right adjoint be more mysterious , and the result identify the right adjoint in familiar term . we give a categorical discussion of such result . one essential point be to differentiate between the classical framework that arise in algebraic geometry and a deceptively similar , but genuinely different , framework that arise in algebraic topology . another be to make clear which part of the proof of such result be formal . the analysis significantly simplify the proof of particular case , as we illustrate in a sequel discuss application to equivariant stable homotopy theory .

title: Morphisms and modules for poly-bicategories
authors: J.R.B. Cockett, J. Koslowski, and  R.A.G. Seely
abstract: linear bicategorie be a generalization of ordinary bicategorie in which there be two horizontal ( 1 - cell ) composition correspond to the ` ` tensor '' and ` ` par '' of linear logic . Benabou 's notion of a morphism ( lax 2 - functor ) of bicategorie may be generalize to linear bicategorie , where they be call linear functor . unfortunately , as for the bicategorical case , it be not obvious how to organize linear functor smoothly into a higher dimensional structure . not only do linear functor seem to lack the two composition expect for a linear bicategory but , even worse , they inherit from the bicategorical level the failure to combine well with the obvious notion of transformation . as we shall see , there be also problem with lift the notion of lax transformation to the linear setting . one possible resolution be to step up one dimension , take morphism as the 0 - cell level . in the linear setting , this suggest make linear functor 0 - cell , but what structure should sit above they ? lax transformation in a suitable sense just do not seem to work very well for this purpose ( section \ref{s : linnattran } ) . module provide a more promising direction , but raise a number of technical issue concern the composability of both the module and their transformation . in general the require composite will not exist in either the linear bicategorical or ordinary bicategorical setting . however , when these composite do exist module between linear functor do combine to form a linear bicategory . in order to well understand the condition for the existence of composite , we have find it convenient , particularly in the linear setting , to develop the theory of ` ` poly - bicategorie '' . in this setting we can develop the theory so as to extract the answer to these problem not only for linear bicategorie but also for ordinary bicategorie . Poly - bicategorie be 2 - dimensional generalization of Szabo 's poly - category , consist of object , 1 - cell , and poly-2 - cell . the latter may have several 1 - cell as input and as output and can be compose by mean of cut along a single 1 - cell . while a poly - bicategory do not require that there be any composition for the 1 - cell , such composite be determine ( up to 1 - cell isomorphism ) by their universal property . we say a poly - bicategory be representable when there be a represent 1 - cell for each of the two possible 1 - cell composition gear towards the domain and codomain of the poly 2 - cell . in this case we recover the notion of a linear bicategory . the poly notion of functor , module and their transformation be introduce as well . the poly - functor between two give poly - bicategorie p and P ' together with poly - module between poly - functor and their transformation form a new poly - bicategory provide P be representable and closed in the sense that every 1 - cell have both a left and a right adjoint ( in the appropriate linear sense ) . finally we revisit the notion of linear ( or lax ) natural transformation , which can only be define for representable poly - bicategorie . these in fact correspond to module have special property .

title: Categorical models and quasigroup homotopies
abstract: in many application of quasigroup isotopie and homotopie be more important than isomorphism and homomorphism . in this paper , the way homotopie may arise in the context of categorical quasigroup model theory be investigate . in this context , the algebraic structure be specify by diagram - base logic , such as sketch , and category of model become functor category . an idea , pioneer by Gvaramiya and Plotkin , be use to give a construction of a model category naturally equivalent to the category of quasigroup with homotopie between they .

title: Higher-dimensional algebra V: 2-Groups
authors: John C. Baez and Aaron D. Lauda
abstract: a 2 - group be a ` categorifie ' version of a group , in which the underlie set g have be replace by a category and the multiplication map m ; g x g -&gt ; G have be replace by a functor . various version of this notion have already be explore ; our goal here be to provide a detailed introduction to two , which we call ` weak ' and ` coherent ' 2 - group . a weak 2 - group be a weak monoidal category in which every morphism have an inverse and every object x have a ` weak inverse ' : an object y such that x \tensor y \iso 1 \iso y \tensor x. a coherent 2 - group be a weak 2 - group in which every object x be equip with a specify weak inverse x ' and isomorphism i_x : 1 -&gt ; x \tensor x ' , e_x : x ' \tensor x -&gt ; 1 form an adjunction . we describe 2 - category of weak and coherent 2 - group and an ` improvement ' 2 - functor that turn weak 2 - group into coherent one , and prove that this 2 - functor be a 2 - equivalence of 2 - category . we internalize the concept of coherent 2 - group , which give a quick way to define Lie 2 - group . we give a tour of example , include the ` fundamental 2 - group ' of a space and various Lie 2 - group . we also explain how coherent 2 - group can be classify in term of 3rd cohomology class in group cohomology . finally , use this classification , we construct for any connect and simply - connect compact simple Lie group g a family of 2 - group g_h ( h in Z ) have g as its group of object and u(1 ) as the group of automorphism of its identity object . these 2 - group be build use Chern - Simons theory , and be closely relate to the Lie 2 - algebras g_h ( h in R ) describe in a companion paper .

title: Higher-Dimensional Algebra VI: Lie 2-Algebras
authors: John C. Baez and Alissa S. Crans
abstract: the theory of Lie algebra can be categorifie start from a new notion of ` 2 - vector space ' , which we define as an internal category in Vect . there be a 2 - category 2Vect have these 2 - vector space as object , ` linear functor ' as morphism and ` linear natural transformation ' as 2 - morphism . we define a ` semistrict Lie 2 - algebra ' to be a 2 - vector space l equip with a skew - symmetric bilinear functor [ . , . ] : l x l -&gt ; l satisfy the Jacobi identity up to a completely antisymmetric trilinear natural transformation call the ` jacobiator ' , which in turn must satisfy a certain law of its own . this law be closely related to the Zamolodchikov tetrahedron equation , and indeed we prove that any semistrict Lie 2 - algebra give a solution of this equation , just as any Lie algebra give a solution of the Yang -- Baxter equation . we construct a 2 - category of semistrict Lie 2 - algebra and prove that it be 2 - equivalent to the 2 - category of 2 - term l_\infty - algebra in the sense of Stasheff . we also study strict and skeletal Lie 2 - algebra , obtain the former from strict Lie 2 - group and use the latter to classify Lie 2 - algebra in term of 3rd cohomology class in Lie algebra cohomology . this classification allow we to construct for any finite - dimensional Lie algebra g a canonical 1 - parameter family of Lie 2 - algebra g_h which reduce to g at h = 0 . these be closely related to the 2 - group g_h construct in a companion paper .

title: The double powerlocale and exponentiation: A case study in geometric logic
abstract: if X be a locale , then its double powerlocale px be define to be pu(pl(x ) ) where PU and PL be the upper and low powerlocale construction . we prove various result relate it to exponentiation of locale , include the follow . first , if X be a locale for which the exponential s^x exist ( where s be the Sierpinski locale ) , then PX be an exponential s^(s^x ) . second , if in addition W be a locale for which PW be homeomorphic to s^x , then X be an exponential s^w. the work use geometric reasoning , i.e. reasoning stable under pullback along geometric morphism , and this enable the locale to be discuss in term of their point as though they be space . it rely on a number of geometricity result include those for locale presentation and for powerlocale .

Adamek and Sousa 's result follow from ours . we also prove that $ \lambda$-presentable morphism be precisely the pushout of morphism between $ \lambda$-presentable object of C.

Gerstenhaber introduce a list of axiom define Moore category in order to develop the Baer Extension Theory . in this paper , we study some implication between the axiom and compare they with more recent notion , show that , apart from size restriction , a Moore category be a pointed , strongly protomodular and Barr - exact category with cokernel .

title: Notions of flatness relative to a Grothendieck topology
abstract: completion of ( small ) category under certain kind of colimit and exactness condition have be study extensively in the literature . when the category that we complete be not leave exact but have some weak kind of limit for finite diagram , the universal property of the completion be usually state with respect to functor that enjoy a property reminiscent of flatness . in this fashion notion like that of a left covering or a multilimit merge functor have appear in the literature . we show here that such notion coincide with flatness when the latter be interpret relative to ( the internal logic of ) a site structure associate to the target category . we exploit this in order to show that the left Kan extension of such functor , along the inclusion of their domain into its completion , be leave exact . this give in a very economical and uniform manner the universal property of such completion . our result rely heavily on some unpublished work of A. Kock from 1989 . we far apply this to give a pretopos completion process for small category have a weak finite limit property .

title: Operads in higher-dimensional category theory

title: Baer invariants in semi-abelian categories II: Homology

title: Internal monotone-light factorization for categories via preorders

title: Split structures
abstract: in the early 1990 ' the author prove that the full subcategory of ` sup - lattice ' determine by the constructively completely distributive ( CCD ) lattice be equivalent to the idempotent splitting completion of the bicategory of set and relation . have many corollary , this be an extremely useful result . moreover , as the author soon suspect , it specialize a much more general result . let D be a monad on a category c in which idempotent split . write kar(c_d ) for the idempotent splitting completion of the Kleisli category . write spl(c^d ) for the category whose object be pair ( ( l , s),t ) , where ( l , s ) be an object of the Eilenberg - Moore category for D , and t be a homomorphism that split s , with spl(c^d)(((l , s),t),((l',s'),t'))=c^d((l , s)(l',s ' ) ) . the main result be that kar(c_d ) be isomorphic to spl(c^d ) . we also show how this imply the ccd lattice characterization theorem and consider a more general context .

title: Birkhoff's variety theorem with and without free algebras
abstract: for large signature $ \sigma$ we prove that Birkhoff 's Variety Theorem hold ( i.e. , equationally presentable collection of $ \sigma$-algebra be precisely those close under limit , subalgebra , and quotient algebra ) iff the universe of small set be not measurable . under that limitation Birkhoff 's Variety Theorem hold in fact for $ f$-algebra of an arbitrary endofunctor $ f$ of the category Class of class and function . for endofunctor $ F$ of Set , the category of small set , Jan Reiterman prove that if $ f$ be a varietor ( i.e. , if free $ f$-algebra exist ) then Birkhoff 's Variety Theorem hold for $ f$-algebra . we prove the converse , whenever $ f$ preserve preimage : if $ f$is not a varietor , Birkhoff 's Variety Theorem do not hold . however , we also present a non - varietor satisfy Birkhoff 's Variety Theorem . our most surprising example be two varietor whose coproduct do not satisfy Birkhoff 's Variety Theorem .

title: Notes on enriched categories with colimits of some class
abstract: the paper be in essence a survey of category have $ \phi$-weighted colimit for all the weight $ \phi$ in some class $ \phi$. we introduce the class $ \phi^+$ of $ \phi$-flat weight which be those $ \psi$ for which $ \psi$-colimit commute in the base $ \cal v$ with limit have weight in $ \phi$ ; and the class $ \phi^-$ of $ \phi$-atomic weight , which be those $ \psi$ for which $ \psi$-limits commute in the base $ \cal v$ with colimit have weight in $ \phi$. we show that both these class be saturate ( that be , what be call closed in the terminology of Albert and Kelly ) . we prove that for the class $ \cal p$ of all weight , the class $ \cal p^+$ and $ \cal p^-$ both coincide with the class $ \q$ of absolute weight . for any class $ \phi$ and any category $ \cal a$ , we have the free $ \phi$-cocompletion $ \phi(\cal a)$ of $ \cal a$ ; and we recognize $ \cal q(\cal a)$ as the Cauchy - completion of $ \cal a$ . we study the equivalence between $ { ( \cal q(\cal a^{op}))}^{op}$ and $ \cal q(\cal a)$ , which we exhibit as the restriction of the Isbell adjunction between $ { [ \cal a,\cal v]}^{op}$ and $ [ \cal a^{op},\cal v]$ when $ \cal a$ be small ; and we give a new Morita theorem for any class $ \phi$ contain $ \cal q$. we end with the study of $ \phi$-continuous weight and their relation to the $ \phi$-flat weight .

title: Enlargements of categories
abstract: in order to apply nonstandard method to modern algebraic geometry , as a first step in this paper we study the application of nonstandard construction to category theory . it turn out that many categorical property be well behave under enlargement .

title: Localic completion of generalized metric spaces I
abstract: follow Lawvere , a generalized metric space ( gm ) be a set $ X$ equip with a metric map from $ x^{2}$ to the interval of upper real ( approximate from above but not from below ) from 0 to $ \infty$ inclusive , and satisfy the zero self - distance law and the triangle inequality . we describe a completion of gm 's by Cauchy filter of formal ball . in term of Lawvere 's approach use category enrich over $ [ 0,\infty]$ , the Cauchy filter be equivalent to flat left module . the completion generalize the usual one for metric space . for quasimetric it be equivalent to the Yoneda completion in its netwise form due to Kunzi and Schellekens and thereby give a new and explicit characterization of the point of the Yoneda completion . non - expansive function between gm 's lift to continuous map between the completion . various example and construction be give , include finite product . the completion be easily adapt to produce a locale , and that part of the work be constructively valid . the exposition illustrate the use of geometric logic to enable point - base reasoning for locale .

title: Classification of concrete geometrical categories
abstract: a precise concept of concrete geometrical category be introduce in an axiomatic way . to any algebra l for an many - sorted infinitary algebraic theory t be associate a concrete geometrical category Geo(L ) , the so - call classify concrete geometrical category of L , satisfy a universal property . the terminology " geometrical " be justify firstly for Geo(L ) and secondly for any concrete geometrical category by prove that they be all classify one . the legitimate category CGC of concrete geometrical category be build up and prove to be the dual of the legitimate category TGC of topological geometrical category .

title: Every group is representable by all natural transformations of some  set-functor
abstract: for every group G , we construct a functor f : set --&gt ; set ( finitary for a finite group G ) such that the monoid of all natural endotransformation of F be a group isomorphic to G.

title: On the representability of actions in a semi-abelian category
authors: F. Borceux, G. Janelidze and G.M. Kelly
abstract: we consider a semi - abelian category v and we write Act(G , x ) for the set of action of the object g on the object x , in the sense of the theory of semi - direct product in V. we investigate the representability of the functor act(-,x ) in the case where v be locally presentable , with finite limit commute with filter colimit . this contain all category of model of a semi - abelian theory in a Grothendieck topos , thus in particular all semi - abelian variety of universal algebra . for such category , we prove first that the representability of act(-,x ) reduce to the preservation of binary coproduct . next we give both a very simple necessary condition and a very simple sufficient condition , in term of amalgamation property , for the preservation of binary coproduct by the functor Act(-,X ) in a general semi - abelian category . finally , we exhibit the precise form of the more involved ` ` if and only if '' amalgamation property correspond to the representability of action : this condition be in particular relate to a new notion of ` ` normalization of a morphism '' . we provide also a wide supply of algebraic example and counter - example , give in particular evidence of the relevance of the object represent Act(-,X ) , when it turn out to exist .

title: Groupoid enriched categories and natural systems
abstract: we generalize the Baues - Jibladze descent theorem to a large class of groupoid enrich category .

title: Canonical and op-canonical lax algebras
abstract: the definition of a category of ( t , v)-algebra , where v be a unital commutative quantale and t be a set - monad , require the existence of a certain lax extension of T. in this article , we present a general construction of such an extension . this lead to the formation of two category of ( t , v)-algebra : the category alg(t , v ) of canonical ( t , v)-algebra , and the category alg(t',v ) of op - canonical ( t , v)-algebra . the usual topological - like example of category of ( t , v)-algebra ( preordered set , topological , metric and approach space ) be obtain in this way , and the category of closure space appear as a category of canonical ( p , v)-algebra , where P be the powerset monad . this unified presentation allow we to study how these category be relate , and it be show that under suitable hypothesis both alg(t , v ) and alg(t',v ) embed coreflectively into alg(p , v ) .

title: A homotopy double groupoid of a Hausdorff space II:  a van Kampen theorem
authors: R. Brown, K.H. Kamps, and T. Porter
abstract: this paper be the second in a series explore the property of a functor which assign a homotopy double groupoid with connection to a Hausdorff space . we show that this functor satisfy a version of the van Kampen theorem , and so be a suitable tool for nonabelian , 2 - dimensional , local - to - global problem . the method be analogous to those develop by Brown and Higgins for similar theorem for other high homotopy groupoid . an integral part of the proof be a detailed discussion of commutative cube in a double category with connection , and a proof of the key result that any composition of commutative cube be commutative . these result have recently be generalise to all dimension by Philip Higgins .

title: Introduction to coalgebra
abstract: a survey of part of General Coalgebra be present with application to the theory of system . stress be lay on terminal coalgebra and coinduction as well as iterative algebra and iterative theory .

title: A monadic approach to polycategories
abstract: in the quest for an elegant formulation of the notion of ` ` polycategory '' we develop a more symmetric counterpart to Burroni 's notion of ` ` t- category '' , where t be a cartesian monad on a category x with pullback . our approach involve two such monad , s and t , that be link by a suitable generalization of a distributive law in the sense of Beck . this take the form of a span omega : ts st in the functor category [ x , x ] and guarantee essential associativity for a canonical pullback - induce composition of s - t - span over x , identify they as the 1 - cell of a bicategory , whose ( internal ) monoid then qualify as ` ` omega - category '' . in case that s and t both be the free monoid monad on set , we construct an omega utilize an apparently new classical distributive law link the free semigroup monad with itself . our construction then give rise to so - call ` ` planar polycategorie '' , which nowadays seem to be of more intrinsic interest than Szabo 's original polycategorie . weakly cartesian monad on X may be accommodate as well by first quotiente the bicategory of X - span .

title: Abstract physical traces
abstract: we revise our ` physical trace ' paper in the light of the result in [ Abramsky and Coecke LiCS`04 ] . the key fact be that the notion of a strongly compact closed category allow abstract notion of adjoint , bipartite projector and inner product to be define , and their key property to be prove . in this paper we improve on the definition of strong compact closure as compare to the one present in [ Abramsky and Coecke LiCS`04 ] . this modification enable an elegant characterization of strong compact closure in term of adjoint and a Yanking axiom , and a well treatment of bipartite projector .

title: Universal properties of Span
authors: R.J.MacG. Dawson, R. Pare and D.A. Pronk
abstract: we give two related universal property of the span construction . the first involve sinister morphism out of the base category and sinister transformation . the second involve oplax morphism out of the bicategory of span have an extra property ; we call these ` jointed ' oplax morphism .

title: Thin elements and commutative shells  in cubical omega-categories
abstract: the relationship between thin element , commutative shell and connection in cubical omega - category be explore by a method which do not involve the use of pasting theory or nerve of omega - category ( both of which be previously need for this purpose ; see Al - Agl , Brown and Steiner , section 9 ) . it be show that composite of commutative shell be commutative and that thin structure be equivalent to appropriate set of connection ; this work extend to all dimension the result prove in dimension 2 and 3 in Brown , Kamps and Porter and Brown and Mosa .

title: Adjunction models for call-by-push-value with stacks
abstract: call - by - push - value be a " semantic machine code " , provide a set of simple primitive from which both the call - by - value and call - by - name paradigm be build . we present its operational semantic as a stack machine , suggest a term judgement of stack . we then see that CBPV , incorporate these stack term , have a simple categorical semantic base on an adjunction between value and stack . there be no coherence requirement . we describe this semantic incrementally . first , we introduce locally index category and the opGrothendieck construction , and use these to give the basic structure for interpret the three judgement : value , stack and computation . then we look at the universal property require to interpret each type constructor . we define a model to be a strong adjunction with countable coproduct , countable product and exponential . we see a wide range of instance of this structure : we give example for divergence , storage , erratic choice , continuation , possible world and game ( with or without a bracketing condition ) , in each case resolve the strong monad from the literature into a strong adjunction . and we give way of construct model from other model . finally , we see that call - by - value and call - by - name be interpret within the Kleisli and co - Kleisli part , respectively , of a call - by - push - value adjunction .

title: Absolute homology
abstract: call two map , f , g from C to c ' , of chain complex absolutely homologous if for any additive functor f , the induce ff and fg be homologous ( induce the same map on homology ) . it be know that the identity be absolutely homologous to 0 iff it be homotopic to 0 and tempting to conjecture that f and g be absolutely homologous iff they be homotopic . this conjecture be false , but there be an equational characterization of absolute homology . I also characterize left absolute and right absolute ( in which f be quantify over left or right exact functor ) .

title: Categorical structures enriched in a quantaloid: categories, distributors and functors
abstract: we thoroughly treat several familiar and less familiar definition and result concern category , functor and distributor enrich in a base quantaloid Q. in analogy with v - category theory we discuss such thing as adjoint functor , ( pointwise ) left Kan extension , weight ( co)limit , presheave and free ( co)completion , Cauchy completion and Morita equivalence . with an appendix on the universality of the quantaloid Dist(Q ) of Q - enrich category and distributor .

title: A Galois theory with stable units for simplicial sets
abstract: we recall and reformulate certain know construction , in order to make a convenient setting for obtain generalized monotone - light factorization in the sense of A. Carboni , G. Janelidze , G. M. Kelly and R. Paré . this setting be use to study the existence of monotone - light factorization both in category of simplicial object and in category of internal category . it be show that there be a non - trivial monotone - light factorization for simplicial set , such that the monotone - light factorization for reflexive graph via reflexive relation be a special case of it , obtain by truncation . more generally , we will show that there exist a monotone - light factorization associate with every full subcategory mono(f_n ) , n & gt;= 0 , consist of all simplicial set whose unit morphism be monic for the localization $ f_n:\mathbf{set}^{\delta^{op}}\rightarrow\mathbf{set}^{\delta^{op}_n}$ , which truncate each simplicial set after the object of n - simplice . the monotone - light factorization for category via preorder be as well derive from the propose setting . we also show that , for regular Mal'cev category , the reflection of internal groupoid into internal equivalence relation necessarily produce monotone - light factorization . it turn out that all these reflection do have stable unit , in the sense of C. Cassidy , M. Hébert and G. M. Kelly , give rise to Galois theory .

title: On essential ring embeddings and the epimorphic hull of C(X)
abstract: Storrer introduce the epimorphic hull of a commutative semiprime ring r and show that it be ( up to isomorphism ) the unique essential epic von Neumann regular extension of R. in the case when r = c(x ) with x a Tychonoff space , we show that the embedding induce by a dense subspace of X be always essential . this simplify the search for space whose epimorphic hull be a full ring of continuous function , and allow we to obtain new example where this occur . the main theorem come close to a characterisation of this phenomenon .

title: Generic commutative separable algebras and cospans of graphs
authors: R. Rosebrugh, N. Sabadini and R.F.C. Walters
abstract: we show that the generic symmetric monoidal category with a commutative separable algebra which have a $ \sigma$-family of action be the category of cospan of finite $ \sigma$-labelle graph restrict to finite set as object , thus provide a syntax for automaton on the alphabet $ \sigma$. we use this result to produce semantic functor for $ \sigma$-automata .

title: The shape of a category up to directed homotopy
abstract: this work be a contribution to a recent field , Directed Algebraic Topology . category which appear as fundamental category of ` direct structure ' , e.g. ordered topological space , have to be study up to appropriate notion of direct homotopy equivalence , which be more general than ordinary equivalence of category . here we introduce past and future equivalence of category - sort of symmetric version of an adjunction - and use they and their combination to get ` direct model ' of a category ; in the simple case , these be the join of the least full reflective and the least full coreflective subcategory .

title: Algebraic models of intuitionistic theories of sets and classes
abstract: this paper construct model of intuitionistic set theory in suitable category . first , a Basic Intuitionistic Set Theory ( BIST ) be state , and the categorical semantic be give . second , we give a notion of an ideal over a category , use which one can build a model of BIST in which a give topos occur as the set . and third , a sheaf model be give of a Basic Intuitionistic Class Theory conservatively extend BIST . the paper extend the result in Awodey , Butz , Simpson and Streicher ( 2003 ) by introduce a new and perhaps more natural notion of ideal , and in the class theory of part three .

title: Model structures for homotopy of internal categories
authors: T. Everaert, R.W. Kieboom and T. Van der Linden
abstract: the aim of this paper be to describe Quillen model category structure on the category CatC of internal category and functor in a give finitely complete category C. several non - equivalent notion of internal equivalence exist ; to capture these notion , the model structure be define relative to a give Grothendieck topology on C. under mild condition on C , the regular epimorphism topology determine a model structure where we be the class of weak equivalence of internal category ( in the sense of Bunge and Pare ) . for a Grothendieck topos C we get a structure that , though different from Joyal and Tierney 's , have an equivalent homotopy category . in case C be semi - abelian , these weak equivalence turn out to be homology isomorphism , and the model structure on CatC induce a notion of homotopy of internal cross module . in case C be the category gp of group and homomorphism , it reduce to the case of cross module of group . the trivial topology on a category C determine a model structure on CatC where we be the class of strong equivalence ( homotopy equivalence ) , fib the class of internal functor with the homotopy lifting property , and cof the class of functor with the homotopy extension property . as a special case , the ` ` folk '' Quillen model category structure on the category Cat = CatSet of small category be recover .

title: Reflective Kleisli subcategories of the category of Eilenberg-Moore algebras for factorization monads
abstract: it be well know that for any monad , the associate Kleisli category be embed in the category of Eilenberg - Moore algebra as the free one . we discover some interesting example in which this embedding be reflective ; that be , it have a left adjoint . to understand this phenomenon we introduce and study a class of monad arise from factorization system , and thereby term factorization monad . for they we show that under some simple condition on the factorization system the free algebra be a full reflective subcategory of the algebra . we provide various example of this situation of a combinatorial nature .

title: Generating families in a topos
abstract: a generating family , in a category c be a collection of object $ \{a_i|i\in i\}$ such that if for any subobject y & gt;--&gt ; x , every $ f : a_i \rightarrow x$ factor through m , then m be an isomorphism - i.e. the functor $ c(a_i , - ) $ be collectively conservative . in this paper , we examine some circumstance under which subobject of 1 form a generating family . object for which subobject of 1 do form a generating family be call partially well - point . for a Grothendieck topos , it be well know that subobject of 1 form a generating family if and only if the topos be localic . for the elementary case , little more be know . the problem be study by Borceux , where it be show that the result be internally true , an equivalent condition be find in the boolean case , and certain preservation property be show . we look at two different approach to the problem , one base on a generalization of projectivity , and the other base on look at the most extreme sort of counterexample .

title: Predicative algebraic set theory
authors: Steve Awodey and Michael A. Warren
abstract: in this paper the machinery and result develop in [ Awodey et al . , 2004 ] be extend to the study of constructive set theory . specifically , we introduce two constructive set theory bcst and cst and prove that they be sound and complete with respect to model in category with certain structure . specifically , basic category of class and category of class be axiomatize and show to provide model of the aforementioned set theory . finally , model of these theory be construct in the category of ideal .

title: Copower objects and their applications to finiteness in topoi
abstract: in this paper , we examine a new approach to topos theory - rather than consider subobject , look at quotient . this lead to the notion of a copower object , which be the object of quotient of a give object . we study some property of copower object , many of which be similar to the property of power object . give enough categorical structure ( i.e. in a pretopos ) it be possible to get power object from copower object , and vice versa . we then examine some new definition of finiteness arise from the notion of a copower object . we will see that the most naturally occurring such notion be equivalent to the standard notion , k - finiteness ( at least for well - point object ) and $ \tilde{k}$-finiteness , but that this new way of look at they give new information , and in fact give rise to another notion of finiteness , which be relate to the classical notion of an amorphous set - i.e. an infinite set that be not the disjoint union of two infinite set . finally , we look briefly at two similar notion : potency object and per object .

title: Categorified algebra and quantum mechanics
abstract: the process some call ` categorification ' consist of interpret set - theoretic structure in mathematic as derive from category - theoretic structure . example include the interpretation of N as the Burnside rig of the category of finite set with product and coproduct , and of n[x ] in term the category of combinatorial specie . this have interesting application to quantum mechanic , and in particular the quantum harmonic oscillator , via Joyal 's ` combinatorial specie ' , and a new generalization call ` stuff type ' describe by Baez and Dolan , which be a special case of Kelly 's ` club ' . operator between stuff type be represent as rudimentary Feynman diagram for the oscillator . in quantum mechanic , we want to represent state in an algebra over the complex number , and also want our Feynman diagram to carry more structure than these ` stuff operator ' can do , and these turn out to be closely relate . we will describe a categorification of the quantum harmonic oscillator in which the group of ` phase ' - that be , u(1 ) , the circle group - play a special role . we describe a general notion of ` m - stuff type ' for any monoid M , and see that the case m = u(1 ) provide an interpretation of time evolution in the combinatorial setting , as well as recover the usual Feynman rule for the quantum harmonic oscillator .

title: Pullback and finite coproduct preserving functors between categories of permutation representations
abstract: motivate by application to Mackey functor , Serge Bouc characterize pullback and finite coproduct preserve functor between category of permutation representation of finite group . initially surprise to a category theorist , this result do have a categorical explanation which we provide .

title: A cohomological description of connections and curvature over posets
authors: John E. Roberts and  Giuseppe Ruzzi
abstract: what remain of a geometrical notion like that of a principal bundle when the base space be not a manifold but a coarse graining of it , like the poset form by a base for the topology order under inclusion ? motivate by the search for a geometrical framework for develop gauge theory in algebraic quantum field theory , we give , in the present paper , a first answer to this question . the notion of transition function , connection form and curvature form find a nice description in term of cohomology , in general non - abelian , of a poset with value in a group g. interpret a 1 - cocycle as a principal bundle , a connection turn out to be a 1 - cochain associate in a suitable way with this 1 - cocycle ; the curvature of a connection turn out to be its 2 - coboundary . we show the existence of nonflat connection , and relate flat connection to homomorphism of the fundamental group of the poset into G. we discuss holonomy and prove an analogue of the Ambrose - Singer theorem .

title: Categories of components and loop-free categories
