abstract: give a groupoid g one have , in addition to the equivalence of category e from g to its skeleton , a fibration f from g to its set of connect component ( see as a discrete category ) . from the observation that E and F differ unless g[x , x]=id_x for every object x of G , we prove there be a fibere equivalence from c[\sigma^{-1 } ] to c/\sigma when \Sigma be a Yoneda - system of a loop - free category C. in fact , all the equivalence from c[\sigma^{-1}]$ to c/\sigma be fibere . furthermore , since the quotient c/\sigma shrink as \Sigma grow , we define the component category of a loop - free category as c/{\overline{\sigma } } where \overline{\sigma } be the great yoneda - system of C.

title: Quotient models of a category up to directed homotopy
abstract: directed Algebraic Topology be a recent field , deeply link with ordinary and higher dimensional Category Theory . a ` direct space ' , e.g. an ordered topological space , have direct homotopie ( which be generally non reversible ) and a fundamental category ( replace the fundamental groupoid of the classical case ) . find a simple - possibly finite - model of the latter be a non - trivial problem , whose solution give relevant information on the give ` space ' ; a problem which be of interest for application as well as in general Category Theory . here we continue the work ` ` the shape of a category up to direct homotopy " , with a deep analysis of ` surjective model ' , motivate by study the singularity of 3 - dimensional order space .

title: Topological *-autonomous categories
abstract: give an additive equational category with a closed symmetric monoidal structure and a potential dualize object , we find sufficient condition that the category of topological object over that category have a good notion of full subcategorie of strong and weakly topologized object and show that each be equivalent to the chu category of the original category with respect to the dualize object .

title: Descent for Monads
authors: Pieter Hofstra and Federico De Marchi
abstract: motivate by a desire to gain a well understanding of the ` ` dimension - by - dimension '' decomposition of certain prominent monad in high category theory , we investigate descent theory for endofunctor and monad . after set up a basic framework of index monoidal category , we describe a suitable subcategory of Cat over which we can view the assignment C |-&gt ; Mnd(C ) as an index category ; on this base category , there be a natural topology . then we single out a class of monad which be well - behave with respect to reindexing . the main result be now , that such monad form a stack . use this , we can shed some light on the free strict $ \omega$-category monad on globular set and the free operad - with - contraction monad on the category of collection .

title: Equivalence of 2D-multitopic category and ana-bicategory
abstract: in this paper equivalence of the concept of ana - bicategory and the 2d - multitopic category be prove . the equivalence be FOLDS equivalence of the FOLDS - Specifications of the two concept . two construction for transform one form of category to another be give and it be show that we get a structure equivalent to the original one when we compose the two construction .

title: On categorical crossed modules
authors: P. Carrasco, A.R. Garzon and E.M. Vitale
abstract: the well - know notion of cross module of group be raise in this paper to the categorical level support by the theory of categorical group . we construct the cokernel of a categorical cross module and we establish the universal property of this categorical group . we also prove a suitable 2 - dimensional version of the kernel - cokernel lemma for a diagram of categorical cross module . we then study derivation with coefficient in categorical cross module and show the existence of a categorical cross module give by inner derivation . this allow we to define the low - dimensional cohomology categorical group and , finally , these invariant be connect by a six - term 2 - exact sequence obtain by use the kernel - cokernel lemma .

title: Compactifications, C(X) and ring epimorphisms
abstract: give a topological space $ x$ , $ k(x)$ denote the upper semi - lattice of its ( Hausdorff ) compactification . recent study have ask when , for $ \alpha x \in k(x)$ , the restriction homomorphism $ \rho : c(\alpha x ) \to c(x)$ be an epimorphism in the category of commutative ring . this article continue this study by examine the sub - semilattice , $ k_{epi}(x)$ , of those compactification where $ \rho$ be an epimorphism along with two of its subset , and its complement $ k_{nepi}(x)$. the role of $ k_z(x)\subseteq k(x)$ of those $ \alpha X$ where $ x$ be $ z$-embedde in $ \alpha x$ , be also examine . the case where $ x$ be a $ p$-space and , more particularly , where $ x$ be discrete , receive special attention .

title: Numerology in topoi
abstract: this paper study numeral , natural number object and , more generally , free action , in a topos . a pre - numeral be a poset with a constant , 0 , and a unary operation , s , such that : x\leq y imply sx \leq sy x\leq sx a numeral be a minimal pre - numeral .

title: Categorical representations of categorical groups
authors: John W. Barrett and Marco Mackaay
abstract: a representation theory for ( strict ) categorical group be construct . each categorical group determine a monoidal bicategory of representation . typically , these bicategorie contain representation which be indecomposable but not irreducible . a simple example be compute in explicit detail .

title: Paths in  double categories
authors: R. J. MacG. Dawson, R. Paré, and D. A. Pronk
abstract: two construction of path in double category be study , provide algebraic version of the homotopy groupoid of a space . universal property of these construction be present . the first be see as the codomain of the universal oplax morphism of double category and the second , which be a quotient of the first , give the universal normal oplax morphism . normality force an equivalence relation on cell , a special case of which be see before in the free adjoint construction . these construction be the object part of 2 - comonad which be show to be oplax idempotent . the coalgebra for these comonad turn out to be Leinster 's fc - multicategorie , with representable identity in the second case .

title: Spectra of finitely generated Boolean flows
abstract: a flow on a compact Hausdorff space x be give by a map t : x --&gt ; X. the general goal of this paper be to find the " cyclic part " of such a flow . to do this , we approximate ( x , t ) by a flow on a Stone space ( that be , a totally disconnected , compact Hausdorff space ) . such a flow can be examine by analyze the result flow on the boolean algebra of clopen subset , use the spectrum define in our previous TAC paper , the cyclic spectrum of a boolean flow . in this paper , we describe the cyclic spectrum in term that do not rely on topos theory . we then compute the cyclic spectrum of any finitely generate boolean flow . we define when a sheaf of boolean flow can be regard as cyclic and find necessary condition for represent a boolean flow use the global section of such a sheaf . in the final section , we define and explore a related spectrum base on minimal subflow of Stone space .

title: TFT Construction of RCFT correlators
authors: Jens Fjelstad, Jurgen Fuchs, Ingo Runkel and Christoph Schweigert
abstract: the correlator of two - dimensional rational conformal field theory that be obtain in the TFT construction of Fuchs , Runkel and Schweigert be show to be invariant under the action of the relative modular group and to obey bulk and boundary factorisation constraint . we present result both for conformal field theory define on orient surface and for theory define on unoriented surface . in the latter case , in particular the so - call cross cap constraint be include .

title: Stable meet semilattice fibrations and free restriction categories
abstract: the construction of a free restriction category can be break into two step : the construction of a free stable semilattice fibration follow by the construction of a free restriction category for this fibration . restriction category produce from such fibration be ` unitary ' , in a sense which generalize that from the theory of inverse semigroup . characterization theorem for unitary restriction category be derive . the paper end with an explicit description of the free restriction category on a direct graph .

title: Categorical structures enriched in a quantaloid: tensored and cotensored categories
abstract: a quantaloid be a sup - lattice - enrich category ; our subject be that of category , functor and distributor enrich in a base quantaloid $ \mathcal{q}$. we show how cocomplete $ \mathcal{q}$-categories be precisely those which be tensored and conically cocomplete , or alternatively , those which be tensored , cotensored and ` order - cocomplete ' . in fact , tensor and cotensor in a $ \mathcal{q}$-category determine , and be determine by , certain adjunction in the category of $ \mathcal{q}$-categories ; some of these adjunction can be reduce to adjuction in the category of order set . bear this in mind , we explain how tensored $ \mathcal{q}$-categories be equivalent to order - value closed pseudofunctor on $ \mathcal{q}^{op}$ ; this result be then finetune to obtain in particular that cocomplete $ \mathcal{q}$-categories be equivalent to sup - lattice - value homomorphism on $ \mathcal{q}^{op}$ ( a.k.a.\ $ \mathcal{q}$-modules ) .

title: Closedness properties of internal relations II: Bourn localization
abstract: we say that a class $ \mathbb{d}$ of category be the Bourn localization of a class $ \mathbb{c}$ of category , and we write $ \mathbb{d } = \mathrm{loc}\mathbb{c}$ , if $ \mathbb{d}$ be the class of all ( finitely complete ) category $ \mathcal{d}$ such that for each object $ a$ in $ \mathcal{d}$ , $ \mathrm{pt}(\mathcal{d}\downarrow a ) \in \mathbb{c}$ , where $ \mathrm{pt}(\mathcal{d}\downarrow a)$ denote the category of all pointed object in the comma - category $ ( \mathcal{d}\downarrow a)$. as D. Bourn show , if we take $ \mathbb{d}$ to be the class of Mal'tsev category in the sense of A. Carboni , J. Lambek , and M. C. Pedicchio , and $ \mathbb{c}$ to be the class of unital category in the sense of D. Bourn , which generalize pointed Jónsson - Tarski variety , then $ \mathbb{d } = \mathrm{loc}(\mathbb{c})$. a similar result be obtain by the author : if $ \mathbb{d}$ be as above and $ \mathbb{c}$ be the class of subtractive category , which generalize pointed subtractive variety in the sense of A. Ursini , then $ \mathbb{d } = \mathrm{loc}(\mathbb{c})$. in the present paper we extend these result to abstract class of category obtain from class of variety . we also show that the Bourn localization of the union of the class of unital and subtractive category be still the class of Mal'tsev category .

title: A characterization of quantic quantifiers in orthomodular lattices
abstract: let L be an arbitrary orthomodular lattice . there be a one to one correspondence between orthomodular sublattice of L satisfy an extra condition and quantic quantifier . the category of orthomodular lattice be equivalent to the category of poset have two family of endofunctor satisfy six condition .

title: Closedness properties of internal relations I:  A unified approach to Mal'tsev, unital and subtractive categories
abstract: we study closedness property of internal relation in finitely complete category , which lead to develop a unified approach to : Mal'tsev category , in the sense of A. Carboni , J. Lambek and M. C. Pedicchio , that generalize Mal'tsev variety of universal algebra ; unital category , in the sense of D. Bourn , that generalize pointed Jónsson - Tarski variety ; and subtractive category , introduce by the author , that generalize pointed subtractive variety in the sense of A. Ursini .

title: Exponentiability in lax slices of
abstract: we consider exponentiable object in lax slice of Top with respect to the specialization order ( and its opposite ) on a base space b. we begin by show that the lax slice over B have binary product which be preserve by the forgetful functor to Top if and only if b be a meet ( respective , join ) semilattice in Top , and go on to characterize exponentiability over a complete Alexandrov space b.

title: Free A_\infty-categories
abstract: for a differential grade k - quiver q we define the free a_\infty - category fq generate by Q. the main result be that the restriction a_\infty - functor a_\infty(fq , a ) \to a_1(q , a ) be an equivalence , where object of the last a_\infty - category be morphism of differential grade k - quiver q \to a.

title: Thin fillers in the cubical nerves of omega-categories
abstract: it be show that the cubical nerve of a strict omega - category be a sequence of set with cubical face operation and distinguished subclass of thin element satisfy certain thin filler condition . it be also show that a sequence of this type be the cubical nerve of a strict omega - category unique up to isomorphism ; the cubical nerve functor be therefore an equivalence of category . the sequence of set involve be the analogue of cubical t - complex appropriate for strict omega - category . degeneracy be not require in the definition of these sequence , but can in fact be construct as thin filler . the proof of the thin filler condition use chain complex and chain homotopie .

title: Monads of effective descent type and comonadicity
abstract: we show , for an arbitrary adjunction $ f \dashv u : \cal b \to \cal a$ with $ \cal b$ cauchy complete , that the functor $ f$ be comonadic if and only if the monad $ t$ on $ \cal a$ induce by the adjunction be of effective descent type , mean that the free $ t$-algebra functor $ f^{t } : \cal a \to \cal a^{t}$ be comonadic . this result be apply to several situation : in section 4 to give a sufficient condition for an exponential functor on a cartesian close category to be monadic , in section 5 and 6 to settle the question of the comonadicity of those functor whose domain be Set , or set$_{\star}$ , or the category of module over a semisimple ring , in section 7 to study the effectiveness of ( co)monad on module category . our final application be a descent theorem for noncommutative ring from which we deduce an important result of A. Joyal and M. Tierney and of J.-P. Olivier , assert that the effective descent morphism in the opposite of the category of commutative unital ring be precisely the pure monomorphism .

title: The Dialectica interpretation of first-order classical affine logic
abstract: we give a Dialectica - style interpretation of first - order classical affine logic . by move to a contraction - free logic , the translation ( a.k.a . d - translation ) of a first - order formula into a high - type $ \exists\forall$-formula can be make symmetric with respect to duality , include exponential . it turn out that the propositional part of our d - translation use the same construction as de Paiva 's dialectica category gc and we show how our d - translation extend GC to the first - order setting in term of an index category . furthermore the combination of Girard 's ? ! -translation and our d - translation result in the essentially equivalent $ \exists\forall$-formula as the double - negation translation and Godel 's original d - translation .

title: Dialectica and Chu Constructions: Cousins?
abstract: this note investigate two generic construction use to produce categorical model of linear logic , the Chu construction and the Dialectica construction , in parallel . the construction have the same object , but be rather different in other way . we discuss similarity and difference and prove that the Dialectica construction can be do over a symmetric monoidal closed basis . we also point out interesting open problem concern the Dialectica construction .

title: An extended view of the Chu-construction
abstract: the cyclic Chu - construction for closed bicategorie with pullback , which generalize the original Chu - construction for symmetric monoidal closed category , turn out to have a non - cyclic counterpart . both use so - call Chu - span as new 1 - cell between 1 - cell of the underlie bicategory , which form the new object . Chu - span may be see as a natural generalization of 2 - cell - span in the base bicategory that no long be confine to a single hom - category . this view help to clarify the composition of Chu - span . we consider various approach of link the underlie bicategory with the newly construct one , e.g. by mean of two - dimensional generalization of bifibration . in the quest for a well connection , we investigate , whether Chu - span form a double category . while this turn out not to be the case , we be lead to consider a generalization of the construction to path of 1 - cell in the base , lead to two hierarchy of close bicategorie , one for linear path and one for loop . the possibility of move beyond path , respectively , loop of the same length be indicate . finally , Chu - span in rel be identify as bipartite state transition system . even though their composition may fail here due to the lack of pullback in rel , basic game - theoretic construction can be perform on cyclic Chu - span . these be available in all symmetric monoidal closed category with finite product . if pullback exist as well , the bicategory of cyclic Chu - span inherit a monoidal structure that on object coincide with the categorical product .

title: Approximable Concepts, Chu spaces, and  information systems
abstract: this paper serve to bring three independent but important area of computer science to a common meeting point : Formal Concept Analysis ( FCA ) , Chu Spaces , and Domain Theory ( DT ) . each area be give a perspective or reformulation that be conducive to the flow of idea and to the exploration of cross - disciplinary connection . among other result , we show that the notion of state in Scott 's information system correspond precisely to that of formal concept in FCA with respect to all finite Chu space , and the entailment relation correspond to ` ` association rule " . we introduce , moreover , the notion of approximable concept and show that approximable concept represent algebraic lattice which be identical to Scott domain except the inclusion of a top element . this notion serve as a stepping stone in recent work in which a new notion of morphism on formal context result in a category equivalent to ( a ) the category of complete algebraic lattice and Scott continuous function , and ( b ) a category of information system and approximable mapping .

title: A Parigot-style linear $\lambda$-calculus for full intuitionistic linear  logic
authors: Valeria de Paiva and Eike Ritter
abstract: this paper describe a natural deduction formulation for Full Intuitionistic Linear Logic ( FILL ) , an intriguing variation of multiplicative linear logic , due to Hyland and de Paiva . the system FILL resemble intuitionistic logic , in that all its connective be independent , but resemble classical logic in that its sequent - calculus formulation have intrinsic multiple conclusion . from the intrinsic multiple conclusion come the inspiration to modify Parigot 's natural deduction system for classical logic , to produce a natural deduction formulation and a term assignment system for FILL .

title: Coherence of the Double Involution on *-Autonomous Categories
authors: J.R.B. Cockett, M. Hasegawa and R.A.G. Seely
abstract: we show that any free * -autonomous category be equivalent ( in a strict sense ) to a free * -autonomous category in which the double - involution $ ( -)^{**}$ be the identity functor and the canonical isomorphism $ a\simeq a^{**}$ be an identity arrow for all $ A$ .

title: The Chu construction: history of an idea
abstract: this paper describe the historical background and motivation involve in the discovery ( or invention ) of Chu category .

title: Familial 2-functors and parametric right adjoints
abstract: we define and study familial 2 - functor primarily with a view to the development of the 2 - categorical approach to operad of [ Weber , 2005 ] . also include in this paper be a result in which the well - know characterisation of a category as a simplicial set via the Segal condition , be generalise to a result about nice monad on cocomplete category . instance of this general result can be find in [ Leinster , 2004 ] , [ Berger , 2002 ] and [ Moerdijk - Weiss , 2007b ] . aspect of this general theory be then use to show that the composite 2 - monad of [ Weber , 2005 ] that describe symmetric and braided analogue of the $ \omega$-operads of [ Batanin , 1998 ] , be cartesian 2 - monad and their underlie endo-2 - functor be familial . intricately link to the notion of familial 2 - functor be the theory of fibration in a finitely complete 2 - category [ Street , 1974 ] [ Street , 1980 ] , and those aspect of that theory that we require , that be not discuss in [ Weber , 2007 ] , be review here .

title: Quotients of tannakian categories
abstract: we classify the " quotient " of a tannakian category in which the object of a tannakian subcategory become trivial , and we examine the property of such quotient category .

title: A universal property of the monoidal 2-category of cospans of ordinals and  surjections
authors: M. Menni, N. Sabadini and R. F. C. Walters
abstract: we prove that the monoidal 2 - category of cospan of ordinal and surjection be the universal monoidal category with an object x with a semigroup and a cosemigroup structure , where the two structure satisfy a certain 2 - dimensional separable algebra condition .

title: Collared cospans, cohomotopy and TQFT  (cospans in algebraic topology, II)
abstract: topological cospan and their concatenation , by pushout , appear in the theory of tangle , ribbon , cobordism , etc . various algebraic invariant have be introduce for their study , which it would be interesting to link with the standard tool of Algebraic Topology , ( co)homotopy and ( co)homology functor . here we introduce collarable ( and collared ) cospan between topological space . they generalise the cospan which appear in the previous theory , as a consequence of a classical theorem on manifold with boundary . their interest lie in the fact that their concatenation be realise by mean of homotopy pushout . therefore , cohomotopy functor induce ` functor ' from collarable cospan to span of set , provide - by linearisation - topological quantum field theory ( TQFT ) on manifold and their cobordism . similarly , ( co)homology and homotopy functor take collarable cospan to relation of abelian group or ( co)span of group , yield other ` algebraic ' invariant . this be the second paper in a series devote to the study of cospan in Algebraic Topology . it be practically independent from the first , which deal with high cubical cospan in abstract category . the third article will proceed from both , study cubical topological cospan and their collared version .

title: Nuclei of categories with tensor products
abstract: follow the analogy between algebra ( monoid ) and monoidal category the construction of nucleus for non - associative algebra be simulate on the categorical level . nucleus of category of module be consider as an example .

title: Enriched model categories and an application to additive endomorphism spectra
abstract: we define the notion of an additive model category and prove that any stable , additive , combinatorial model category $ \cal m$ have a model enrichment over $ sp^\sigma(sab)$ ( symmetric spectrum base on simplicial abelian group ) . so to any object $ X$ in $ \cal m$ one can attach an endomorphism ring object , denote $ hend_ad(x)$ , in the category $ sp^\sigma(sab)$. we establish some useful property of these endomorphism ring . we also develop a new notion in enriched category theory which we call ` adjoint module ' . this be use to compare enrichment over one symmetric monoidal model category with enrichment over a Quillen equivalent one . in particular , it be use here to compare enrichment over $ \sp^\sigma(s\ab)$ and chain complex .

title: Dense morphisms of monads
abstract: give an arbitrary locally finitely presentable category $ k$ and finitary monad $ t$ and $ s$ on $ k$ , we characterize monad morphism $ \alpha : s\to t$ with the property that the induce functor $ \alpha _ * : k^t \to k^ s$ between the category of Eilenberg - Moore algebra be fully faithful . we call such monad morphism dense and give a characterization of they in the spirit of Beth 's definability theorem : $ \alpha$ be a dense monad morphism if and only if every $ t$-operation be explicitly define use $ s$-operation . we also give a characterization in term of epimorphic property of $ \alpha$ and clarify the connection between various notion of epimorphism between monad .

title: Coherent unit actions on regular operads and Hopf algebras
abstract: J.-L. Loday introduce the concept of coherent unit action on a regular operad and show that such action give Hopf algebra structure on the free algebra . Hopf algebra obtain this way include the Hopf algebra of shuffle , quasi - shuffle and planar rooted tree . we characterize coherent unit action on binary quadratic regular operad in term of linear equation of the generator of the operad . we then use these equation to classify operad with coherent unit action . we far show that coherent unit action be preserve under take product and thus yield Hopf algebra on the free object of the product operad when the factor operad have coherent unit action . on the other hand , coherent unit action be never preserve under take the dual in the operadic sense except for the operad of associative algebra .

title: Higher cospans and weak cubical categories (Cospans in algebraic topology, I)
abstract: we define a notion of weak cubical category , abstract from the structure of n - cubical cospan $ x : \wedge^n \to x$ in a category $ x$ where $ \wedge$ be the ` formal cospan ' category . these diagram form a cubical set with composition $ x + _ i y$ in all direction , which be compute use pushout and behave ` categorically ' in a weak sense , up to suitable comparison . actually , we work with a ` symmetric cubical structure ' , which include the transposition symmetry , because this allow for a strong simplification of the coherence condition . these notion will be use in subsequent paper to study topological cospan and their use in Algebraic Topology , from tangle to cobordism of manifold . we also introduce the more general notion of a multiple category , where - to start with - arrow belong to different sort , vary in a countable family , and symmetry must be drop . the present example seem to show that the symmetric cubical case be well suit for topological application .

title: Towards an n-category of cobordisms
abstract: we discuss an approach to construct a weak n - category of cobordism . first we present a generalisation of Trimble 's definition of n - category which seem most appropriate for this construction ; in this definition composition be parametrise by a contractible operad . then we show how to use this definition to define the n - category ncob , whose k - cell be k - cobordism , possibly with corner . we follow Baez and Langford in use ` ` manifold embed in cube '' rather than general manifold . we make the construction for 1 - manifold embed in 2- and 3 - cube . for general dimension k and n we indicate what the construction should be .

title: More morphisms between bundle gerbes
abstract: usually bundle gerbe be consider as object of a 2 - groupoid , whose 1 - morphism , call stable isomorphism , be all invertible . I introduce new 1 - morphism which include stable isomorphism , trivialization and bundle gerbe module . they fit into the structure of a 2 - category of bundle gerbe , and lead to natural definition of surface holonomy for closed surface , surface with boundary , and unoriented closed surface .

title: Quasi locally connected toposes
abstract: we have show that complete spread ( with a locally connect domain ) over a bound topos e ( relative to S ) be ` comprehensive ' in the sense that they be precisely the second factor of a factorization associate with an instance of the comprehension scheme involve s - value distribution on E. Lawvere have ask whether the ` Michael covering ' ( or complete spread with a definable dominance domain ) be comprehensive in a similar fashion . we give here a positive answer to this question . in order to deal effectively with the comprehension scheme in this context , we introduce a notion of an ` extensive topos doctrine , ' where the extensive quantity ( or distribution ) have value in a suitable subcategory of what we call ` locally discrete ' locale . in the process we define what we mean by a quasi locally connect topos , a notion that we feel may be of interest in its own right .

title: The theory of core algebras: its completeness
abstract: the core of a category ( first define in ` ` core algebra revisit '' Theoretical Computer Science , vol 375 , issue 1 - 3 , pp 193 - 200 ) have the structure of an abstract core algebra ( first define in the same place ) . a question be leave open : be there more structure yet to be define ? the answer be no : it be show that any operation on an object arise from the fact that the object be the core of its category can be define use only the constant and two binary operation that appear in the definition of abstract core algebra . in the process a number of fact about abstract core algebra must be develop .

title: Monad compositions I: general constructions and recursive distributive laws
abstract: new technique for construct a distributive law of a monad over another be study use submonad , quotient monad , product monad , recursively - define distributive law , and linear equation . sequel paper will consider distributive law in close category and will construct monad approximation for composition which fail to be a monad .

title: CCD lattices in presheaf categories
authors: G. S. H. Cruttwell, F. Marmolejo and R. J. Wood
abstract: in this paper we give a characterization of constructively completely distributive ( CCD ) lattice in presheave on C , for C a small category with pullback .

title: Pullback and finite coproduct preserving functors between categories of permutation representations: Corrigendum and Addendum
abstract: Francisco Marmolejo point out a mistake in the statement of proposition 4.4 in our TAC paper ( Vol . 16 , no . 28 ) . the mistaken version be use later in that paper . our purpose here be to correct the error by provide an explicit description of the finite coproduct completion of the dual of the category of connect g - set . the description use the distinguished morphism of a factorization system on the category of g - set .

title: On Yetter's Invariant and an Extension of the Dijkgraaf-Witten Invariant to Categorical Groups
authors: Joao Faria Martins and Timothy Porter
abstract: we give an interpretation of Yetter 's Invariant of manifold M in term of the homotopy type of the function space top(m , b(\cal g))$ , where \cal G be a cross module and b(\cal G ) be its classifying space . from this formulation , there follow that Yetter 's invariant depend only on the homotopy type of M , and the weak homotopy type of the cross module \cal g. we use this interpretation to define a twisting of Yetter 's Invariant by cohomology class of cross module , define as cohomology class of their classify space , in the form of a state sum invariant . in particular , we obtain an extension of the Dijkgraaf - Witten Invariant of manifold to categorical group . the straightforward extension to cross complex be also consider .

title: Bicat is not triequivalent to Gray
abstract: bicat be the tricategory of bicategorie , homomorphism , pseudonatural transformation , and modification . gray be the subtricategory of 2 - category , 2 - functor , pseudonatural transformation , and modification . we show that these two tricategorie be not triequivalent .

title: Cartesian bicategories II
authors: A. Carboni, G.M. Kelly, R.F.C. Walters, and R.J. Wood
abstract: the notion of cartesian bicategory , introduce by Carboni and Walters for locally order bicategorie , be extend to general bicategorie . it be show that a cartesian bicategory be a symmetric monoidal bicategory .

title: Iterative algebras: How iterative are they?
authors: J. Adamek, R. Borger, S. Milius, and J. Velebil
abstract: iterative algebra , define by the property that every guard system of recursive equation have a unique solution , be prove to have a much strong property : every system of recursive equation have a unique strict solution . those system that have a unique solution in every iterative algebra be characterize .

title: Functional analysis on normed spaces: the  Banach space comparison
abstract: it be the aim of this paper to compute the category of Eilenberg - Moore algebra for the monad arise from the dual unit - ball functor on the category of ( semi)normed space . we show that this give rise to a strong algebraic structure than the totally convex one obtain from the closed unit ball functor on the category of Banach space .

title: Polarized category theory, modules, and game semantics
abstract: motivate by an analysis of Abramsky - Jagadeesan game , the paper consider a categorical semantic for a polarized notion of two - player game , a semantic which have close connection with the logic of ( finite cartesian ) sum and product , as well as with the multiplicative structure of linear logic . in each case , the structure be polarize , in the sense that it will be model by two category , one for each of two polarity , with a module structure connect they . these be study in considerable detail , and a comparison be make with a different notion of polarization due to Olivier Laurent : there be an adjoint connection between the two notion .

title: Q-modules are Q-suplattices
abstract: it be well know that the internal suplattice in the topo of sheaf on a locale be precisely the module on that locale . use enrich category theory and a lemma on KZ doctrine we prove ( the generalization of ) this fact in the case of ordered sheaf on a small quantaloid . compare module - equivalence with sheaf - equivalence for quantaloid and use the notion of centre of a quantaloid , we refine a result of F. Borceux and E. Vitale .

title: Components, complements and the reflection formula
abstract: we illustrate the formula $ ( \downarrow p)x = \gamma_!(x / p ) $ , which give the reflection $ \downarrow p$ of a category $ p : p \to x$ over $ x$ in discrete fibration . one of its proof be base on a ` ` complement operator " which take a discrete fibration $ a$ to the functor $ \neg a$ , right adjoint to $ \gamma_!(a\times-):cat / x \to set$ and value in discrete opfibration . some consequence and application be present .

title: Axiomatic Cohesion
abstract: the nature of the spatial background for classical analysis and for modern theory of continuum physics require more than the partial invariant of locale and cohomology ring for its description . as Maxwell emphasize , this description have various level of precision depend on the need of investigation . these level correspond to different category of space , all of which have intuitively the feature of cohesion . our aim here be to continue the axiomatic study of such category , which involve the following aspect : i. category of space as cohesive background ii . cohesion versus non - cohesion ; quality type iii . extensive quality ; intensive quality in its rarefied and condense aspect ; the canonical quality form and substance iv . non - cohesion within cohesion via constancy on infinitesimal v. the example of reflexive graph and their atomic number vi . sufficient cohesion and the Grothendieck condition vii . weak generation of a subtopos by a quotient topos I look forward to further work on each of these aspect , as well as development of category of dynamical law , constitutive relation , and other mathematical structure that naturally live in cohesive category .

title: Framed bicategories and monoidal fibrations
abstract: in some bicategorie , the 1 - cell be ` morphism ' between the 0 - cell , such as functor between category , but in other they be ` object ' over the 0 - cell , such as bimodule , span , distributor , or parametrize spectrum . many bicategorical notion do not work well in these case , because the ` morphism between 0 - cell ' , such as ring homomorphism , be miss . we can include they by use a pseudo double category , but usually these morphism also induce base change functor act on the 1 - cell . we avoid complicated coherence problem by describe base change ` nonalgebraically ' , use categorical fibration . the result ` frame bicategorie ' assemble into 2 - category , with attendant notion of equivalence , adjunction , and so on which be more appropriate for our example than be the usual bicategorical one . we then describe two way to construct frame bicategorie . one be an analogue of ring and bimodule which start from one frame bicategory and build another . the other start from a ` monoidal fibration ' , mean a parametrized family of monoidal category , and produce an analogue of the frame bicategory of span . combine the two , we obtain a construction which include both enriched and internal category as special case .

title: Cohomology theory in 2-categories
abstract: recently , symmetric categorical group be use for the study of the Brauer group of symmetric monoidal category . as a part of these effort , some algebraic structure of the 2 - category of symmetric categorical group SCG be be investigate . in this paper , we consider a 2 - categorical analogue of an abelian category , in such a way that it contain SCG as an example . as a main theorem , we construct a long cohomology 2 - exact sequence from any extension of complex in such a 2 - category . our axiomatic and self - dual definition will enable we to simplify the proof , by analogy with abelian category .

title: Exponentiability in homotopy slices of
abstract: we prove a general theorem relate pseudo - exponentiable object of a bicategory k to those of the Kleisli bicategory of a pseudo - monad on K. this theorem be apply to obtain pseudo - exponentiable object of the homotopy slice top//b of the category of topological space and the pseudo - slice cat//b of the category of small category .

title: Propriétés universelles et extensions de Kan  dérivées
abstract: we prove that , give any small category a$ = , the derivator hot_a , correspond to the homotopy theory of presheave of homotopy type on A , be characterize by a natural universal property . in particular , the theory of Kan extension extend to the setting of Grothendieck derivator .

title: Isbell duality
authors: Michael Barr, John F. Kennison, and R. Raphael
abstract: we develop in some generality the duality that often arise when one object lie in two different category . in our example , one category be equational and the other consist of the topological object in a ( generally different ) equational category .

title: Core varieties, extensivity, and rig geometry
abstract: the role of the Frobenius operation in analyze finite space , as well as the extended algebraic geometry over rig , depend partly on variety ( birkhoffian inclusion of algebraic category ) that have coreflection as well as reflection and whose dual category of affine space be extensive . even within the category of those rig where 1 + 1 = 1 , not only distributive lattice but also the function algebra of tropical geometry ( where x + 1 = 1 ) and the dimension rig of separable prextensive category ( where x + x^2 = x^2 ) enjoy those feature . ( talk give at CT08 , Calais . )

title: Quotients of unital $A_\infty$-categories
abstract: assume that $ b$ be a full $ a_\infty$-subcategory of a unital $ a_\infty$-category $ \cc$ we construct the quotient unital $ a_\infty$-category $ \cd=$`$\cc/\cb$ ' . it represent the $ a_\infty^u$-2 - functor $ a \mapsto a_\infty^u(c , a)_{mod b}$ , which associate with a given unital $ a_\infty$-category $ a$ the $ a_\infty$-category of unital $ a_\infty$-functors $ c \to a$ , whose restriction to $ b$ be contractible . namely , there be a unital $ a_\infty$-functor $ e : c \to d$ such that the composition $ b \hookrightarrow c \to^e d$ be contractible , and for an arbitrary unital $ a_\infty$-category $ a$ the restriction $ a_\infty$-functor $ ( e\boxtimes 1)m : a_\infty^u(d , a)\to a_\infty^u(c , a)_{mod b}$ be an equivalence . let $ C_k$ be the differential grade category of differential grade $ k$-module . we prove that the Yoneda $ a_\infty$-functor $ y : a \to a_\infty^u(a^{op } , c_k)$ be a full embedding for an arbitrary unital $ a_\infty$-category $ a$ . in particular , such $ a$ be $ a_\infty$-equivalent to a differential grade category with the same set of object .

title: Colimits of representable algebra-valued functors
keywords: representable functor among varieties of algebras
abstract: if C and D be variety of algebra in the sense of general algebra , then by a representable functor C --&gt ; D we understand a functor which , when compose with the forgetful functor d --&gt ; Set , give a representable functor in the classical sense ; Freyd show that these functor be determine by D - coalgebra object of C. let Rep(C , D ) denote the category of all such functor , a full subcategory of Cat(C , D , opposite to the category of D - coalgebra in C. it be prove that Rep(C , D ) have small colimit , and in certain situation , explicit construction for the represent coalgebra be obtain . in particular , Rep(C , D ) always have an initial object . this be show to be ` ` trivial '' unless C and D either both have no zeroary operation , or both have more than one derive zeroary operation . in those two case , the functor in question may have surprisingly opulent structure . it be also show that every set - value representable functor on C admit a universal morphism to a d - value representable functor . several example be work out in detail , and area for further investigation be note .

title: Star-autonomous functor categories
abstract: we construct a star - autonomous structure on the functor category $ k^j$ , where $ j$ be small , $ k$ be small - complete , and both be star - autonomous . a weak result , that $ k^j$ admit a linear distributive structure , be also show under weak hypothesis . the latter lead to a deep understanding of the notion of linear functor .

title: Balanced category theory
abstract: some aspect of basic category theory be develop in a finitely complete category $ \cal c$ , endow with two factorization system which determine the same discrete object and be link by a simple reciprocal stability law . rest on this axiomatization of final and initial functor and discrete ( op)fibration , concept such as component , slice and coslice , colimit and limit , left and right adjunctible map , dense map and arrow interval , can be naturally define in $ \cal c$ , and several classical property concern they can be effectively prove . for any object $ x$ of $ \cal c$ , by restrict $ \cal c / x$ to the slice or to the coslice of $ x$ , two dual ` ` underlying category " be obtain . these can be enrich over internal set ( discrete object ) of $ \cal c$ : internal hom - set be give by the component of the pullback of the correspond slice and coslice of $ x$. the construction extend to give functor $ \cal c \to cat$ , which preserve ( or reverse ) slice and adjunctible map and which can be enrich over internal set too .

title: Algebraic real analysis
abstract: an effort to initiate the subject of the title : the basic tool be the study of the abstract closed interval equip with certain equational structure .

title: Category-theoretic models of linear Abadi and Plotkin logic
authors: Lars Birkedal and Rasmus E. Mogelberg and Rasmus L. Petersen
abstract: this paper present a sound and complete category - theoretic notion of model for Linear Abadi and Plotkin Logic , a logic suitable for reason about parametricity in combination with recursion . a subclass of these call parametric LAPL structure can be see as an axiomatization of domain theoretic model of parametric polymorphism , and we show how to solve general ( nested ) recursive domain equation in these . parametric LAPL structure constitute a general notion of model of parametricity in a setting with recursion . in future paper we will demonstrate this by show how many different model of parametricity and recursion give rise to parametric lapl structure , include Simpson and Rosolini 's set theoretic model , a syntactic model base on Lily and a model base on admissible pers over a reflexive domain .

title: Fundamental pushout toposes
abstract: the author introduce and employ certain ` fundamental pushout topos ' in the construction of the covering fundamental groupoid of a locally connect topos . our main purpose in this paper be to generalize this construction without the local connectedness assumption . we replace connect component by constructively complemented , or definable , monomorphism . unlike the locally connect case , where the fundamental groupoid be localic prodiscrete and its classify topos be a Galois topos , in the general case our version of the fundamental groupoid be a locally discrete progroupoid and there be no intrinsic Galois theory in the sense of Janelidze . we also discuss cover projection , locally trivial , and branched covering without local connectedness by analogy with , but also necessarily depart from , the locally connect case . throughout , we work abstractly in a setting give axiomatically by a category v of locally discrete locale that have as example the category d of discrete locale , and z of zero - dimensional locale . in this fashion we be lead to give unify and often simple proof of old theorem in the locally connect case , as well as new one without that assumption .

title: Kan extensions in double categories
abstract: this paper deal with Kan extension in a weak double category . absolute Kan extension be closely relate to the orthogonal adjunction introduce in a previous paper . the pointwise case be treat by introduce internal comma object , which can be define in an arbitrary double category .

title: Coherence for pseudodistributive laws revisited
authors: F. Marmolejo and R. J. Wood
abstract: in this paper we show that eight coherence condition suffice for the definition of a pseudodistributive law between pseudomonad .

title: Abelian groupoids and non-pointed additive categories
abstract: we show that , in any Mal'tsev ( and a fortiori protomodular ) category E , not only the fibre Grd_X E of internal groupoid above the object x be a naturally Mal'tsev category , but moreover it share with the category Ab of abelian group the property following which the domain of any split epimorphism be isomorphic with the direct sum of its codomain with its kernel . this allow we to point at a new class of ` ` non - pointed additive '' category which be necessarily protomodular . actually this even give rise to a large classification table of non - pointed additive category which gradually take place between the class of naturally Mal'tsev category and the one of essentially affine category . as an application , when furthermore the ground category E be efficiently regular , we get a new way to produce Baer sum in the fibre grd_x E and , more generally , in the fibre n - grd_x E.

title: Frobenius objects in cartesian bicategories
abstract: map ( left adjoint arrow ) between Frobenius object in a cartesian bicategory b be precisely comonoid homomorphism and , for A Frobenius and any t in B , map(b)(t , a ) be a groupoid .

title: Descent for compact 0-dimensional spaces
abstract: use the reflection of the category C of compact 0 - dimensional topological space into the category of Stone space we introduce a concept of a fibration in C. we show that : ( i ) effective descent morphism in C be the same as the surjective fibration ; ( ii ) effective descent morphism in C with respect to the fibration be all surjection .

title: Generalized Brown representability in homotopy categories: Erratum
abstract: proposition 4.2 and 4.3 of the author 's article ( theory Appl . Categ . 14 ( 2005 ) , 451 - 479 ) be not correct . we show that their use can be avoid and all remain result remain correct . see note on p. 24 .

title: Approximate Mal'tsev operations
abstract: let $ X$ and $ A$ be set and $ \alpha : x\to a$ a map between they . we call a map $ \mu : x\times x\times x\to a$ an approximate Mal'tsev operation with approximation $ \alpha$ , if it satisfy $ \mu(x , y , y ) = \alpha(x ) = \mu(y , y , x)$ for all $ x , y\in x$. note that if $ a = x$ and the approximation $ \alpha$ be an identity map , then $ \mu$ become an ordinary Mal'tsev operation . we prove the following two characterization theorem : a category $ \mathbb{x}$ be a Mal'tsev category if and only if in the functor category $ \mathbf{set}^{\mathbb{x}^\mathrm{op}\times\mathbb{x}}$ there exist an internal approximate Mal'tsev operation $ \mathrm{hom}_{\mathbb{x}}\times \mathrm{hom}_{\mathbb{x}}\times \mathrm{hom}_{\mathbb{x}}\rightarrow a$ whose approximation $ \alpha$ satisfy a suitable condition ; a regular category $ \mathbb{x}$ with finite coproduct be a Mal'tsev category , if and only if in the functor category $ \mathbb{x}^\mathbb{x}$ there exist an internal approximate Mal'tsev co - operation $ a\rightarrow 1_\mathbb{x}+1_\mathbb{x}+1_\mathbb{x}$ whose approximation $ \alpha$ be a natural transformation with every component a regular epimorphism in $ \mathbb{x}$. note that in both of these characterization theorem , if require far the approximation $ \alpha$ to be an identity morphism , then the condition there involve $ \alpha$ become equivalent to $ \mathbb{x}$ be a naturally Mal'tsev category .

title: Locally cartesian closed categories without chosen constructions
abstract: we show how to formulate the notion of locally cartesian closed category without choose pullback , by the use of Makkai 's theory of anafunctor .

title: Relative injectivity as cocompleteness for a class of distributors
authors: Maria Manuel Clementino and Dirk Hofmann
abstract: notion and technique of enrich category theory can be use to study topological structure , like metric space , topological space and approach space , in the context of topological theory . recently in [ D. Hofmann , injective space via adjunction , arxiv : math . ct/0804.0326 ] the construction of a Yoneda embedding allow to identify injectivity of space as cocompleteness and to show monadicity of the category of injective space and left adjoint over SET . in this paper we generalise these result , study cocompleteness with respect to a give class of distributor . we show in particular that the description of several semantic domain present in [ M. Escardo and B. Flagg , semantic domain , injective space and monad , Electronic Notes in Theoretical Computer Science 20 ( 1999 ) ] can be translate into the v - enrich setting .

title: Analytic functors and weak pullbacks
abstract: for accessible set - value functor it be well know that weak preservation of limit be equivalent to representability , and weak preservation of connect limit to familial representability . in contrast , preservation of weak wide pullback be equivalent to be a coproduct of quotient of $ \hom$-functor modulo group of automorphism . for finitary functor this be prove by Andr\'e Joyal who call these functor analytic . we introduce a generalization of Joyal 's concept from endofunctor of Set to endofunctor of a symmetric monoidal category .

title: Notes on effective descent and projectivity in quasivarieties of universal  algebras
abstract: we present sufficient condition under which effective descent morphism in a quasivariety of universal algebra be the same as regular epimorphism and example for which they be the same as regular epimorphism satisfy projectivity .

title: Extensions in the theory of lax algebras
authors: Christoph Schubert and Gavin J. Seal
abstract: recent investigation of lax algebra - in generalization of Barr 's relational algebra -make an essential use of lax extension of monad functor on Set to the category rel(v ) of set and v - relation ( where v be a unital quantale ) . for a give monad there may be many such lax extension , and different construction appear in the literature . the aim of this article be to shed a unifying light on these lax extension , and present a symptomatic situation in which distinct monad yield isomorphic category of lax algebra .

title: A convenient category for directed homotopy
abstract: we propose a convenient category for direct homotopy consist of " direct '' topological space generate by " direct '' cube . its main advantage be that , like the category of topological space generate by simplice suggest by J. H. Smith , it be locally presentable .

title: Weakly Mal'cev categories
abstract: we introduce a notion of weakly Mal'cev category , and show that : ( a ) every internal reflexive graph in a weakly Mal'tsev category admit at most one multiplicative graph structure in the sense of Janelidze , and such a structure always make it an internal category ; ( b ) ( unlike the special case of Mal'tsev category ) there be weakly Mal'tsev category in which not every internal category be an internal groupoid . we also give a simplified characterization of internal groupoid among internal category in this context .

title: Completions in biaffine sets
abstract: the theory of completion of $ t_0 $ object in category of affine object over a give complete category develop by the second author be extend to the case of $ t_0 $ object in category of 2affine object . in the paper the case of the category $ Set$ and target object the two - point set be study in detail and an internal characterization of 2affine set be provide .

title: Doubles for monoidal categories
abstract: in a recent paper , Daisuke Tambara define two - sided action on an endomodule (= endodistributor ) of a monoidal v - category A. when A be autonomous (= rigid = compact ) , he show that the v - category ( that we call Tamb(A ) ) of so - equip endomodule ( that we call Tambara module ) be equivalent to the monoidal centre z[a , v ] of the convolution monoidal v - category [ a , v ] . our paper extend these idea somewhat . for general A , we construct a promonoidal v - category DA ( which we suggest should be call the double of A ) with an equivalence of [ da , v ] with tamb(a ) . when A be close , we define strong ( respectively , leave strong ) Tambara module and show that these constitute a v - category tamb_s(a ) ( respectively , tamb_{ls}(a ) ) which be equivalent to the centre ( respectively , lax centre ) of [ a , v ] . we construct localization d_sa and d_{ls}a of DA such that there be equivalence of tamb_s(a ) with [ d_sa , v ] and of tamb_{ls}(a ) with [ d_{ls}a , v ] . when A be autonomous , every Tambara module be strong ; this imply an equivalence of z[a , v ] with [ da , v ] .

title: Limit preserving full embeddings
abstract: we prove that every small strongly connect category k have a full embedding preserve all limit exist in k into a category of unary universal algebra . the number of unary operation can be restrict to |mor k| in case when k have a terminal object and only preservation of limit over finitely many object be desire . and all limit exist in such a category k be preserve by a full embedding of k into the category of all algebraic system with |mor k| unary operation and one unary relation .

title: Protolocalisations of exact Mal'cev categories
authors: Francis Borceux, Marino Gran, Sandra Mantovani
abstract: a protolocalisation of a regular category be a full reflective regular subcategory , whose reflection preserve pullback of regular epimorphism along arbitrary morphism . we devote special attention to the epireflective protolocalisation of an exact Mal'cev category ; we characterise they in term of a correspond closure operator on equivalence relation . we give some example in algebra and in topos theory .

title: Cartesian differential categories
authors: R.F. Blute, J.R.B. Cockett and R.A.G. Seely
abstract: this paper revisit the author ' notion of a differential category from a different perspective . a differential category be an additive symmetric monoidal category with a comonad ( a " coalgebra modality " ) and a differential combinator . the morphism of a differential category should be think of as the linear map ; the differentiable or smooth map would then be morphism of the coKleisli category . the purpose of the present paper be to directly axiomatize differentiable map and thus to move the emphasis from the linear notion to structure resemble the coKleisli category . the result be a setting with a more evident and intuitive relationship to the familiar notion of calculus on smooth map . indeed a primary example be the category whose object be euclidean space and whose morphism be smooth map . a cartesian differential category be a cartesian left additive category which possess a cartesian differential operator . the differential operator itself must satisfy a number of equation , which guarantee , in particular , that the differential of any map be ` " linear " in a suitable sense . we present an analysis of the basic property of cartesian differential category . we show that under modest and natural assumption , the coKleisli category of a differential category be cartesian differential . finally we present a ( sound and complete ) term calculus for these category which allow their structure to be analyse use essentially the same language one might use for traditional multi - variable calculus .

title: Algebraic categories whose projectives are explicitly free
abstract: let m = ( m , m , u ) be a monad and let ( mx , m ) be the free m - algebra on the object X. consider an m - algebra ( a , a ) , a retraction r : ( mx , m ) --&gt ; ( a , a ) and a section t : ( a , a ) --&gt ; ( mx , m ) of r. the retract ( a , a ) be not free in general . we observe that for many monad with a ` combinatorial flavor ' such a retract be not only a free algebra ( ma_0 , m ) , but it be also the case that the object a_0 of generator be determine in a canonical way by the section t. we give a precise form of this property , prove a characterization , and discuss example from combinatoric , universal algebra , convexity and topos theory .

title: Homotopical interpretation of globular complex by multipointed d-space
abstract: globular complex be introduce by E. Goubault and the author to model higher dimensional automaton . globular complex be topological space equip with a globular decomposition which be the direct analogue of the cellular decomposition of a CW - complex . we prove that there exist a combinatorial model category such that the cellular object be exactly the globular complex and such that the homotopy category be equivalent to the homotopy category of flow . the underlie category of this model category be a variant of M. Grandis ' notion of d - space over a topological space colimit generate by simplice . this result enable we to understand the relationship between the framework of flow and other work in direct algebraic topology use d - space . it also enable we to prove that the underlie homotopy type functor of flow can be interpret up to equivalence of category as the total left derive functor of a left Quillen adjoint .

title: A brief review of abelian categorifications
authors: Mikhail Khovanov, Volodymyr Mazorchuk and Catharina Stroppel
abstract: this article contain a review of categorification of semisimple representation of various ring via abelian category and exact endofunctor on they . a simple definition of an abelian categorification be present and illustrate with several example , include categorification of various representation of the symmetric group and its Hecke algebra via high weight category of module over the Lie algebra $ sl_n$. the review be intend to give non - expert in representation theory who be familiar with the topological aspect of categorification ( lift quantum link invariant to homology theory ) an idea for the sort of category that appear when link homology be extend to tangle .

title: Higher-dimensional categories with finite derivation type
abstract: we study convergent ( terminating and confluent ) presentation of n - category . use the notion of polygraph ( or computad ) , we introduce the homotopical property of finite derivation type for n - category , generalise the one introduce by Squier for word rewriting system . we characterise this property by use the notion of critical branching . in particular , we define sufficient condition for an n - category to have finite derivation type . through example , we present several technique base on derivation of 2 - category to study convergent presentation by 3 - polygraph .

title: Vector fields and flows on differentiable stacks
abstract: this paper introduce the notion of vector field and flow on a general differentiable stack . our main theorem state that the flow of a vector field on a compact proper differentiable stack exist and be unique up to a uniquely determine 2 - cell . this extend the usual result on the existence and uniqueness of flow on a manifold as well as the author 's exist result for orbifold . it set the scene for a discussion of Morse Theory on a general proper stack and also pave the way for the categorification of other key aspect of differential geometry such as the tangent bundle and the Lie algebra of vector field .

with the representable t - category , we form a connection between two concept , both owe to a. Burroni : on the one hand , the one of t - category , and , on the other hand , the one of t - lax algebra . both of they generalise the concept of algebra on a monad t.

title: Epimorphic covers make $R^+_G$ a site, for profinite $G$
abstract: let $ g$ be a non - finite profinite group and let $ g - Sets_{df}$ be the canonical site of finite discrete $ g$-sets . then the category $ r^+_g$ , define by Devinatz and Hopkins , be the category obtain by consider $ g - Sets_{df}$ together with the profinite $ g$-space $ g$ itself , with morphism be continuous $ g$-equivariant map . we show that $ r^+_g$ be a site when equip with the pretopology of epimorphic cover . we point out that presheave of spectrum on $ r^+_g$ be an efficient way of organize the datum that be obtain by take the homotopy fix point of a continuous $ g$-spectrum with respect to the open subgroup of $ g$. additionally , utilize the result that $ r^+_g$ be a site , we describe various model category structure on the category of presheave of spectrum on $ r^+_g$ and make some observation about they .

title: Isbell duality for modules
authors: Michael Barr, John F. Kennison, and R. Raphael
abstract: the purpose of this paper be to extend the result of TAC Vol . 20 , No . 15 from the case of abelian group ( z - module ) to that of module over a large class of not necessarily commutative ring .

title: Eventually cyclic spectra of parameterized flows
abstract: this paper continue the work of our previous paper , the cyclic spectrum of a boolean flow TAC 10 , 392 - 419 and spectrum of finitely generate boolean flow TAC 16 , 434 - 459 . we define eventually cyclic boolean flow and the eventually cyclic spectrum of a boolean flow . we show that this spectrum , as well as the spectra define in our early paper , extend to parametrize flow on Stone space and on compact Hausdorff space when symbolic dynamic be use . an example show that the cyclic spectrum for a parameterize flow be sometimes over a non - spatial locale .

title: An embedding theorem for Hilbert categories
abstract: we axiomatically define ( pre-)hilbert category . the axiom resemble those for monoidal abelian category with the addition of an involutive functor . we then prove embedding theorem : any locally small pre - hilbert category whose monoidal unit be a simple generator embed ( weakly ) monoidally into the category of pre - hilbert space and adjointable map , preserve adjoint morphism and all finite ( co)limit . an intermediate result that be important in its own right be that the scalar in such a category necessarily form an involutive field . in case of a Hilbert category , the embedding extend to the category of Hilbert space and continuous linear map . the axiom for ( pre-)hilbert category be weak than the axiom find in other approach to axiomatize 2 - Hilbert space . neither enrichment nor a complex base field be presuppose . a comparison to other approach will be make in the introduction .

title: Weak distributive laws
abstract: distributive law between monad ( triple ) be define by Jon Beck in the 1960 . they be generalize to monad in 2 - category and notice to be monad in a 2 - category of monad . mixed distributive law be comonad in the 2 - category of monad ; if the comonad have a right adjoint monad , the mate of a mixed distributive law be an ordinary distributive law . particular case be the entwining operator between algebra and coalgebra . motivate by work on weak entwine operator , we define and study a weak notion of distributive law for monad . in particular , each weak distributive law determine a wreath product monad ( in the terminology of Lack and Street ) ; this give an advantage over the mix case .

title: On the categorical semantics of elementary linear logic
abstract: we introduce the notion of elementary Seely category as a notion of categorical model of Elementary Linear Logic ( ELL ) inspire from Seely 's definition of model of Linear Logic ( LL ) . in order to deal with additive connective in ELL , we use the approach of Danos and Joinet . from the categorical point of view , this require we to go outside the usual interpretation of connective by functor . the $ ! $ connective be decompose into a pre - connective $ \sharp$ which be interpret by a whole family of functor ( generate by $ \id$ , $ \tens$ and $ \with$ ) . as an application , we prove the stratified coherent model and the obsessional coherent model to be elementary Seely category and thus model of ELL .

title: Enriched Orthogonality and Equivalences
abstract: in this paper , we consider an enriched orthogonality for class of space , with respect to groupoid , simplicial set and space themselves . this point of view allow one to characterize homotopy equivalence , shape and strong shape equivalence . we show that there exist a class of space , properly contain anr - space , for which shape and strong shape equivalence coincide . for such a class of space homotopy orthogonality imply enriched orthogonality .

title: Algebraic colimit calculations in homotopy theory using fibred and cofibred categories
abstract: high Homotopy van Kampen theorem allow some colimit calculation of certain homotopical invariant of glue space . one corollary be to describe homotopical excision in critical dimension in term of induce module and cross module over groupoid . this paper show how fibred and cofibred category give an overall context for discuss and compute such construction , allow one result to cover many case . a useful general result be that the inclusion of a fibre of a fibred category preserve connect colimit . the main homotopical application be to pair of space with several base point ; we also describe briefly application to triad .

title: Covering space theory for directed topology
authors: Eric Goubault, Emmanuel Haucourt, Sanjeevi Krishnan
abstract: the state space of a machine admit the structure of time . for example , the geometric realization of a precubical set , a generalization of an unlabeled asynchronous transition system , admit a ` ` local preorder '' encode control flow . in the case where time do not loop , the ` ` locally preordered '' state space split into causally distinct component . the set of such component often give a computable invariant of machine behavior . in the general case , no such meaningful partition could exist . however , as we show in this note , the locally preordered geometric realization of a precubical set admit a ` ` locally monotone '' covering from a state space in which time do not loop . thus we hope to extend geometric technique in static program analysis to loop process .

title: Categories with slicing
abstract: prior work towards the subject of high - dimensional category give rise to several example of a category over $ cat$ to which the slice - category construction can be lift universally . the present paper start by supply this last clause with a precise meaning . it go on to establish for any such category a certain embedding in a presheaf category , to describe the image , and hence to derive condition collectively sufficient for that functor to be an equivalence . these condition be meet in the foremost of the example : the category of dendrotopic set .

title: Searching for more absolute CR-epic spaces
authors: Michael Barr, John F. Kennison, and R. Raphael
abstract: we continue our examination of absolute cr - epic space , or space with the property that any embedding induce an epimorphism , in the category of commutative ring , between their ring of continuous function . we examine more closely the delete plank construction , which generalize the Dieudonne construction , and yield absolute cr - epic space which be not Lindelof . for the Lindelof case , an early paper have show the usefulness of the countable neighbourhood property , cnp , and the Alster condition ( where cnp mean that the space be a p - space in any compactification and the Alster condition say that any cover of the space by $ g_\delta$ set have a countable subcover , provide each compact subset can be cover by a finite subset . ) in this paper , we find further property of Lindelof CNP space and of Alster space , include construction that preserve these property and condition equivalent to these property . we explore the outgrowth of such space and find several example that answer open question in our previous work .

title: Tensor-triangulated categories and dualities
abstract: in a triangulate closed symmetric monoidal category , there be natural duality induce by the internal Hom . give a monoidal exact functor $ f^*$ between two such category and adjoint couple $ ( f^*,f_*)$ , $ ( f_*,f^!)$ , we establish the commutative diagram necessary for $ f^*$ and $ f_*$ to respect certain duality , for a projection formula to hold between they ( as duality preserve exact functor ) and for classical base change and composition formula to hold when such duality preserve functor be compose . this framework allow we to define push - forward for Witt group , for example .

title: On endomorphism algebras of separable monoidal functors
abstract: we show that the ( co)endomorphism algebra of a sufficiently separable ` ` fibre '' functor into $ vect_k$ , for $ k$ a field of characteristic 0 , have the structure of what we call a ` ` unital '' von Neumann core in $ vect_k$. for $ vect_k$ , this particular notion of algebra be weak than that of a Hopf algebra , although the correspond concept in $ Set$ be again that of a group .

title: On deformations of pasting diagrams
abstract: we adapt the work of Power to describe general , not - necessarily composable , not - necessarily commutative 2 - categorical pasting diagram and their composable and commutative part . we provide a deformation theory for pasting diagram value in the 2 - category of k - linear category , parallel that provide for diagram of algebra by Gerstenhaber and Schack , prove the standard result . along the way , the construction give rise to a bicategorical analog of the homotopy g - algebra of Gerstenhaber and Voronov .

title: What are sifted colimits?
authors: J. Adamek, J. Rosicky, E. M. Vitale
abstract: sift colimit , important for algebraic theory , be " almost " just the combination of filter colimit and reflexive coequalizer . for example , give a finitely cocomplete category $ \cal a$ , then a functor with domain $ \cal a$ preserve sift colimit iff it preserve filter colimit and reflexive coequalizer . but for general category $ \cal a$ that statement be not true : we provide a counter - example .

title: The pointed subobject functor, 3 x 3 lemmas, and subtractivity of spans
abstract: the notion of a subtractive category recently introduce by the author , be a pointed categorical counterpart of the notion of a subtractive variety of universal algebra in the sense of A.~Ursini ( recall that a variety be subtractive if its theory contain a constant 0 and a binary term s satisfy s(x , x)=0 and s(x,0)=x ) . let we call a pointed regular category $ \mathbb{c}$ normal if every regular epimorphism in $ \mathbb{c}$ be a normal epimorphism . it be well know that any homological category in the sense of F. Borceux and D. Bourn be both normal and subtractive . we prove that in any subtractive normal category , the upper and low $ 3\times 3 $ lemma hold true , which generalize a similar result for homological category due to D. Bourn ( note that the middle $ 3\times 3 $ lemma hold true if and only if the category be homological ) . the technique of proof be new : the pointed subobject functor $ \mathcal{s}=\mathrm{sub}(-):\mathbb{c}\rightarrow\mathbf{set}_*$ turn out to have suitable preservation / reflection property which allow we to reduce the proof of these two diagram lemma to the standard diagram - chase argument in $ \mathbf{set}_*$ ( alternatively , we could use the more advanced embedding theorem for regular category due to M.~Barr ) . the key property of $ \mathcal{s}$ , which allow to obtain these diagram lemma , be the preservation of subtractive span . subtractivity of a span provide a weak version of the rule of subtraction --- one of the elementary rule for chase diagram in abelian category , in the sense of S. Mac Lane . a pointed regular category be subtractive if and only if every span in it be subtractive , and moreover , the functor $ \mathcal{s}$ not only preserve but also reflect subtractive span . thus , subtractivity seem to be exactly what we need in order to prove the upper / low $ 3\times 3 $ lemma in a normal category . indeed , we show that a normal category be subtractive if and only if these $ 3\times 3 $ lemma hold true in it . moreover , we show that for any pointed regular category $ \mathbb{c}$ ( not necessarily a normal one ) , we have : $ \mathbb{c}$ be subtractive if and only if the low $ 3\times 3 $ lemma hold true in $ \mathbb{c}$.

title: A metric tangential calculus
abstract: the metric jet , introduce here , generalize the jet ( at order one ) of Charles Ehresmann . in short , for a ` ` good '' map f ( say to be ` ` tangentiable '' at a ) between metric space , we define its metric jet tangent at a ( compose of all the map which be locally lipschitzian at a and tangent to f at a ) call the ` ` tangential '' of f at a , and denote tf_a . so , in this metric context , we define a ` ` new differentiability '' ( call ` ` tangentiability '' ) which extend the classical differentiability ( while preserve most of its property ) to new map , traditionally pathologic .

title: Star-multiplicative graphs in pointed protomodular categories
abstract: protomodularity , in the pointed case , be equivalent to the Split Short five Lemma . it be also well know that this condition imply that every internal category be in fact an internal groupoid . in this work , this be condition ( ii ) and we introduce two other condition denote ( i ) and ( iii ) . under condition ( i ) , every multiplicative graph be an internal category . under condition ( iii ) , every star - multiplicative graph can be extend ( uniquely ) to a multiplicative graph , a problem raise by G. Janelidze in the semiabelian context . when the three condition hold , internal groupoid have a simple description , that , in the semiabelian context , correspond to the notion of internal cross module , in the sense of Janelidze .

title: The third cohomology group classifies double central extensions
authors: Diana Rodelo and Tim Van der Linden
abstract: we characterise the double central extension in a semi - abelian category in term of commutator condition . we prove that the third cohomology group h^3(z , a ) of an object z with coefficient in an abelian object a classify the double central extension of z by a.

title: Strongly separable morphisms in general categories
abstract: we clarify the relationship between separable and cover morphism in general category by introduce and study an intermediate class of morphism that we call strongly separable .

title: Snake Lemma in incomplete relative homological categories
abstract: the purpose of this paper be to prove a new , incomplete - relative , version of non - abelian Snake Lemma , where " relative " refer to a distinguished class of normal epimorphism in the ground category , and " incomplete " refer to omit all completeness / cocompleteness assumption not involve that class .

title: Internal crossed modules and  Peiffer Condition
abstract: in this paper we show that in a homological category in the sense of F. Borceux and D. Bourn , the notion of an internal precrosse module correspond to a star - multiplicative graph , in the sense of G. Janelidze , can be obtain by directly internalize the usual axiom of a cross module , via equivariance . we then exhibit some sufficient condition on a homological category under which this notion coincide with the notion of an internal cross module due to G. Janelidze . we show that this be the case for any category of distributive $ \omega_2$-groups , in particular for the category of group with operation in the sense of G. Orzech .

title: Monadic approach to Galois descent and cohomology
authors: Francis Borceux, Stefaan Caenepeel and George Janelidze
abstract: we describe a simplified categorical approach to Galois descent theory . it be well know that Galois descent be a special case of Grothendieck descent , and that under mild additional condition the category of Grothendieck descent datum coincide with the Eilenberg - Moore category of algebra over a suitable monad . this also suggest use monad directly , and our monadic approach to Galois descent make no reference to Grothendieck descent theory at all . in order to make Galois descent construction perfectly clear , we also describe their connection with some other related construction of categorical algebra , and make various explicit calculation , especially with 1 - cocycle and 1 - dimensional non - abelian cohomology , usually omit in the literature .

title: The comprehensive factorization and torsors
