abstract: this be an expand , revise and correct version of the first author 's 1981 preprint . the discussion of one - dimensional cohomology $ h^{1}$ in a fairly general category e involve pass to the 2 - category Cat(E ) of category E. in particular , the coefficient object be a category b in E and the torsor that $ h^{1}$ classify be particular functor in E. we only impose condition on E that be satisfy also by Cat(E ) and argue that $ h^{1}$ for Cat(E ) be a kind of $ h^{2}$ for E , and so on recursively . for we , it be too much to ask E to be a topos ( or even internally complete ) since , even if E be , Cat(E ) be not . with this motivation , we be lead to examine morphism in E which act as internal family and to internalize the comprehensive factorization of functor into a final functor follow by a discrete fibration . we define b - torsor for a category b in E and prove clutching and classification theorem . the former theorem clutch Cech cocycle to construct torsor while the latter construct a coefficient category to classify structure locally isomorphic to member of a give internal family of structure . we conclude with application to example .

title: Homology of n-fold groupoids
abstract: any semi - abelian category a appear , via the discrete functor , as a full replete reflective subcategory of the semi - abelian category of internal groupoid in A. this allow one to study the homology of $ n$-fold internal groupoid with coefficient in a semi - abelian category a , and to compute explicit high Hopf formula . the crucial concept make such computation possible be the notion of protoadditive functor , which can be see as a natural generalisation of the notion of additive functor .

title: A categorical approach to integration
abstract: we present a general treatment of measure and integral in certain ( monoidal closed ) category . under appropriate condition the integral can be define by a universal property , and the universal measure be at the same time a universal multiplicative measure . in the multiplicative case this assignment be right adjoint to the formation of the boolean algebra of idempotent . now coproduct preservation yield an approach to product measure .

title: Duality for CCD lattices
authors: Francisco Marmolejo, Robert Rosebrugh, and R.J. Wood
abstract: the 2 - category of constructively completely distributive lattice be show to be bidual to a 2 - category of generalized order that admit a monadic schizophrenic object biadjunction over the 2 - category of order set .

title: Strictification of categories weakly enriched in symmetric monoidal categories
abstract: we show that category weakly enrich over symmetric monoidal category can be strictifie to category enrich in permutative category . this be a " many 0 - cell " version of the strictification of bimonoidal category to strict one .

title: Action accessibility for categories of interest
abstract: we prove that every category of interest ( in the sense of G. Orzech ) be action accessible in the sense of Bourn and Janelidze . this fact allow we to give an intrinsic description of center and centralizer in this class of category . we give also some new example of category of interest , mainly arise from Loday 's paper .

title: A unified framework for generalized multicategories
authors: G.S.H. Cruttwell and Michael A. Shulman
abstract: notion of generalize multicategory have be define in numerous context throughout the literature , and include such diverse example as symmetric multicategorie , globular operad , Lawvere theory , and topological space . in each case , generalized multicategorie be define as the ` ` lax algebra '' or ` ` kleisli monoid '' relative to a ` ` monad '' on a bicategory . however , the meaning of these word differ from author to author , as do the specific bicategorie consider . we propose a unified framework : by work with monad on double category and relate structure ( rather than bicategorie ) , one can define generalize multicategorie in a way that unify all previous example , while at the same time simplify and clarify much of the theory .

title: Higher Dimensional Algebra VII: Groupoidification
authors: John C. Baez, Alexander E. Hoffnung, and Christopher D. Walker
abstract: groupoidification be a form of categorification in which vector space be replace by groupoid and linear operator be replace by span of groupoid . we introduce this idea with a detailed exposition of ` degroupoidification ' : a systematic process that turn groupoid and span into vector space and linear operator . then we present three application of groupoidification . the first be to Feynman diagram . the hilbert space for the quantum harmonic oscillator arise naturally from degroupoidifye the groupoid of finite set and bijection . this allow for a purely combinatorial interpretation of creation and annihilation operator , their commutation relation , field operator , their normal - order power , and finally Feynman diagram . the second application be to Hecke algebra . we explain how to groupoidify the Hecke algebra associate to a Dynkin diagram whenever the deformation parameter $ q$ be a prime power . we illustrate this with the simple nontrivial example , come from the $ a_2 $ Dynkin diagram . in this example we show that the solution of the Yang -- Baxter equation build into the $ a_2 $ Hecke algebra arise naturally from the axiom of projective geometry apply to the projective plane over the finite field $ \mathbb{f}_q$. the third application be to Hall algebra . we explain how the standard construction of the Hall algebra from the category of $ \mathbb{f}_q$ representation of a simply - lace quiver can be see as an example of degroupoidification . this in turn provide a new way to categorify - or more precisely , groupoidify - the positive part of the quantum group associate to the quiver .

title: Internal profunctors and commutator theory;
abstract: we clarify the relationship between internal profunctor and connector on pair ( r , s ) of equivalence relation which originally appear in our new profunctorial approach of the Schreier - Mac Lane extension theorem . this clarification allow we to extend this Schreier - Mac Lane theorem to any exact Mal'cev category with centralizer . on the other hand , still in the Mal'cev context and in respect to the categorical Galois theory associate with a reflection i , it allow we to produce the faithful action of a certain abelian group on the set of class ( up to isomorphism ) of i - normal extension have a give Galois groupoid .

title: On the duality between trees and disks
abstract: a combinatorial category Disk be introduce by André Joyal to play a role in his definition of weak $ \omega$-category . he define the category $ \theta$ to be dual to Disk . in the ensue literature , a more concrete description of $ \theta$ be provide . in this paper we provide another proof of the dual equivalence and introduce various category equivalent to Disk or $ \theta$ , each provide a helpful viewpoint .

title: The span construction
authors: Robert Dawson, Robert Paré, Dorette Pronk
abstract: we present two generalization of the Span construction . the first generalization give Span of a category with all pullback as a ( weak ) double category . this double category Span A can be view as the free double category on the vertical category A where every vertical arrow have both a companion and a conjoint ( and these companion and conjoint be adjoint to each other ) . thus define , Span : Cat --&gt ; Doub become a 2 - functor , which be a partial left bi - adjoint to the forgetful functor Vrt : Doub --&gt ; Cat , which send a double category to its category of vertical arrow . the second generalization give Span of an arbitrary category as an oplax normal double category . the universal property can again be give in term of companion and conjoint and the presence of their composite . moreover , Span A be universal with this property in the sense that Span : Cat --&gt ; OplaxNDoub be leave bi - adjoint to the forgetful functor which send an oplax double category to its vertical arrow category .

title: A logic for categories
abstract: we present a doctrinal approach to category theory , obtain by abstract from the index inclusion ( via discrete fibration and opfibration ) of left and of right action of x in Cat in category over X. namely , a ` ` weak temporal doctrine '' consist essentially of two index functor with the same codomain such that the induce functor have both left and right adjoint satisfy some exactness condition , in the spirit of categorical logic . the derive logical rule include some adjunction - like law involve the truth - value - enrich hom and tensor functor , which condense several basic categorical property and display a nice symmetry . the symmetry become more apparent in the slightly strong context of ` ` temporal doctrine '' , which we initially treat and which include as an instance the inclusion of low and upper set in the part of a poset , as well as the inclusion of left and right action of a graph in the graph over it .

title: On *-autonomous categories of topological modules
authors: Michael Barr, John F. Kennison, and R. Raphael
abstract: let R be a commutative ring whose complete ring of quotient be r - injective . we show that the category of topological r - module contain a full subcategory that be * -autonomous use R itself as dualize object . in order to do this , we develop a new variation on the category chu(d , r ) , where D be the category of discrete r - module : the high wide subcategory , which we show equivalent to the category of reflexive topological module .

title: Lois distributives. Applications aux automates stochastiques
abstract: deterministic automaton be algebra of the monad $ t_m$ associate to a free monoid $ m$. to extend to nondeterministic and stochastic automaton such a monadic formalism , it be suitable to resort to a notion rich than the one of monad , but equally basic : the notion of distributive law between two monad . the notion of algebra on a monad be then generalize by the one of algebra for a distributive law . the nondeterministic and stochastic automaton be precisely algebra for distributive law whose first monad be $ t_m$. if the nondeterministic case involve a distributive law between $ T_M$ and the well - know power set monad , the stochastic case involve a distributive law between $ T_M$ ( where , here , $ m$ be a measurable monoid ) and the probability monad . this allow presentation of the stochastic automaton as algebra for this distributive law . this paper take place at the confluence of category , automata and probability theory , we have , for the convenience of the reader not aware of each area , make useful review about these subject ( in several appendix ) . we also recall the detailed construction of the probability monad ; and we construct precisely the distributive law which link it to the monad $ t_m$.

title: Tensor products of sup-lattices and generalized sup-arrows
abstract: an alternative description of the tensor product of sup - lattice be give with yet another description provide for the tensor product in the special case of CCD sup - lattice . in the course of develop the latter , property of sup - preserve function and the totally below relation be generalize to not - necessarily - complete order set .

title: The Hopf algebra of Möbius intervals
authors: F. W. Lawvere and M. Menni
abstract: an unpublished result by the first author state that there exist a Hopf algebra $ h$ such that for any Möbius category $ \cal c$ ( in the sense of Leroux ) there exist a canonical algebra morphism from the dual $ h^*$ of $ h$ to the incidence algebra of $ \cal c$ . moreover , the Möbius inversion principle in incidence algebra follow from a ` master ' inversion result in $ h^*$. the underlie module of $ h$ be originally define as the free module on the set of iso class of Möbius interval , i.e. Möbius category with initial and terminal object . here we consider a category of Möbius interval and construct the Hopf algebra via the objective approach apply to a monoidal extensive category of combinatorial object , with the value in appropriate ring be abstract from combinatorial functor on the object . the explicit consideration of a category of Möbius interval lead also to two new characterization of Möbius category .

title: Finitely presentable morphisms in exact sequences
abstract: let $ \cal k$ be a locally finitely presentable category . if $ \cal k$ be abelian and the sequence $ $ 0 \to k \to^k x \to^c c \to 0$$ be short exact , we show that 1 ) $ k$ be finitely generate iff $ c$ be finitely presentable ; 2 ) $ k$ be finitely presentable iff $ c$ be finitely presentable . the ` ` if " direction fail for semi - abelian variety . we show that all but ( possibly ) 2)(if ) follow from analogous property which hold in all locally finitely presentable category . as for 2)(if ) , it hold as soon as $ \cal k$ be also co - homological , and all its strong epimorphism be regular . finally , locally finitely coherent ( resp . noetherian ) abelian category be characterize as those for which all finitely presentable morphism have finitely generate ( resp . presentable ) kernel object .

title: On modified Reedy and modified projective model structures
abstract: variation on the notion of Reedy model structure and projective model structure on category of diagram in a model category be introduce . these allow one to choose only a subset of the entry when define weak equivalence , or to use different model category at different entry of the diagram . as a result , a bisimplicial model category that can be use to recover the algebraic k - theory for any Waldhausen subcategory of a model category be produce .

title: Transversal homotopy theory
abstract: implement an idea due to John Baez and James Dolan we define new invariant of Whitney stratify manifold by consider the homotopy theory of smooth transversal map . to each Whitney stratified manifold we assign transversal homotopy monoid , one for each natural number . the assignment be functorial for a natural class of map which we call stratified normal submersion . when the stratification be trivial the transversal homotopy monoid be isomorphic to the usual homotopy group . we compute some simple example and explore the elementary property of these invariant . we also assign ` high invariant ' , the transversal homotopy category , to each Whitney stratify manifold . these have a rich structure ; they be rigid monoidal category for n & gt ; 1 and ribbon category for n & gt ; 2 . as an example we show that the transversal homotopy category of a sphere , stratify by a point and its complement , be equivalent to category of frame tangle .

title: Topos theoretic aspects of semigroup actions
abstract: we define the notion of a torsor for an inverse semigroup , which be base on semigroup action , and prove that this be precisely the structure classify by the topo associate with an inverse semigroup . unlike in the group case , not all set - theoretic torsor be isomorphic : we shall give a complete description of the category of torsor . we explain how a semigroup prehomomorphism give rise to an adjunction between a restriction - of - scalar functor and a tensor product functor , which we relate to the theory of cover space and e - unitary semigroup . we also interpret for semigroup the Lawvere - product of a sheaf and distributio$ and finally , we indicate how the theory might be extend to general semigroup , by define a notion of torsor and a classify topo for those .

title: On a Conjecture by J.H.Smith
abstract: we show that the class of weak equivalence of a combinatorial model category can be detect by an accessible functor into simplicial set .

title: Monads as Extension Systems - No Iteration is Necessary
authors: F.  Marmolejo and R. J. Wood
abstract: we introduce a description of the algebra for a monad in term of extension system , similar to the one for monad give by Manes . we rewrite distributive law for monad and wreath in term of this description , avoid the iteration of the functor involve . we give a profunctorial explanation of why Manes ' description of monad in term of extension system work .

title: Hopf monoidal comonads
authors: Dimitri Chikhladze, Stephen Lack, and Ross Street
abstract: we generalize to the context internal to an autonomous monoidal bicategory the work of Bruguieres , Virelizier , and the second - name author on lift closed structure on a monoidal category to the category of Eilenberg - Moore algebra for an opmonoidal monad . the result then apply to quantum category and bialgebroid .

title: The Frobenius relations meet linear distributivity
abstract: the notion of Frobenius algebra originally arise in ring theory , but it be a fairly easy observation that this notion can be extend to arbitrary monoidal category . but , be this really the correct level of generalisation ? for example , when study Frobenius algebra in the * -autonomous category $ \Sup$ , the standard concept use only the usual tensor product be less interesting than a similar one in which both the usual tensor product and its de Morgan dual ( par ) be use . thus we maintain that the notion of linear - distributive category ( which have both a tensor and a par , but be nevertheless more general than the notion of monoidal category ) provide the correct framework in which to interpret the concept of Frobenius algebra .

title: Joyal's arithmetic universe as list-arithmetic pretopos
abstract: we explain in detail why the notion of list - arithmetic pretopo should be take as the general categorical definition for the construction of arithmetic universe introduce by André Joyal to give a categorical proof of Gödel 's incompleteness result .

title: Bicategories of spans as cartesian bicategories
authors: Stephen Lack, R.F.C. Walters, and R.J. Wood
abstract: bicategorie of span be characterize as cartesian bicategorie in which every comonad have an Eilenberg - Moore object and every left adjoint arrow be comonadic .

title: Symbolic dynamics and the category of graphs
abstract: symbolic dynamics be partly the study of walk in a direct graph . by a walk , here we mean a morphism to the graph from the Cayley graph of the monoid of non - negative integer . set of these walk be also important in other area , such as stochastic process , automaton , combinatorial group theory , $ c^*$-algebra , etc . we put a Quillen model structure on the category of direct graph , for which the weak equivalence be those graph morphism which induce bijection on the set of walk . we determine the result homotopy category . we also introduce a " finite - level " homotopy category which respect the natural topology on the set of walk . to each graph we associate a basal graph , well define up to isomorphism . we show that the basal graph be a homotopy invariant for our model structure , and that it be a fine invariant than the zeta series of a finite graph . we also show that , for finite walkable graph , if $ b$ be basal and separated then the walk space for $ x$ and $ B$ be topologically conjugate if and only if $ X$ and $ b$ be homotopically equivalent for our model structure .

title: Differential restriction categories
authors: J.R.B. Cockett, G.S.H. Cruttwell,  and J. D. Gallagher
keywords: Rational functions and the  Rational monad
abstract: we combine two recent idea : cartesian differential category , and restriction category . the result be a new structure which axiomatize the category of smooth map define on open subset of $ r^n$ in a way that be completely algebraic . we also give other model for the result structure , discuss what it mean for a partial map to be additive or linear , and show that differential restriction structure can be lift through various completion operation .

title: Countable meets in coherent spaces with applications to the cyclic spectrum
authors: Michael Barr, John F. Kennison, and R. Raphael
abstract: this paper review the basic property of coherent space , characterize they , and prove a theorem about countable meet of open set . a number of example of coherent space be give , include the set of all congruence ( equip with the Zariski topology ) of a model of a theory base on a set of partial operation . we also give two alternate proof of the main theorem , one use a theorem of Isbell 's and a second use an unpublished theorem of Makkai 's . finally , we apply these result to the boolean cyclic spectrum and give some relevant example .

title: On reflective-coreflective equivalence and associated pairs

abstract: we show that a reflective / coreflective pair of full subcategorie satisfy a ` ` maximal - normal''-type equivalence if and only if it be an associate pair in the sense of Kelly and Lawvere .

title: Lax Presheaves and Exponentiability
abstract: the category of Set - value presheave on a small category b be a topos . replace Set by a bicategory s whose object be set and morphism be span , relation , or partial map , we consider a category lax(b , S ) of s - value lax functor on B. when S = span , the result category be equivalent to Cat / B , and hence , be rarely even cartesian closed . restrict this equivalence give rise to exponentiability characterization for Lax(B , Rel ) by Niefield and for Lax(B , Par ) in this paper . along the way , we obtain a characterization of those b for which the category UFL / B be a coreflective subcategory of Cat / B , and hence , a topos .

title: Flows: cocyclic and almost cocyclic
authors: Michael Barr, John F. Kennison, and R. Raphael
abstract: a flow on a compact Hausdorff space be an automorphism . use the closed structure on the category of uniform space , a flow give rise , by iteration , to an action of the integer on the topological group of automorphism of the object . we study special class of flow : periodic , cocyclic , and almost cocyclic , mainly in term of the possibility of extend this action continuously to various compactification of the integer .

title: Semidirect products and crossed modules in varieties of right $\Omega$-loops
abstract: we present a new explicit construction of categorical semidirect product in an arbitrary variety v of right $ \omega$-loops and use it to obtain simplified description of internal precrosse and cross module in v.

title: Yoneda theory for double categories

title: The Faà di Bruno construction
abstract: in the context of cartesian differential category , the structure of the first - order chain rule give rise to a fibration , the ` ` bundle category '' . in the present paper we generalise this to the high - order chain rule ( originally develop in the traditional setting by Faà di Bruno in the nineteenth century ) ; give any cartesian differential category x , there be a ` ` high - order chain rule fibration '' faa(x ) --&gt ; x over it . in fact , Faa be a comonad ( over the category of cartesian left ( semi-)additive category ) . our main theorem be that the coalgebra for this comonad be precisely the cartesian differential category . in a sense , this result affirm the ` ` correctness '' of the notion of cartesian differential category .

title: On involutive monoidal categories
abstract: in this paper , we consider a non - posetal analogue of the notion of involutive quantale ; specifically , a ( planar ) monoidal category equip with a covariant involution that reverse the order of tensoring . we study the coherence issue that inevitably result when pass from poset to category ; we also link our subject with other notion already in the literature , such as balance monoidal category and dagger pivotal category .

title: Covariant presheaves and subalgebras
abstract: for small involutive and integral quantaloid $ { \cal q}$ it be show that covariant presheave on symmetric $ { \cal q}$-categorie be equivalent to certain subalgebra of a specific monad on the category of symmetric $ { \cal q}$-categorie . this construction be relate to a weakening of the subobject classifier axiom which do not require the classification of all subalgebra , but only guarantee that classifiable subalgebra be uniquely classifiable . as an application the identification of closed left ideal of non - commutative $ c^*$-algebra with certain " open " , subalgebra of freely generate algebra be give .

title: Towards a homotopy theory of higher dimensional transition systems
abstract: we prove in a previous work that Cattani - Sassone 's high dimensional transition system can be interpret as a small - orthogonality class of a topological locally finitely presentable category of weak higher dimensional transition system . in this paper , we turn our attention to the full subcategory of weak higher dimensional transition system which be union of cube . it be prove that there exist a left proper combinatorial model structure such that two object be weakly equivalent if and only if they have the same cube after simplification of the labelling . this model structure be obtain by Bousfield localize a model structure which be leave determined with respect to a class of map which be not the class of monomorphism . we prove that the higher dimensional transition system correspond to two process algebra be weakly equivalent if and only if they be isomorphic . we also construct a second Bousfield localization in which two bisimilar cubical transition system be weakly equivalent . the appendix contain a technical lemma about smallness of weak factorization system in coreflective subcategorie which can be of independent interest . this paper be a first step towards a homotopical interpretation of bisimulation for higher dimensional transition system .

title: Symmetry and Cauchy completion of quantaloid-enriched categories
abstract: we formulate an elementary condition on an involutive quantaloid $ q$ under which there be a distributive law from the Cauchy completion monad over the symmetrisation comonad on the category of $ q$-enriche category . for such quantaloid , which we call cauchy - bilateral quantaloid , it follow that the Cauchy completion of any symmetric $ q$-enriche category be again symmetric . example include Lawvere 's quantale of non - negative real number and Walters ' small quantaloid of closed crible .

title: A small observation on co-categories
abstract: various concern suggest look for internal co - category in category with strong logical structure . it turn out that in any coherent category e , all co - category be co - equivalence relation .

title: Model-categories of coalgebras over operads

title: Higher categorified algebras versus bounded homotopy algebras

abstract: we define Lie 3 - algebra and prove that these be in 1 - to-1 correspondence with the 3 - term Lie infinity algebra whose bilinear and trilinear map vanish in degree ( 1,1 ) and in total degree 1 , respectively . far , we give an answer to a question of Roytenberg pertain to the use of the nerve and normalization functor in the study of the relationship between categorifie algebra and truncate sh algebra .

title: An embedding theorem for adhesive categories
abstract: adhesive category be category which have pushout with one leg a monomorphism , all pullback , and certain exactness condition relate these pushout and pullback . we give a new proof of the fact that every topos be adhesive . we also prove a converse : every small adhesive category have a fully faithful functor in a topos , with the functor preserve the all the structure . combine these two result , we see that the exactness condition in the definition of adhesive category be exactly the relationship between pushout along monomorphism and pullback which hold in any topos .

title: Reflective-coreflective equivalence

abstract: we explore a curious type of equivalence between certain pair of reflective and coreflective subcategorie . we illustrate with example involve noncommutative duality for $ c^*$-dynamical system and compact quantum group , as well as example where the subcategorie be actually isomorphic .

title: Monoidal functor categories and graphic Fourier transforms
abstract: this article represent a preliminary attempt to link Kan extension , and some of their further development , to Fourier theory and quantum algebra through * -autonomous monoidal category and related structure . there be a close resemblance to convolution product and the Wiener algebra ( of transform ) in functional analysis . the analysis term ` ` kernel '' ( of a distribution ) have also be adapt below in connection with certain special type of ` ` distributor '' ( in the terminology of J. Benabou ) or ` ` module '' ( in the terminology of R. Street ) in category theory . in use the term ` ` graphic '' , in a very broad sense , we be clearly distinguish the categorical method employ in this article from standard Fourier and wavelet mathematic . the term ` ` graphic '' also apply to promultiplicative graph , and related concept , which can feature prominently in the theory .

title: Comparative smootheology
abstract: we compare various different definition of " the category of smooth object " . the definition compare be due to Chen , Frolicher , Sikorski , Smith , and Souriau . the method of comparison be to construct functor between the category that enable we to see how the category relate to each other . our method of study involve find a general context into which these category can be place . this involve consider category wherein object be consider in relation to a certain collection of standard test object . this therefore apply beyond the question of category of smooth space .

title: Remarks on punctual local connectedness
abstract: we study the condition , on a connected and locally connect geometric morphism $ p : \cal e \to \cal s$ , that the canonical natural transformation $ p_*\to p_!$ should be ( pointwise ) epimorphic - a condition which F.W. Lawvere call the ` nullstellensatz ' , but which we prefer to call ` punctual local connectedness ' . we show that this condition imply that $ p_!$ preserve finite product , and that , for bound morphism between topos with natural number object , it be equivalent to be both local and hyperconnected .

title: Tangled circuits
authors: R. Rosebrugh, N. Sabadini and R. F. C. Walters
abstract: we consider commutative Frobenius algebra in braided strict monoidal category in the study of the circuit and communicate system which occur in Computer Science , include circuit in which the wire be tangle . we indicate also some possible novel geometric interest in such algebra . for example , we show how Armstrong 's description of knot colouring and knot group fit into this context .

title: Internal categories, anafunctors and localisations
abstract: in this article we review the theory of anafunctor introduce by Makkai and Bartels , and show that give a subcanonical site $ s$ , one can form a bicategorical localisation of various 2 - category of internal category or groupoid at weak equivalence use anafunctor as 1 - arrow . this unify a number of proof throughout the literature , use the few assumption possible on $ S$.

title: A remark about the Connes fusion tensor product
abstract: we analyze the algebraic structure of the Connes fusion tensor product ( CFTP ) in the case of bi - finite Hilbert module over a von Neumann algebra M. it turn out that all complication in its definition disappear if one use the closely relate bi - module of bound vector . we construct an equivalence of monoidal category with duality between a category of Hilbert bi - module over M with CFTP and some natural category of bi - module over M with the usual relative algebraic tensor product .

title: Décalage and Kan's simplicial loop group functor
abstract: give a bisimplicial set , there be two way to extract from it a simplicial set : the diagonal simplicial set and the less well know total simplicial set of Artin and Mazur . there be a natural comparison map between these simplicial set , and it be a theorem due to Cegarra and Remedios and independently Joyal and Tierney , that this comparison map be a weak homotopy equivalence for any bisimplicial set . in this paper we will give a new , elementary proof of this result . as an application , we will revisit Kan 's simplicial loop group functor $ g$. we will give a simple formula for this functor , which be base on a factorization , due to Duskin , of Eilenberg and Mac Lane 's classify complex functor $ \overline{w}$. we will give a new , short , proof of Kan 's result that the unit map for the adjunction $ g\dashv \overline{w}$ be a weak homotopy equivalence for reduce simplicial set .

title: A category of quantum categories
abstract: quantum category be introduce by Day and Street as generalization of both bi(co)algebroid and small category . we clarify detail of that work . in particular , we show explicitly how the monadic definition of a quantum category unpack to a set of axiom close to the definition of a bialgebroid in the Hopf algebraic literature . we introduce notion of functor and natural transformation for quantum category and consider various construction on quantum structure .

title: Site characterizations for geometric invariants of toposes
abstract: we discuss the problem of characterize the property of a Grothendieck topos to satisfy a give ` geometric ' invariant as a property of its site of definition , and indicate a set of general technique for establish such criterion . we then apply our methodology to specific invariant , notably include the property of a Grothendieck topos to be localic ( resp . atomic , locally connected , equivalent to a presheaf topos ) , obtain explicit site characterization for they .

title: Span, cospan, and other double categories
abstract: give a double category $ \mathbb d$ such that $ \mathbb d_0 $ have pushout , we characterize oplax / lax adjunction between $ \mathbb d$ and $ cospan(\mathbb d_0)$ for which the right adjoint be normal and restrict to the identity on $ \mathbb d_0 $ , where $ cospan(\mathbb d_0)$ be the double category on $ \mathbb d_0 $ whose vertical morphism be cospan . we show that such a pair exist if and only if $ \mathbb d$ have companion , conjoint , and 1 - cotabulator . the right adjoint be induce by the companion and conjoint , and the left adjoint by the 1 - cotabulator . the notion of a 1 - cotabulator be a common generalization of the symmetric algebra of a module and Artin - Wraith glueing of topos , locale , and topological space .

title: Isotropy and crossed toposes
authors: Jonathon Funk, Pieter Hofstra and Benjamin Steinberg
abstract: motivate by construction in the theory of inverse semigroup and etale groupoid , we define and investigate the concept of isotropy from a topos - theoretic perspective . our main conceptual tool be a monad on the category of group topos . its algebra correspond to a generalize notion of cross module , which we call a cross topos . as an application , we present a topos - theoretic characterization and generalization of the ` Clifford , fundamental ' sequence associate with an inverse semigroup .

title: Duality and traces for indexed monoidal categories
abstract: by the Lefschetz fix point theorem , if an endomorphism of a topological space be fix - point - free , then its Lefschetz number vanish . this necessary condition be not usually sufficient , however ; for that we need a refinement of the Lefschetz number call the Reidemeister trace . abstractly , the Lefschetz number be a trace in a symmetric monoidal category , while the Reidemeister trace be a trace in a bicategory ; in this paper we relate these context use index symmetric monoidal category . in particular , we will show that for any symmetric monoidal category with an associate index symmetric monoidal category , there be an associate bicategory which produce refinement of trace analogous to the Reidemeister trace . this bicategory also produce a new notion of trace for parametrize space with dualizable fiber , which refine the obvious ` ` fiberwise '' trace by incorporate the action of the fundamental group of the base space . we also advance the basic theory of index monoidal category , include introduce a string diagram calculus which make calculation much more tractable . this abstract framework lay the foundation for generalization of these idea to other context .

title: Bimonadicity and the explicit basis property
abstract: let $ { l\dashv r:\cal x \rightarrow\cal y}$ be an adjunction with $ r$ monadic and $ l$ comonadic . denote the induce monad on $ \cal y$ by $ M$ and the induce comonad on $ \calX$ by $ c$ . we characterize those $ C$ such that $ m$ satisfy the Explicit Basis property . we also discuss some new example and result motivate by this characterization .

title: Yoneda representations of flat functors and classifying toposes
abstract: we obtain semantic characterization , hold for any Grothendieck site $ ( c , j)$ , for the model of a theory classify by a topos of the form $ sh(c , j)$ in term of the model of a theory classify by a topos $ [ c^{op } , set]$. these characterization arise from an appropriate representation of flat functor into Grothendieck topos base on an application of the Yoneda Lemma in conjunction with idea from index category theory , and turn out to be relevant also in different context , in particular for address question in classical Model Theory .

title: Modeling stable one-types
abstract: classification of homotopy $ n$-type have focus on develop algebraic category which be equivalent to category of $ n$-type . we expand this theory by provide algebraic model of homotopy - theoretic construction for stable one - type . these include a model for the Postnikov one - truncation of the sphere spectrum , and for its action on the model of a stable one - type . we show that a bicategorical cokernel introduce by Vitale model the cofiber of a map between stable one - type , and apply this to develop an algebraic model for the Postnikov datum of a stable one - type .

title: Opetopes and chain complexes
abstract: we give a simple algebraic description of opetope in term of chain complex , and we show how this description be relate to combinatorial description in term of treelike structure . more generally , we show that the chain complex associate to high category generate graphlike structure . the algebraic description give a relationship between the opetopic approach and other approach to high category theory . it also give an easy way to calculate the source and target of opetope .

title: Range categories II: Towards regularity
authors: J.R.B. Cockett, Xiuzhan Guo and Pieter Hofstra
abstract: in this paper , which be the second part of a study of partial map category with image , we investigate the interaction between image and various other kind of categorical structure and property . in particular , we consider image in the context of partial product , meet and discreteness and survey a taxonomy of structure lead towards the partial map category of regular category . we also present a term logic for cartesian partial map category with image and prove a soundness and completeness theorem for this logic . finally , we exhibit several free construction relate the different class of category under consideration .

title: Range categories I: General theory
authors: J.R.B. Cockett, Xiuzhan Guo and Pieter Hofstra
abstract: in this two - part paper , we undertake a systematic study of abstract partial map category in which every map have both a restriction ( domain of definition ) and a range ( image ) . in this first part , we explore connection with related structure such as inverse category and allegory , and establish two representational result . the first of these explain how every range category can be fully and faithfully embed into a category of partial map equip with a suitable factorization system . the second be a generalization of a result from semigroup theory by Boris Schein , and say that every small range category satisfy the additional condition that every map be an epimorphism onto its range can be faithfully embed into the category of set and partial function with the usual notion of range . finally , we give an explicit construction of the free range category on a partial map category in term of certain type of label tree .

title: A presheaf interpretation of the generalized Freyd conjecture
authors: Anna Marie Bohmann and J. P. May
abstract: we give a generalized version of the Freyd conjecture and a way to think about a possible proof . the essential point be to describe an elementary formal reduction of the question that hold in any triangulate category . there be no new result , but at least one know example drop out very easily .

title: Skew monoidales, skew warpings and quantum categories
abstract: Kornel Szlachanyi recently use the term skew - monoidal category for a particular laxified version of monoidal category . he show that bialgebroid $ h$ with base ring $ r$ could be characterize in term of skew - monoidal structure on the category of one - sided $ r$-module for which the lax unit be $ R$ itself . we define skew monoidale ( or skew pseudo - monoid ) in any monoidal bicategory $ \cal m$. these be skew - monoidal category when $ \cal m$ be $ cat$. our main result be present at the level of monoidal bicategorie . however , a consequence be that quantum category with base comonoid $ c$ in a suitably complete braided monoidal category $ \cv$ be precisely skew monoidale in $ comod ( \cal v)$ with unit come from the counit of $ c$ . quantum groupoid ( in the sense of Chikhladze et al rather than Day and Street ) be those skew monoidale with invertible associativity constraint . in fact , we provide some very general result connect opmonoidal monad and skew monoidale . we use a lax version of the concept of warping define by Booker and Street to modify monoidal structure .

title: Biequivalences in tricategories
abstract: we show that every internal biequivalence in a tricategory $ t$ be part of a biadjoint biequivalence . we give two application of this result , one for transport monoidal structure and one for equip a monoidal bicategory with invertible object with a coherent choice of those inverse .

title: Injective hulls of partially ordered monoids
authors: J. Lambek, Michael Barr, John F. Kennison, R. Raphael
abstract: we find the injective hull of partially order monoid in the category whose object be po - monoid and submultiplicative order - preserve function . these injective hull be with respect to a special class of monic call ` ` embedding '' . we show as well that the injective object with respect to these embedding be precisely the quantale .

title: Congruences of Morita equivalent small categories
abstract: two category be call Morita equivalent if the category of functor from these category to the category of set be equivalent . we prove that congruence lattice of Morita equivalent small category be isomorphic .

title: The coalgebraic structure of cell complexes
abstract: the relative cell complex with respect to a generate set of cofibration be an important class of morphism in any model structure . in the particular case of the standard ( algebraic ) model structure on Top , we give a new expression of these morphism by define a category of relative cell complex , which have a forgetful functor to the arrow category . this allow we to prove a conjecture of Richard Garner : consider the algebraic weak factorisation system give in that algebraic model structure between cofibration and trivial fibration , we show that the category of relative cell complex be equivalent to the category of coalgebra .

title: Notes on Bimonads and Hopf Monads
abstract: for a generalisation of the classical theory of Hopf algebra over field , A. Bruguièeres and A. Virelizier study opmonoidal monad on monoidal category ( which they call bimonad , ) . in a recent joint paper with S. Lack the same author define the notion of a pre - hopf monad by require only a special form of the fusion operator to be invertible . in previous paper it be observe by the present author that bimonad yield a special case of an entwining of a pair of functor ( on arbitrary category ) . the purpose of this note be to show that in this setting the pre - hopf monad be a special case of Galois entwining . as a byproduct some new property be detect which make a ( general ) bimonad on a cauchy complete category to a Hopf monad . in the final section application to cartesian monoidal category be consider .

title: Graphical Methods for Tannaka duality of weak bialgebras and weak Hopf algebras
abstract: Tannaka duality describe the relationship between algebraic object in a give category and functor into that category ; an important case be that of Hopf algebra and their category of representation ; these have strong monoidal forgetful ` ` fibre functor '' to the category of vector space . we simultaneously generalize the theory of Tannaka duality in two way : first , we replace Hopf algebra with weak Hopf algebra and strong monoidal functor with separable Frobenius monoidal functor ; second , we replace the category of vector space with an arbitrary braided monoidal category . to accomplish this goal , we make use of a graphical notation for functor between monoidal category , use string diagram with coloured region . not only do this notation extend our capacity to give simple proof of complicated calculation , it make plain some of the connection between Frobenius monoidal or separable Frobenius monoidal functor and the topology of the axiom define certain algebraic structure . finally , having generalize Tannaka duality to an arbitrary base category , we briefly discuss the functoriality of the construction as this base be vary .

title: A characterization of representable intervals
abstract: in this note we provide a characterization , in term of additional algebraic structure , of those strict interval ( certain cocategory object ) in a symmetric monoidal closed category $ \cal e$ that be representable in the sense of induce on $ \cal e$ the structure of a finitely bicomplete 2 - category . several example and connection with the homotopy theory of 2 - category be also discuss .

title: Note on star-autonomous comonads
abstract: we develop an alternative approach to star - autonomous comonad via linearly distributive category . it be show that in the autonomous case the notion of star - autonomous comonad and Hopf comonad coincide .

title: Syntactic characterizations of properties of classifying toposes
abstract: we give characterization , for various fragment of geometric logic , of the class of theory classify by a locally connect ( respectively connect and locally connect , atomic , compact , presheaf ) topos , and exploit the existence of multiple site of definition for a give topos to establish various result on quotient of theory of presheaf type .

title: Closed categories vs. closed multicategories
abstract: we prove that the 2 - category of closed category of Eilenberg and Kelly be equivalent to a suitable full 2 - subcategory of the 2 - category of closed multicategorie .

title: Commutative monads as a theory of distributions
abstract: it be show how the theory of commutative monad provide an axiomatic framework for several aspect of distribution theory in a broad sense , include probability distribution , physical extensive quantity , and Schwartz distribution of compact support . among the particular aspect consider here be the notion of convolution , density , expectation , and conditional probability .

title: On diagram-chasing in double complexes
abstract: we construct , for any double complex in an abelian category , certain ` ` short - distance '' map , and an exact sequence involve these , instance of which can be piece together to give the ` ` long - distance '' map and exact sequence of result such as the Snake Lemma . further application be give . we also note what the building block of an analogous study of triple complex would be .

title: On the iteration of weak wreath products
abstract: base on a study of the 2 - category of weak distributive law , we describe a method of iterate Street 's weak wreath product construction . that is , for any 2 - category $ cal k$ and for any non - negative integer $ n$ , we introduce 2 - category $ \wdl^{(n)}(\cal k)$ , of $ ( n+1)$-tuple of monad in $ \cal k$ pairwise relate by weak distributive law obey the Yang - Baxter equation . the first instance $ \wdl^{(0)}(\cal k)$ coincide with $ \mnd(\cal k)$ , the usual 2 - category of monad in $ \cal k$ , and for other value of $ n$ , $ \wdl^{(n)}(\cal k)$ contain $ \mnd^{n+1}(\ck)$ as a full 2 - subcategory . for the local idempotent closure $ \overline \cal k$ of $ \cal k$ , extend the multiplication of the 2 - monad $ \mnd$ , we equip these 2 - category with $ n$ possible ` weak wreath product ' 2 - functor $ \wdl^{(n)}(\ock)\to \wdl^{(n-1)}(\overline \cal k)$ , such that all of their possible $ n$-fold composite $ \wdl^{(n)}(\overline \cal k)\to \wdl^{(0)}(\overline \cal k)$ be equal ; that be , such that the weak wreath product be ` associative ' . whenever idempotent 2 - cell in $ \cal k$ split , this lead to pseudofunctor $ \wdl^{(n)}(\cal k)\to \wdl^{(n-1)}(\cal k)$ obey the associativity property up - to isomorphism . we present a practically important occurrence of an iterate weak wreath product : the algebra of observable quantity in an Ising type quantum spin chain where the spin take their value in a dual pair of finite weak Hopf algebra . we also construct a fully faithful embedding of $ \wdl^{(n)}(\overline \cal k)$ into the 2 - category of commutative $ n+1 $ dimensional cube in $ \mnd(\overline \cal k)$ ( hence into the 2 - category of commutative $ n+1 $ dimensional cube in $ \cal k$ whenever $ \cal k$ have Eilenberg - Moore object and its idempotent 2 - cell split ) . finally we give a sufficient and necessary condition on a monad in $ \overline \cal k$ to be isomorphic to an $ n$-ary weak wreath product .

title: Kan extensions and lax idempotent pseudomonads
abstract: we show that colax idempotent pseudomonad and their algebra can be present in term of right Kan extension . dually , lax idempotent pseudomonad and their algebra can be present in term of left Kan extension . we also show that a distributive law of a colax idempotent pseudomonad over a lax idempotent pseudomonad have a presentation in term of Kan extension .

title: An equational metalogic for monadic equational systems
abstract: the paper present algebraic and logical development . from the algebraic viewpoint , we introduce Monadic Equational Systems as an abstract enrich notion of equational presentation . from the logical viewpoint , we provide Equational Metalogic as a general formal deductive system for the derivability of equational consequence . relate the two , a canonical model theory for Monadic Equational Systems be give and for it the soundness of Equational Metalogic be establish . this development involve a study of clone and double - dualization structure . we also show that in the presence of free algebra % construction the model theory of Monadic Equational Systems satisfy an internal strong - completeness property .

title: Elementary quotient completion
authors: Maria Emilia Maietti and Giuseppe Rosolini
abstract: we extend the notion of exact completion on a category with weak finite limit to Lawvere 's elementary doctrine . we show how any such doctrine admit an elementary quotient completion , which be the universal solution to add certain quotient . we note that the elementary quotient completion can be obtain as the composite of two other universal construction : one add effective quotient , the other force extensionality of morphism . we also prove that each construction preserve comprehension .

title: Generalized Hopf modules for bimonads
authors: Marcelo Aguiar and Stephen U. Chase
abstract: Bruguières , Lack and Virelizier have recently obtain a vast generalization of Sweedler 's Fundamental Theorem of Hopf module , in which the role of the Hopf algebra be play by a bimonad . we present an extension of this result which involve , in addition to the bimonad , a comodule - monad and a algebra - comonoid over it . as an application we obtain a generalization of another classical theorem from the Hopf algebra literature , due to Schneider , which itself be an extension of Sweedler 's result ( to the setting of Hopf Galois extension ) .

title: Composition of modules for lax functors
abstract: we study the composition of module between lax functor of weak double category . we adapt the bicategorical notion of local cocompleteness to weak double category , which the codomain of our lax functor will be assume to satisfy . we introduce a notion of factorization of cell , which most weak double category of interest possess , and which be sufficient to guarantee the strong representability of composite of module between lax functor whose domain satisfy it .

title: On actions and strict actions in homological categories
abstract: let $ G$ be an object of a finitely cocomplete homological category $ \mathbb c$ . we study action of $ g$ on object $ a$ of $ \mathbb c$ ( define by Bourn and Janelidze as be algebra over a certain monad $ \mathbb t_g$ ) , with two objective : investigate to which extent action can be describe in term of small datum , call action core ; and to single out those abstract action core which extend to action correspond to semi - direct product of $ a$ and $ g$ ( in a non - exact setting , not every action do ) . this amount to exhibit a subcategory of the category of the action of $ g$ on object $ a$ which be equivalent with the category of point in $ \mathbb c$ over $ g$ , and to describe it in term of action core . this notion and its study be base on a preliminary investigation of co - smash product , in which cros - effect of functor in a general categorical context turn out to be a useful tool . the co - smash product also allow we to define high categorical commutator , different from the one of Huq , which be not generally expressible in term of nest binary one . we use strict action core to show that any normal subobject of an object $ e$ ( i.e. , the equivalence class of $ 0 $ for some equivalence relation on $ e$ in $ \mathbb c$ ) admit a strict conjugation action of $ e$. if $ \mathbb c$ be semi - abelian , we show that for subobject $ x$ , $ y$ of some object $ a$ , $ x$ be proper in the supremum of $ x$ and $ y$ if and only if $ x$ be stable under the restriction to $ y$ of the conjugation action of $ a$ on itself . this also amount to an alternative proof of Bourn and Janelidze 's category equivalence between point over $ g$ in $ \mathbb c$ and action of $ g$ in the semi - abelian context . finally , we show that the two axiom of an algebra which characterize $ g$-actions be equivalent with three other one , in term of action core . these axiom be commutative square involve only co - smash product . two of they be associativity type condition which generalize the usual property of an action of one group on another , while the third be kind of a high coherence condition which be a consequence of the other two in the category of group , but probably not in general . as an application , we characterize abelian action core , that be , action core correspond to Beck module ; here also the coherence condition follow from the other .

title: Lawvere completeness as a topological property
abstract: Lawvere 's notion of completeness for quantale - enrich category have be extend to the theory of lax algebra under the name of l - completeness . in this paper we introduce the correspond morphism concept and examine its property . we explore some important relativized topological concept like separatedness , denseness , compactness and compactification with respect to l - complete morphism . moreover , we show that separate l - complete morphism belong to a factorization system .

title: Proper maps for lax algebras and the Kuratowski-Mrówka theorem
authors: Maria Manuel Clementino and Walter Tholen
abstract: the characterization of stably closed map of topological space as the closed map with compact fibre and the role of the Kuratowski - Mrówka ' theorem in this characterization be be explore in the general context of lax ( t , v)-algebra , for a quantale v and a Set - monad T with a lax extension to v - relation . the general result be be apply in standard ( topological and metric ) and non - standard ( labeled graph ) context .

title: Descent in monoidal categories
abstract: we consider a symmetric monoidal closed category $ v = ( v , \otime , i , [ -,-])$ together with a regular injective object $ q$ such that the functor $ [ - , q ] : \to v^{op}$ be comonadic and prove that in such a category , as in the monoidal category of abelian group , a morphism of commutative monoid be an effective descent morphism for module if and only if it be a pure monomorphism . example of this kind of monoidal category be elementary topos consider as cartesian closed monoidal category , the module category over a commutative ring object in a Grothendieck topos and Barr 's star - autonomous category .

title: The *-autonomous category of uniform sup semi-lattices
authors: Michael Barr, John F. Kennison, and R. Raphael
abstract: in 2001 Barr and Kleisli describe * -autonomous structure on two full subcategorie of topological abelian group . in this paper we do the same for sup semi - lattice except that uniform structure play the role that topology do in the early paper .

title: Higher central extensions via commutators
authors: Diana Rodelo and Tim Van der Linden
abstract: we prove that all semi - abelian category with the the Smith be Huq property satisfy the Commutator Condition(CC ): high central extension may be characterise in term of binary ( Huq or Smith ) commutator . in fact , even Higgins commutator suffice . as a consequence , in the presence of enough projective we obtain explicit Hopf formula for homology with coefficient in the abelianisation functor , and an interpretation of cohomology with coefficient in an abelian object in term of equivalence class of high central extension . we also give a counterexample against ( cc ) in the semi - abelian category of ( commutative ) loop .

title: The Ursini commutator as normalized Smith-Pedicchio commutator
abstract: we introduce an intrinsic description of the Ursini commutator in any ideal determine category and we compare it with the Higgins and Huq commutator . after describe also the Smith - Pedicchio commutator by mean of canonical arrow from a coproduct , we compare the two notion , show that in any exact Mal'tsev normal category the Ursini commutator $ [ h , k]_{u}$ of two subobject $ h , k$ of $ a$ be the normalization of the Smith - Pedicchio commutator of the equivalence relation generate by $ h$ and $ k$ , extend the result valid for ideal determine variety give by Ursini and Gumm .

title: Exact completions and small sheaves
abstract: we prove a general theorem which include most notion of " exact completion " as special case . the theorem be that " κ - ary exact category " be a reflective sub-2 - category of " κ - ary site " , for any regular cardinal κ . a κ - ary exact category be an exact category with disjoint and universal κ - small coproduct , and a κ - ary site be a site whose covering sieve be generate by κ - small family and which satisfy a solution - set condition for finite limit relative to κ . in the unary case , this include the exact completion of a regular category , of a category with ( weak ) finite limit , and of a category with a factorization system . when κ = ω it include the pretopos completion of a coherent category . and when κ=∞ be the size of the universe , it include the category of sheaf on a small site , and the category of small presheave on a locally small and finitely complete category . the ∞-ary exact completion of a large nontrivial site give a well - behave " category of small sheaf " . along the way , we define a slightly generalized notion of " morphism of site " and show that κ - ary site be equivalent to a type of " enhance allegory " . this enable we to construct the exact completion in two way , which can be regard as decategorification of " representable profunctor " ( i.e. entire functional relation ) and " anafunctor " , respectively .

title: Symmetry of regular diamonds, the Goursat property, and subtractivity
authors: Marino Gran, Zurab Janelidze, Diana Rodelo and Aldo Ursini
abstract: we investigate $ 3$-permutability , in the sense of universal algebra , in an abstract categorical setting which unify the pointed and the non - pointed context in categorical algebra . this lead to a unified treatment of regular subtractive category and of regular Goursat category , as well as of $ e$-subtractive variety ( where $ e$ be the set of constant in a variety ) recently introduce by the fourth author . as an application , we show that ` ` ideal '' coincide with ` ` clot '' in any regular subtractive category , which can be consider as a pointed analogue of a know result for regular Goursat category .

title: Weakly Mal'tsev categories and strong relations
abstract: we define a strong relation in a category $ \mathbb{c}$ to be a span which be ` ` orthogonal '' to the class of jointly epimorphic pair of morphism . under the presence of finite limit , a strong relation be simply a strong monomorphism $ r\rightarrow x\times y$. we show that a category $ \mathbb{c}$ with pullback and equalizer be a weakly Mal'tsev category if and only if every reflexive strong relation in $ \mathbb{c}$ be an equivalence relation . in fact , we obtain a more general result which include , as its another particular instance , a similar well - know characterization of Mal'tsev category .

title: On the axioms for adhesive and quasiadhesive categories
abstract: a category be adhesive if it have all pullback , all push - out along monomorphism , and all exactness condition between pullback and pushout along monomorphism which hold in a topos . this condition can be modify by consider only pushout along regular monomorphism , or by ask only for the exactness condition which hold in a quasitopos . we prove four characterization theorem deal with adhesive category and their variant .

title: Exponentiability via double categories
abstract: for a small category $ b$ and a double category $ \mathbb d$ , let $ { \rm lax}_n(b,\mathbb d)$ denote the category whose object be vertical normal lax functor $ b\to\mathbb d$ and morphism be horizontal lax transformation . it be well know that $ lax_n(b , \mathbb Cat ) \simeq Cat / b$ , where $ \mathbb Cat$ be the double category of small category , functor , and profunctor . we generalize this equivalence to certain double category , in the case where $ b$ be a finite poset . Street show that $ y\to b$ be exponentiable in $ cat / b$ if and only if the correspond normal lax functor $ b\to \mathbb cat$ be a pseudo - functor . use our generalized equivalence , we show that a morphism $ y\to b$ be exponentiable in $ { \mathbb d}_0 / b$ if and only if the corresponding normal lax functor $ b\to\mathbb d$ be a pseudo - functor plus an additional condition that hold for all $ x\to ! B$ in $ Cat$. thus , we obtain a single theorem which yield characterization of certain exponentiable morphism of small category , topological space , locale , and poset .

title: The core of adjoint functors
abstract: there be a lot of redundancy in the usual definition of adjoint functor . we define and prove the core of what be require . first we do this in the hom - enrich context . then we do it in the cocompletion of a bicategory with respect to Kleisli object , which we then apply to internal category . finally , we describe a doctrinal setting .

title: Remarks on exactness notions pertaining to pushouts
abstract: we call a finitely complete category diexact if every difunctional relation admit a pushout which be stable under pullback and itself a pullback . we prove three result relate to diexact category : firstly , that a category be a pretopos if and only if it be diexact with a strict initial object ; secondly , that a category be diexact if and only if it be Barr - exact , and every pair of monomorphism admit a pushout which be stable and a pullback ; and thirdly , that a small category with finite limit and pushout of difunctional relation be diexact if and only if it admit a full structure - preserve embedding into a Grothendieck topos .

title: Galois theories of commutative semigroups via semilattices
authors: Isabel A. Xarez and Joao J. Xarez
abstract: the class of stably - vertical , normal , separable , inseparable , purely inseparable and cover morphism , define in categorical Galois theory , be characterize for the reflection of the variety of commutative semigroup into its subvariety of semilattice . it be also show that there be an inseparable - separable factorization , but there be no monotone - light factorization .

title: The Gleason cover of a realizability topos
abstract: recently Benno ~ van ~ den ~ Berg introduce a new class of realizability topos which he christen Herbrand topos . these topos have strikingly different property from ordinary realizability topos , notably the ( related ) property that the ` constant object ' functor from the topo of set preserve finite coproduct , and that De Morgan 's law be satisfied . in this paper we show that these property be no accident : for any Schonfinkel algebra $ \Lambda$ , the Herbrand realizability topo over $ \Lambda$ may be obtain as the Gleason cover ( in the sense of Johnstone ( 1980 ) ) of the ordinary realizability topo over $ \Lambda$. as a corollary , we obtain the functoriality of the Herbrand realizability construction on the category of Schonfinkel algebra and computationally dense applicative morphism .

title: Tannaka--Krein duality for compact quantum homogeneous spaces. I. General theory
authors: Kenny De Commer and Makoto Yamashita
abstract: an ergodic action of a compact quantum group $ g$ on an operator algebra $ a$ can be interpret as a quantum homogeneous space for $ g$. such an action give rise to the category of finite equivariant Hilbert module over $ a$ , which have a module structure over the tensor category $ rep(g)$ of finite - dimensional representation of $ g$. we show that there be a one - to - one correspondence between the quantum $ g$-homogeneous space up to equivariant Morita equivalence , and indecomposable module $ c^*$-categorie over $ rep(g)$ up to natural equivalence . this give a global approach to the duality theory for ergodic action as develop by C. Pinzari and J. Roberts .

title: On theories of superalgebras of differentiable functions
abstract: this be the first in a series of paper lay the foundation for a differential graded approach to derive differential geometry ( and other geometry in characteristic zero ) . in this paper , we study theory of supercommutative algebra for which infinitely differentiable function can be evaluate on element . such a theory be call a super fermat theory . any category of superspace and smooth function have an associate such theory . this include both real and complex supermanifold , as well as algebraic superscheme . in particular , there be a super fermat theory of $ c^\infty$-superalgebra . $ c^\infty$-superalgebra be the appropriate notion of supercommutative algebra in the world of $ c^\infty$-ring , the latter be of central importance both to synthetic differential geometry and to all exist model of derive smooth manifold . a super Fermat theory be a natural generalization of the concept of a Fermat theory introduce by E. Dubuc and A. Kock . we show that any Fermat theory admit a canonical superization , however not every super Fermat theory arise in this way . for a fixed super Fermat theory , we go on to study a special subcategory of algebra call near - point determine algebra , and derive many of their algebraic property .

title: A double categorical model of weak 2-categories
abstract: we introduce the notion of weakly globular double category , a particular class of strict double category , as a way to model weak 2 - category . we show that this model be suitably equivalent to bicategorie and give an explicit description of the functor involve in this biequivalence . as an application we show that groupoidal weakly globular double category model homotopy 2 - type .

title: Relative Mal'tsev categories
authors: Tomas Everaert, Julia Goedecke, Tamar Janelidze-Gray and Tim Van der Linden
abstract: we define relative regular Mal'tsev category and give an overview of condition which be equivalent to the relative Mal'tsev axiom . these include condition on relation as well as condition on simplicial object . we also give various example and counterexample .

title: Forms and exterior differentiation in Cartesian differential categories
abstract: cartesian differential category abstractly capture the notion of a differentiation operation . in this paper , we develop some of the theory of such category by define differential form and exterior differentiation in this setting . we show that this exterior derivative , as expect , produce a cochain complex .

title: Multitensor lifting and strictly unital higher category theory
authors: Michael Batanin, Denis-Charles Cisinski and Mark Weber
abstract: in this article we extend the theory of lax monoidal structure , also know as multitensor , and the monad on category of enrich graph that they give rise to . our first principal result - the lifting theorem for multitensor - enable we to see the Gray tensor product of 2 - category and the Crans tensor product of Gray category as part of this framework . we define weak $ n$-categorie with strict unit by mean of a notion of reduce high operad , use the theory of algebraic weak factorisation system . our second principal result be to establish a lax tensor product on the category of weak $ n$-categorie with strict unit , so that enrich category with respect to this tensor product be exactly weak ( n+1)-categorie with strict unit .

title: Multitensors as monads on categories of enriched graphs
abstract: in this paper we unify the development of Batanin [ 1998 ] , Batanin - Weber [ 2011 ] and Cheng [ 2011 ] into a single framework in which the interplay between multitensor on a category $ v$ , and monad on the category $ \cal g v$ of graph enrich in $ v$ , be take as fundamental . the material present here be the conceptual background for subsequent work : in Batanin - Cisinski - Weber [ 2013 ] the Gray tensor product of 2 - category and the Crans [ 1999 ] tensor product of Gray category be exhibit as exist within our framework , and in Weber [ 2013 ] the explicit construction of the funny tensor product of category be generalise to a large class of Batanin operad .

title: Complicial structures in the nerves of omega-categories
abstract: it be know that strict omega - category be equivalent through the nerve functor to complicial set and to set with complicial identity . it follow that complicial set be equivalent to set with complicial identity . we discuss these equivalence . in particular we give a conceptual proof that the nerve of omega - category be complicial set , and a direct proof that complicial set be set with complicial identity .

title: The algebra of the nerves of omega-categories
abstract: we show that the nerve of a strict omega - category can be describe algebraically as a simplicial set with additional operation subject to certain identity . the result structure be call set with complicial identity . we also construct an equivalence between the category of strict omega - category and of set with complical identity .

title: Tight spans, Isbell completions and semi-tropical modules
abstract: in this paper we consider generalized metric space in the sense of Lawvere and the categorical Isbell completion construction . we show that this be an analogue of the tight span construction of classical metric space , and that the Isbell completion coincide with the direct tight span of Hirai and Koichi . the notion of categorical completion and cocompletion be relate to the existence of semi - tropical module structure , and it be show that the Isbell completion ( hence the direct tight span ) have two different semi - tropical module structure .

title: Enriched indexed categories
abstract: we develop a theory of category which be simultaneously ( 1 ) index over a base category $ s$ with finite product , and ( 2 ) enrich over an $ s$-indexe monoidal category $ v$. this include classical enrich category , index and fibere category , and internal category as special case . we then describe the appropriate notion of ` ` limit '' for such enriched index category , and show that they admit ` ` free cocompletion '' construct as usual with a Yoneda embedding .

title: Categories enriched over a quantaloid: Isbell adjunctions and Kan adjunctions
abstract: each distributor between category enrich over a small quantaloid Q give rise to two adjunction between the category of contravariant and covariant presheave , and hence to two monad . these two adjunction be respectively generalization of Isbell adjunction and Kan extension in category theory . it be prove that these two process be functorial with infomorphism play as morphism between distributor ; and that the free cocompletion functor of q - category factor through both of these functor .

title: Sur les types d'homotopie modélisés par les $\infty$-groupoides stricts
abstract: the purpose of this text be the study of the class of homotopy type which be modelize by strict $ \infty$-groupoids . we show that the homotopy category of simply connect strict $ \infty$-groupoids be equivalent to the derive category in homological degree $ d \ge 2 $ of abelian group . we deduce that the simply connect homotopy type modelize by strict $ \infty$-groupoids be precisely the product of Eilenberg - Mac Lane space . we also briefly study 3 - category with weak inverse . we finish by two question about the problem suggest by the title of this text .

title: Subgroupoids and quotient theories
abstract: Moerdijk 's site description for equivariant sheaf topos on open topological groupoid be use to give a proof for the ( known , but apparently unpublished ) proposition that if $ h$ be a subgroupoid of an open topological groupoid $ g$ , then the topo of equivariant sheaf on $ H$ be a subtopos of the topo of equivariant sheaf on $ g$. this proposition be then apply to the study of quotient geometric theory and subtopose . in particular , an intrinsic characterization be give of those subgroupoid that be definable by quotient theory .

title: Connections on non-Abelian gerbes and their holonomy
abstract: we introduce an axiomatic framework for the parallel transport of connection on gerbe . it incorporate parallel transport along curve and along surface , and be formulate in term of gluing axiom and smoothness condition . the smoothness condition be impose with respect to a strict Lie 2 - group , which play the role of a band , or structure 2 - group . upon choose certain example of Lie 2 - group , our axiomatic framework reproduce in a systematical way several know concept of gerbe with connection : non - abelian differential cocycle , Breen - Messing gerbe , abelian and non - abelian bundle gerbe . these relationship convey a well - define notion of surface holonomy from our axiomatic framework to each of these concrete model . till now , holonomy be only know for abelian gerbe ; our approach reproduce that know concept and extend it to non - abelian gerbe . several new feature of surface holonomy be expose under its extension to non - abelian gerbe ; for example , it carry an action of the mapping class group of the surface .

title: Bounded Archimedean l-algebras and Gelfand-Neumark-Stone duality
authors: Guram Bezhanishvili, Patrick J. Morandi, Bruce Olberding
abstract: by Gelfand - Neumark duality , the category $ c^*alg$ of commutative $ c^*$-algebra be dually equivalent to the category of compact Hausdorff space , which by Stone duality , be also dually equivalent to the category $ ubal$ of uniformly complete bounded archimedean $ \ell$-algebra . consequently , $ c^*alg$ be equivalent to $ ubal$ , and this equivalence can be describe through complexification . in this article we study $ ubal$ within the large category $ bal$ of bounded archimedean $ \ell$-algebra . we show that $ ubal$ be the small nontrivial reflective subcategory of $ bal$ , and that $ ubal$ consist of exactly those object in $ bal$ that be epicomplete , a fact that include a categorical formulation of the Stone - Weierstrass theorem for $ bal$. it follow that $ ubal$ be the unique nontrivial reflective epicomplete subcategory of $ bal$. we also show that each nontrivial reflective subcategory of $ bal$ be both monoreflective and epireflective , and exhibit two other interesting reflective subcategorie of $ bal$ involve Gelfand ring and square closed ring . dually , we show that Specker $ { \mathbb r}$-algebra be precisely the co - epicomplete object in $ bal$. we prove that the category $ spec$ of Specker $ \mathbb r$-algebra be a mono - coreflective subcategory of $ bal$ that be co - epireflective in a mono - coreflective subcategory of $ bal$ consist of what we term $ \ell$-clean ring , a version of clean ring adapt to the order - theoretic setting of $ bal$. we conclude the article by discuss the import of our result in the setting of complex $ * $ -algebra through complexification .

title: Tensors, monads and actions
abstract: we exhibit sufficient condition for a monoidal monad $ t$ on a monoidal category $ c$ to induce a monoidal structure on the Eilenberg -- Moore category $ c^t$ that represent bimorphism . the category of action in $ c^t$ be then show to be monadic over the base category $ C$ .

title: n-tuple groupoids and optimally coupled factorizations
abstract: in this paper , we prove that the category of vacant $ n$-tuple groupoid be equivalent to the category of factorization of groupoid by $ n$ factor that satisfy some Yang - Baxter type equation . moreover we extend this equivalence to the category of maximally exclusive $ n$-tuple groupoid , which we define , by drop one assumption . the paper conclude by a note on how these result could tell we more about some lie group of interest .

title: Homotopy theories of diagrams
abstract: suppose that S be a space . there be an injective and a projective model structure for the result category of space with s - action , and both be easily derive . these model structure be special case of model structure for presheaf - value diagram $ x$ define on a fix presheaf of category e which be enrich in simplicial set . vary the parameter category object E ( or parameter space s ) along with the diagram x up to weak equivalence require model structure for E - diagram have weak equivalence define by homotopy colimit , and a generalization of Thomason 's model structure for small category to a model structure for presheave of simplicial category .

title: No-iteration pseudomonads
