abstract: we present the no - iteration version of the coherence condition necessary to define a pseudomonad , and a description of the algebra for it in a similar fashion . we show that every no - iteration pseudomonad induce a pseudomonad , and that the correspond algebra be equivalent . we also show that every pseudomonad induce a no - iteration pseudomonad , and again , that the correspond algebra be equivalent . we conclude with an analysis of the algebra for the 2 - monad $ ( -)^{\mathbf{2}}$ on Cat in the light of the no - iteration description of the algebra .

title: Codensity and the ultrafilter monad
abstract: even a functor without an adjoint induce a monad , namely , its codensity monad ; this be subject only to the existence of certain limit . we clarify the sense in which codensity monad act as substitute for monad induce by adjunction . we also expand on an undeservedly ignore theorem of Kennison and Gildenhuys : that the codensity monad of the inclusion of ( finite set ) into ( set ) be the ultrafilter monad . this result be analogous to the correspondence between measure and integral . so , for example , we can speak of integration against an ultrafilter . use this language , we show that the codensity monad of the inclusion of ( finite - dimensional vector space ) into ( vector space ) be double dualization . from this it follow that compact Hausdorff space have a linear analogue : linearly compact vector space . finally , we show that ultraproduct be categorically inevitable : the codensity monad of the inclusion of ( finite family of set ) into ( family of set ) be the ultraproduct monad .

title: Diagonal model structures
abstract: the category of bisimplicial presheave carry a model structure for which the weak equivalence be define by the diagonal functor and the cofibration be monomorphism . this model structure have the most cofibration of a large family of model structure with weak equivalence define by the diagonal . the diagonal structure for bisimplicial presheave specialize to a diagonal model structure for bisimplicial set , for which the fibration be the Kan fibration .

title: Geometric morphisms of realizability toposes
abstract: we show that every geometric morphism between realizability topos satisfy the condition that its inverse image commute with the ` constant object ' functor , which be assume by John Longley in his pioneering study of such morphism . we also provide the answer to something which be state as an open problem on Jaap van Oosten 's book on realizability topos : if a subtopos of a realizability topos be ( co)complete , it must be either the topo of set or the degenerate topo . and we present a new and simple condition equivalent to the notion of computational density for applicative morphism of Schonfinkel algebra .

title: Tightly bounded completions
abstract: by a ` completion ' on a 2 - category K we mean here an idempotent pseudomonad on K. we be particularly interested in pseudomonad that arise from kz - doctrine . motivate by a question of Lawvere , we compare the Cauchy completion , define in the setting of V - Cat for V a symmetric monoidal closed category , with the Grothendieck completion , define in the setting of S - Indexed Cat for S a topos . to this end we introduce a unified setting ( ` indexed enriched category theory ' ) in which to formulate and study certain property of kz - doctrine . we find that , whereas all of the KZ - doctrine that be relevant to this discussion ( Karoubi , Cauchy , Stack , Grothendieck ) may be regard as ` bounded ' , only the Cauchy and the Grothendieck completion be ` tightly bounded ' - two notion that we introduce and study in this paper . tightly bound KZ - doctrine be show to be idempotent . we also show , in a different approach to answer the motivate question , that the Cauchy completion ( define use ` distributor ' ) and the Grothendieck completion ( define use ` generalized functor ' ) be actually equivalent construction .

title: Traced *-autonomous categories are compact closed
abstract: we show that any trace $ * $ -autonomous category be compact closed .

title: On the monad of internal groupoids
abstract: we deeply analyse the structural organisation of the fibration of point and of the monad of internal groupoid . from that we derive : 1 ) a new characterization of internal groupoid among reflexive graph in the Mal'cev context ; 2 ) a setting in which a Mal'cev category be necessarily a protomodular category .

title: Semiunital semimonoidal categories (Applications to semirings and semicorings)
abstract: the category $ _ { a}\mathbb{s}_{a}$ of bisemimodule over a semialgebra $ a,$ with the so call Takahashi 's tensor - like product $ -\boxtime _ { a}-,$ be semimonoidal but not monoidal . although not a unit in $ _ { a}\mathbb{s}% _ { A},$ the base semialgebra $ a$ have property of a semiunit ( in a sense which we clarify in this note ) . motivate by this interesting example , we investigate semiunital semimonoidal category $ ( \mathcal{v}% , \bullet , \mathbf{i})$ as a framework for study notion like semimonoid ( semicomonoid ) as well as a notion of monad ( comonad ) which we call $ \mathbb{j}$-monads ( $ \mathbb{j}$-comonad ) with respect to the endo - functor $ \mathbb{j}:=\mathbf{i}\bullet -\simeq -\bullet \mathbf{i}:\mathcal{v}\longrightarrow \mathcal{v}.$ this motivate also introduce a more generalized notion of monad ( comonad ) in arbitrary category with respect to arbitrary endo - functor . application to the semiunital semimonoidal variety $ ( _ { a}\mathbb{s}_{a},\boxtimes _ { a},a ) $ provide we with example of semiunital $ a$ -semiring ( semicounital $ a$ -semicoring ) and semiunitary semimodule ( semicounitary semicomodule ) which extend the classical notion of unital ring ( counital coring ) and unitary module ( counitary comodule ) .

title: Duality for distributive spaces
abstract: the main source of inspiration for the present paper be the work of R. Rosebrugh and R.J. Wood on constructively completely distributive lattice where the author elegantly employ the concept of adjunction and module . both notion ( suitably adapt ) be available in topology too , which permit we to investigate topological , metric and other kind of space in a similar spirit . we introduce here the notion of distributive space and algebraic space and show in particular that the category of distributive space and colimit preserve map be dually equivalent to the idempotent split completion of a category of space and convergence relation between they . we explain the connection of this result to the well - know duality between topological space and frame , and deduce further duality theorem .

title: Tannaka duality and convolution for duoidal categories
abstract: give a horizontal monoid $ m$ in a duoidal category $ \cal f$ , we examine the relationship between bimonoid structure on $ M$ and monoidal structure on the category $ \cal f^{\ast m}$ of right $ m$-module which lift the vertical monoidal structure of $ \cal f$. we obtain our result use a variant of the so - call Tannaka adjunction ; that be , an adjunction induce the equivalence which express Tannaka duality . the approach take utilize hom - enriched category rather than category on which a monoidal category act ( ` ` actegorie '' ) . the requirement of enrichment in $ \cal f$ itself demand the existence of some internal hom , lead to the consideration of convolution for duoidal category . prove that certain hom - functor be monoidal , and so take monoid to monoid , unify classical convolution in algebra and Day convolution for category . hopf bimonoid be define lead to a lifting of closed structure on $ \cal f$ to $ \cal f^{\ast m}$. we introduce the concept of warp monoidal structure and this permit the construction of new duoidal category .

title: Free products of higher operad algebras
abstract: one of the open problem in high category theory be the systematic construction of the higher dimensional analogue of the Gray tensor product of 2 - category . in this paper we continue the development of [ Batanin - Weber , 2011 ] , [ Weber , 2011 ] and [ Batanin - Cisinski - Weber , 2011 ] by understand the natural generalisation of Gray 's little brother , the funny tensor product of category . in fact we exhibit for any high categorical structure definable by a normalised n - operad in the sense of Batanin , an analogous tensor product which form a symmetric monoidal closed structure on the category of algebra of the operad .

title: The monoidal structure of strictification
abstract: we study the monoidal structure of the standard strictification functor $ st : bicat \rightarrow 2cat$. in do so , we construct monoidal structure on the 2 - category whose object be bicategorie and on the 2 - category whose object be 2 - category .

title: Iterated icons
abstract: we study the totality of category weakly enrich in a monoidal bicategory use a notion of enrich icon as 2 - cell . we show that when the monoidal bicategory in question be symmetric then this process can be iterate . we show that start from the symmetric monoidal bicategory Cat and perform the construction twice yield a convenient symmetric monoidal bicategory of partially strict tricategorie . we show that restrict to the doubly degenerate one immediately give the correct bicategory of ` 2 - tuply monoidal category ' miss from our early study of the Periodic Table . we propose a generalisation to all $ k$-tuply monoidal $ n$-categorie .

title: More on geometric morphisms between realizability toposes
authors: Eric Faber and Jaap van Oosten
abstract: geometric morphism between realizability topos be study in term of morphism between partial combinatory algebra ( pcas ) . the morphism induce geometric morphism ( the computationally dense one ) be see to be the one whose ` lift ' to a kind of completion have right adjoint . we characterize topos inclusion correspond to a general form of relative computability . we characterize pca whose realizability topos admit a geometric morphism to the effective topo .

title: Bicategorical fibration structures and stacks
authors: Dorette A. Pronk and Michael A. Warren
abstract: in this paper we introduce two notion - system of fibrant object and fibration structures--- which will allow we to associate to a bicategory $ b$ a homotopy bicategory $ ho(b)$ in such a way that $ ho(b)$ be the universal way to add pseudo - inverse to weak equivalence in $ B$. furthermore , $ ho(b)$ be locally small when $ b$ be and $ ho(b)$ be a 2 - category when $ b$ be . we thereby resolve two of the problem with known approach to bicategorical localization . as an important example , we describe a fibration structure on the 2 - category of prestack on a site and prove that the result homotopy bicategory be the 2 - category of stack . we also show how this example can be restrict to obtain algebraic , differentiable and topological ( respectively ) stack as homotopy category of algebraic , differential and topological ( respectively ) prestack .

title: A Serre-Swan theorem for gerbe modules on étale Lie groupoids
authors: Christoph Schweigert, Christopher Tropp and Alessandro Valentino
abstract: give a torsion bundle gerbe on a compact smooth manifold or , more generally , on a compact étale Lie groupoid M , we show that the correspond category of gerbe module be equivalent to the category of finitely generate projective module over an Azumaya algebra on M. this result can be see as an equivariant Serre - Swan theorem for twist vector bundle .

title: Completion, closure, and density relative to a monad, with examples in functional analysis and sheaf theory
abstract: give a monad $ t$ on a suitable enriched category $ B$ equip with a proper factorization system $ ( e , M)$ , we define notion of $ t$-completion , $ t$-closure , and $ t$-density . we show that not only the familiar notion of completion , closure , and density in normed vector space , but also the notion of sheafification , closure , and density with respect to a Lawvere - Tierney topology , be instance of the give abstract notion . the process of $ t$-completion be equally the enriched idempotent monad associate to $ T$ ( which we call the idempotent core of $ t$ ) , and we show that it exist as soon as every morphism in $ b$ factor as a $ t$-dense morphism follow by a $ t$-closed $ m$-embedding . the latter hypothesis be satisfied as soon as $ b$ have certain pullback as well as wide intersection of $ m$-embedding . hence the result theorem on the existence of the idempotent core of an enriched monad entail Fakir 's existence result in the non - enriched case , as well as adjoint functor factorization result of Applegate - Tierney and Day .

title: On pointwise Kan extensions in double categories
abstract: in this paper we consider a notion of pointwise Kan extension in double category that naturally generalise Dubuc 's notion of pointwise Kan extension along enriched functor . we show that , when consider in equipment that admit opcartesian tabulation , it generalise Street 's notion of pointwise Kan extension in $ 2$-categorie .

title: Diagrammatic characterisation of enriched absolute colimits
abstract: we provide a diagrammatic criterion for the existence of an absolute colimit in the context of enriched category theory .

title: Stacks and sheaves of categories as fibrant objects, I
abstract: we show that the category of category fibre over a site be a generalized Quillen model category in which the weak equivalence be the local equivalence and the fibrant object be the stack , as they be define by J. Giraud . the generalized model category restrict to one on the full subcategory whose object be the category fibre in groupoid . we show that the category of sheaf of category be a model category that be Quillen equivalent to the generalized model category for stack and to the model category for strong stack due to A. Joyal and M. Tierney .

title: Continuous cohesion over sets
abstract: a pre - cohesive geometric morphism $ p:\cal e \rightarrow \cal s$ satisfy Continuity if the canonical $ p _ ! ( x^{p^ * s } ) \rightarrow ( p _ ! x)^s$ be an iso for every $ x$ in $ \cal e$ and $ s$ in $ \cal s$. we show that if $ \cal s = set$ and $ \cal e$ be a presheaf topos then , $ p$ satisfy Continuity if and only if it be a quality type . our proof of this characterization rest on a related result show that Continuity and Sufficient Cohesion be incompatible for presheaf topos . this incompatibility raise the question whether Continuity and Sufficient Cohesion be ever compatible for Grothendieck topos . we show that the answer be positive by build some example .

title: Constructing model categories with prescribed fibrant objects
abstract: we present a weak form of a recognition principle for Quillen model category due to J.H. Smith . we use it to put a model category structure on the category of small category enrich over a suitable monoidal simplicial model category . the proof use a part of the model structure on small simplicial category due to J. Bergner . we give an application of the weak form of Smith 's result to leave Bousfield localization of category of monoid in a suitable monoidal model category .

title: Realizable homotopy colimits
abstract: we show that the composition of a homotopically meaningful ` geometric realization ' ( or simple functor ) with the simplicial replacement produce all homotopy colimit and Kan extension in a relative category which be close under coproduct . example ( and its dual ) include model category , $ \delta$-closed class and other concrete example such as complex on ( AB4 ) abelian category , ( filtered ) commutative dg algebra and mix Hodge complex . the result homotopy colimit satisfy the expected property as cofinality and Fubini , and be moreover colimit in a suitable 2 - category of relative category . conversely , the existence of homotopy colimit satisfy these property guarantee that $ hocolim_{\delta^o}$ be a simple functor .

title: On deformations of pasting diagrams, II
authors: Tej Shrestha and D. N. Yetter
abstract: we continue the development of the infinitesimal deformation theory of pasting diagram of $ k$-linear category begin in TAC , Vol 22 , # 2 . in that article the standard result that all obstruction be cocycle be establish only for the elementary , composition - free part of pasting diagram . in the present work we give a proof for pasting diagram in general . as tool we use the method develop by Shrestha of simultaneously represent formula for obstruction , along with the correspond cocycle and cobounding condition by suitably label polygon , give a rigorous exposition of the previously heuristic method ; and deformation of pasting diagram in which some cell be require to be deform trivially .

title: Sequential multicategories
abstract: we study the monoidal closed category of symmetric multicategorie , especially in relation with its cartesian structure and with sequential multicategorie ( whose arrow be sequence of concurrent arrow in a give category ) . then we consider cartesian multicategorie in a similar perspective and develop some peculiar item such as algebraic product . several classical fact arise as a consequence of this analysis when some of the multicategorie involve be representable .

title: Enriched factorization systems
abstract: in a paper of 1974 , Brian Day employ a notion of factorization system in the context of enriched category theory , replace the usual diagonal lifting property with a correspond criterion phrase in term of hom - object . we set forth the basic theory of such enrich factorization system . in particular , we establish stability property for enrich prefactorization system , we examine the relation of enrich to ordinary factorization system , and we provide general result for obtain enrich factorization by mean of wide ( co)intersection . as a special case , we prove result on the existence of enriched factorization system involve enriched strong monomorphism or strong epimorphism .

title: Extending obstructions to noncommutative functorial spectra
authors: Benno van den Berg and Chris Heunen
abstract: any functor from the category of c*-algebra to the category of locale that assign to each commutative c*-algebra its Gelfand spectrum must be trivial on algebra of $ n$-by-$n$ matrix for $ n \geq 3$. this obstruction also apply to other spectrum such as those name after Zariski , Stone , and Pierce . we extend these no - go result to functor with value in ( ringed ) topological space , ( ringed ) topos , scheme , and quantale . the possibility of spectrum in other category be discuss .

title: Toward categorical risk measure theory
abstract: we introduce a category that represent vary risk as well as ambiguity . we give a generalized conditional expectation as a presheaf for this category , which not only work as a traditional conditional expectation give a $ \sigma$-field but also be compatible with change of measure . then , we reformulate dynamic monetary value measure as a presheaf for the category . we show how some axiom of dynamic monetary value measure in the classical setting be deduce as theorem in the new formulation , which be evidence that the axiom be correct . finally , we point out the possibility of give a theoretical criterion with which we can pick up appropriate set of axiom require for monetary value measure to be good , use a topology - as - axiom paradigm .

title: Projective lines as groupoids with projection structure
abstract: the coordinate projective line over a field be see as a groupoid with a further ` projection ' structure . we investigate conversely to what extent such an , abstractly give , groupoid may be coordinatize by a suitable field construct out of the geometry .

title: A Bayesian characterization of relative entropy
authors: John C. Baez and Tobias Fritz
abstract: we give a new characterization of relative entropy , also know as the Kullback -- Leibler divergence . we use a number of interesting category relate to probability theory . in particular , we consider a category FinStat where an object be a finite set equip with a probability distribution , while a morphism be a measure - preserve function $ f \map x \to y$ together with a stochastic right inverse $ s \map y \to x$. the function $ f$ can be think of as a measurement process , while $ s$ provide a hypothesis about the state of the measure system give the result of a measurement . give this data we can define the entropy of the probability distribution on $ X$ relative to the ` prior ' give by push the probability distribution on $ y$ forwards along $ s$. we say that $ s$ be ` optimal ' if these distribution agree . we show that any convex linear , low semicontinuous functor from FinStat to the additive monoid $ [ 0,\infty]$ which vanish when $ s$ be optimal must be a scalar multiple of this relative entropy . our proof be independent of all early characterization , but inspire by the work of Petz .

title: Topological functors as total categories
abstract: a notion of central importance in categorical topology be that of topological functor . a faithful functor $ \cal e \to \cal b$ be call topological if it admit cartesian lifting of all ( possibly large ) family of arrow ; the basic example be the forgetful functor $ top \to set$. a topological functor $ \cal e \to 1 $ be the same thing as a ( large ) complete preorder , and the general topological functor $ \cal e \to \cal b$ be intuitively think of as a " complete preorder relative to $ \cal b$ " . we make this intuition precise by consider an enrichment base $ \cal q_\cal b$ such that $ \cal q_\cal b$-enriche category be faithful functor into $ \cal b$ , and show that , in this context , a faithful functor be topological if and only if it be total (= totally cocomplete ) in the sense of Street - Walters . we also consider the MacNeille completion of a faithful functor to a topological one , first describe by Herrlich , and show that it may be obtain as an instance of Isbell 's generalised notion of MacNeille completion for enrich category .

title: On the infinity category of homotopy Leibniz algebras
authors: David Khudaverdyan, Norbert Poncin, Jian Qiu
abstract: we discuss various concept of $ \infty$-homotopie , as well as the relation between they ( focusse on the Leibniz type ) . in particular $ \infty$-$n$-homotopie appear as the $ n$-simplice of the nerve of a complete Lie $ { \infty}$-algebra . in the nilpotent case , this nerve be know to be a Kan complex . we argue that there be a quasi - category of $ \infty$-algebra and show that for truncated $ \infty$-algebra , i.e. categorifie algebra , this $ \infty$-categorical structure project to a strict 2 - categorical one . the paper contain a shortcut to $ ( \infty,1)$-categorie , as well as a review of Getzler 's proof of the Kan property . we make the latter concrete by apply it to the 2 - term $ \infty$-algebra case , thus recover the concept of homotopy of Baez and Crans , as well as the correspond composition rule \cite{ss07 } . we also answer a question of Shoikhet about composition of $ \infty$-homotopie of $ \infty$-algebra .

title: Duality in non-abelian algebra I. From cover relations to Grandis  ex2-categories
abstract: the aim of this series of paper be to develop a self - dual categorical approach to some topic in non - abelian algebra , which be base on replace the framework of a category with that of a category equip with a functor to it . the present paper give some preliminary step in this direction , where several know structure on a category , which arise in the categorical treatment of these topic , be view as such functor ; as a result , we obtain some new conceptual link between these structure .

title: The theory and practice of Reedy categories
abstract: the goal of this paper be to demystify the role play by the Reedy category axiom in homotopy theory . with no assume prerequisite beyond a healthy appetite for category theoretic argument , we present streamlined proof of a number of useful technical result , which be well know to folklore but difficult to find in the literature . while the result present here be not new , our approach to their proof be somewhat novel . specifically , we reduce much of the hard work involve to simple computation involve weighted colimit and Leibniz ( pushout - product ) construction . the general theory be develop in parallel with example , which we use to prove that familiar formula for homotopy limit and colimit indeed have the desire property .

title: The weakly globular double category of fractions of a category
abstract: this paper introduce the construction of a weakly globular double category of fraction for a category and study its universal property . it show that this double category be locally small and consider a couple of concrete example .

title: Twisted actions of categorical groups
authors: Saikat Chatterjee,  Amitabha Lahiri, and  Ambar N. Sengupta
abstract: we develop a theory of twisted action of categorical group use a notion of semidirect product of category . we work through numerous example to demonstrate the power of these notion . turn to representation , which be action that respect vector space structure , we establish an analog of Schur 's lemma in this context . keep new terminology to a minimum , we concentrate on example explore the essential new notion introduce .

title: Analytic spectrum of rig categories
abstract: we define the analytic spectrum of a rig category $ ( a,\oplus,\otimes)$ , and equip it with a sheaf of category of rational function . if the category be additive , we define a sheaf of category of analytic function . we relate this construction to Berkovich 's analytic space , to Durov 's generalized scheme and to Haran 's f - scheme . we use these relation to define analytic version of Arakelov compactification of affine arithmetic variety .

title: Mapping Spaces of Gray-Categories
abstract: we define a mapping space for Gray - enrich category adapt to high gauge theory . our construction differ significantly from the canonical mapping space of enrich category in that it be much less rigid . the two essential ingredient be a path space construction for Gray - category and a kind of comonadic resolution of the 1 - dimensional structure of a give Gray - category obtain by lift the resolution of ordinary category along the canonical fibration of GrayCat over Cat .

title: A Galois theory for monoids
authors: Andrea Montoli, Diana Rodelo and Tim Van der Linden
abstract: we show that the adjunction between monoid and group obtain via the Grothendieck group construction be admissible , relatively to surjective homomorphism , in the sense of categorical Galois theory . the central extension with respect to this Galois structure turn out to be the so - call special homogeneous surjection .

title: On the image of the almost strict Morse n-category under almost strict  n-functors
abstract: in an early work , we construct the almost strict Morse n - category $ \mathcal x$ which extend Cohen and Jones and Segal 's flow category . in this article , we define two other almost strict n - category $ \mathcal v$ and $ \mathcal w$ where $ \mathcal v$ be base on homomorphism between real vector space and $ \mathcal w$ consist of tuple of positive integer . the Morse index and the dimension of the Morse modulus space give rise to almost strict n - category functor $ \mathcal f : \mathcal x \to \mathcal v$ and $ \mathcal G : \mathcal x \to \mathcal w$.

title: Obvious natural morphisms of sheaves are unique
abstract: we prove that a large class of natural transformation ( consist roughly of those construct via composition from the ` ` functorial '' or ` ` base change '' transformation ) between two functor of the form $ ... f^ * g _ * ... $ actually have only one element , and thus that any diagram of such map necessarily commute . we identify the precise axiom define what we call a ` ` geofibered category '' that ensure that such a coherence theorem exist . our result apply to all the usual sheaf - theoretic context of algebraic geometry . the analogous result that would include any other of the six functor remain unknown .

title: Erratum to `Towards a homotopy theory of higher dimensional transition   systems'
abstract: counterexample for proposition~8.1 and proposition~8.2 in the article Theor . Appl . Categ . 25(2011 ) , pp 295 - 341 be give . they be use in the paper only to prove corollary~8.3 . a proof of this corollary be give without they . the proof of the fibrancy of some cubical transition system be fix .

title: Some stability properties of epimorphism classes
abstract: it be prove that in any pointed category with pullback , coequalizer and regular epi - mono factorization , the class of regular epimorphism be stable under pullback along the so - call balanced effective descent morphism . here ` ` balanced '' can be omit if the category be additive . a balanced effective descent morphism be define as an effective descent morphism $ p : e\rightarrow b$ such that any subobject of $ E$ be a pullback of some morphism along $ p$. it be show that , in any category with pullback and coequalizer , the class of effective descent morphism be stable under pushout if and only if any regular epimorphism be an effective descent morphism . moreover , it be show that the class of descent morphism be stable under pushout if and only if the class of regular epimorphism be stable under pullback .

title: On the 3-representations of groups and the 2-categorical traces
keywords: the 3-representation of a group in a 3-category
abstract: to 2 - categorify the theory of group representation , we introduce the notion of the 3 - representation of a group in a strict 3 - category and the strict 2 - categorical action of a group on a strict 2 - category . we also 2 - categorify the concept of the trace by introduce the 2 - categorical trace of a 1 - endomorphism in a strict 3 - category . for a 3 - representation $ \rho$ of a group g and an element f of G , the 2 - categorical trace $ tr_2\rho_f$ be a category . moreover , the centralizer of f in G act categorically on this 2 - categorical trace . we construct the induce strict 2 - categorical action of a finite group , and show that the 2 - categorical trace $ tr_2 $ take an induce strict 2 - categorical action into an induce categorical action of the initia groupoid . as a corollary , we get the 3 - character formula of the induce strict 2 - categorical action .

title: Profinite topological spaces
authors: G. Bezhanishvili, D. Gabelaia, M. Jibladze, P. J. Morandi
abstract: it be well know that profinite $ t_0$-space be exactly the spectral space . we generalize this result to the category of all topological space by show that the following condition be equivalent : ( 1 ) $ ( x,\tau)$ be a profinite topological space . ( 2 ) the $ t_0$-reflection of $ ( x,\tau)$ be a profinite $ t_0$-space . ( 3 ) $ ( x,\tau)$ be a quasi spectral space . ( 4 ) $ ( x,\tau)$ admit a strong Stone topology $ \pi$ such that $ ( x , \tau,\pi)$ be a bitopological quasi spectral space

title: Mutation pairs and triangulated quotients
abstract: we introduce the notion of mutation pair in pseudo - triangulated category . give such a mutation pair , we prove that the corresponding quotient category carry a natural triangulate structure under certain condition . this result unify many previous construction of quotient triangulate category .

title: Groupoids in categories with pretopology
abstract: we survey the general theory of groupoid , groupoid action , groupoid principal bundle , and various kind of morphism between groupoid in the framework of category with pretopology . the category of topological space and finite or infinite dimensional manifold be example of such category . we study extra assumption on pretopologie that be need for this theory . we check these extra assumption in several category with pretopologie . functor between groupoid may be localise at equivalence in two way . one use span of functor , the other bibundle ( commute action ) of groupoid . we show that both approach give equivalent bicategorie . another type of groupoid morphism , call an actor , be closely related to functor between the category of groupoid action . we also generalise actor use bibundle , and show that this give another bicategory of groupoid .

title: Algebraically coherent categories
authors: Alan S. Cigoli, James R. A. Gray and Tim Van der Linden
abstract: we call a finitely complete category algebraically coherent if the change - of - base functor of its fibration of point be coherent , which mean that they preserve finite limit and jointly strongly epimorphic pair of arrow . we give example of category satisfy this condition ; for instance , coherent category and category of interest in the sense of Orzech . we study equivalent condition in the context of semi - abelian category , as well as some of its consequence : include amongst other , strong protomodularity , and normality of Higgins commutator for normal subobject , and in the varietal case , fibre - wise algebraic cartesian closedness .

title: Algebras of open dynamical systems on the operad of wiring diagrams
authors: Dmitry Vagner, David I. Spivak, and Eugene Lerman
abstract: in this paper , we use the language of operad to study open dynamical system . more specifically , we study the algebraic nature of assemble complex dynamical system from an interconnection of simple one . the syntactic architecture of such interconnection be encode use the visual language of wiring diagram . we define the symmetric monoidal category $ w$ , from which we may construct an operad $ ow$ , whose object be black box with input and output port , and whose morphism be wiring diagram , thus prescribe the algebraic rule for interconnection . we then define two $ w$-algebra } $ G$ and $ l$ , which associate semantic content to the structure in $ w$. respectively , they correspond to general and to linear system of differential equation , in which an internal state be control by input and produce output . as an example , we use these algebra to formalize the classical problem of system of tank interconnect by pipe , and hence make explicit the algebraic relationship among system at different level of granularity .

title: Internal algebra classifiers as codescent objects of crossed internal categories
abstract: inspire by recent work of Batanin and Berger on the homotopy theory of operad , a general monad - theoretic context for speak about structure within structure be present , and the problem of construct the universal ambient structure contain the prescribe internal structure be study . follow the work of Lack , these universal object must be construct from simplicial object arise from our monad - theoretic framework , as certain 2 - categorical colimit call codescent object . we isolate the extra structure present on these simplicial object which enable their codescent object to be compute . these be the cross internal category of the title , and generalise the cross simplicial group of Loday and Fiedorowicz . the most general result of this article be concern with how to compute such codescent object in 2 - category of internal category , and on isolate condition on the monad - theoretic situation which enable these result to apply . combine with early work of the author in which operad be see as polynomial 2 - monad , our result be then apply to the theory of non - symmetric , symmetric and braided operad . in particular , the well - know construction of a prop from an operad be recover , as an illustration of our technique .

title: Limits of abstract elementary classes
abstract: we show that the category of abstract elementary class ( AECs ) and concrete functor be close under construction of ` ` limit type , " which generalize the approach of Mariano , Zambrano and Villaveces away from the syntactically orient framework of institution . moreover , we provide a broad view of this closure phenomenon , consider a variety of category of accessible category with additional structure , and relax the assumption that the morphism be concrete functor .

title: Operads as polynomial 2-monads
abstract: in this article we give a construction of a polynomial 2 - monad from an operad and describe the algebra of the 2 - monad which then arise . this construction be different from the standard construction of a monad from an operad in that the algebra of our associate 2 - monad be the categorifie algebra of the original operad . moreover it enable we to characterise operad as categorical polynomial monad in a canonical way . this point of view reveal categorical polynomial monad as a unifying environment for operad , Cat - operad and club . we recover the standard construction of a monad from an operad in a 2 - categorical way from our associate 2 - monad as a coidentifier of 2 - monad , and understand the algebra of both as weak morphism of operad into a Cat - operad of category . algebra of operad within general symmetric monoidal category arise from our new associate 2 - monad in a canonical way . when the operad be sigma - free , we establish a Quillen equivalence , with respect to the model structure on algebra of 2 - monad find by Lack , between the strict algebra of our associate 2 - monad , and those of the standard one .

title: The waves of a total category
abstract: for any total category $ k$ , with define adjunction $ \sup \ladj y : k \rightarrow set^{k^{op}}$ , the expression $ w(a)(k)= set^{set^{k^{op}}}(k(a,\sup -),[k,-])$ , where $ [ k,-]$ be evaluation at $ k$ , provide a well - define functor $ w : k \rightarrow \hat{k } = set^{k^{op}}$. also , there be natural transformation $ \beta : w\sup \rightarrow 1_{\hat{k}}$ and $ \gamma : \sup w \rightarrow 1_k$ satisfy $ \sup\beta = \gamma\sup$ and $ \beta w = w\gamma$. a total $ k$ be totally distributive if $ \sup$ have a left adjoint . we show that $ k$ be totally distributive iff $ \gamma$ be invertible iff $ w \ladj \sup$. the element of $ w(a)(k)$ be call wave from $ k$ to $ a$. write $ \tilde{k}(k , a)$ for $ w(a)(k)$. for any total $ k$ there be an associative composition of wave . composition become an arrow $ \bullet : \tilde{k}\circ_{k}\tilde{k } \rightarrow \tilde{k}$. also , there be an augmentation $ \tilde{k}(-,- ) \rightarrow k(-,-)$ correspond to a natural $ \delta : w \rightarrow y$ construct via $ \beta$. we show that if $ k$ be totally distributive then $ \bullet$ be invertible and then $ \tilde{k}$ support an idempotent comonad structure . in fact , $ \tilde{k } \circ_{k } \tilde{k } = \tilde{k } \circ_{\tilde{k } } \tilde{k}$ so that $ \bullet$ be the coequalizer of $ \bullet k$ and $ k \bullet$ , make $ \tilde{k}$ a taxon in the sense of Koslowski . for a small taxon $ t$ , the category of interpolative module $ imod(1,t)$ be totally distributive . here we show , for any totally distributive $ k$ , that there be an equivalence $ k \rightarrow imod(1,\tilde{k})$.

title: Homotopy unital $A_\infty$-morphisms with several entries
abstract: we show that morphism from n homotopy unital $ a_\infty$-algebras to a single one be map over an operad module with n+1 commute action of the operad $ a_\infty^\hu$ , whose algebra be homotopy unital $ a_\infty$-algebra . the operad $ a_\infty$ and module over it have two useful grading relate by isomorphism which change the degree . the composition of $ a_\infty^\hu$\n - morphism with several entry be present as a convolution of a coalgebra - like and an algebra - like structure .

title: $A_\infty$-morphisms with several entries
abstract: we show that morphism from n $ a_\infty$-algebra to a single one be map over an operad module with n+1 commute action of the operad $ a_\infty$ , whose algebra be conventional $ a_\infty$-algebra . the composition of $ a_\infty$-morphism with several entry be present as a convolution of a coalgebra - like and an algebra - like structure . under these notion lie two example of Cat - operad : that of graded module and of complex .

title: Proximity biframes and compactifications of completely regular ordered spaces
authors: Guram Bezhanishvili and Patrick J. Morandi
abstract: we generalize the concept of a strong inclusion on a biframe to that of a proximity on a biframe , which be related to the concept of a strong bi - inclusion on a frame introduce by Picado and Pultr . we also generalize the concept of a bi - compactification of a biframe to that of a compactification of a biframe , and prove that the poset of compactification of a biframe L be isomorphic to the poset of proximity on L. as a corollary , we obtain Schauerte 's characterization of bi - compactification of a biframe . in the spatial case this yield Blatter and Seever 's characterization of compactification of completely regular ordered space and a characterization of bi - compactification of completely regular bispace .

title: Transformation double categories associated to 2-group actions
authors: Jeffrey C. Morton and Roger Picken
abstract: transformation groupoid associate to group action capture the interplay between global and local symmetry of structure describe in set - theoretic term . this paper examine the analogous situation for structure describe in category - theoretic term , where symmetry be express as the action of a 2 - group G ( equivalently , a categorical group ) on a category C. it describe the construction of a transformation groupoid in diagrammatic term , and consider this construction internal to Cat , the category of category . the result be a double category c//g which describe the local symmetry of C. we define this and describe some of its structure , with the adjoint action of g on itself as a guide example .

title: Gauge invariant surface holonomy and monopoles
abstract: there be few know computable example of non - abelian surface holonomy . in this paper , we give several example whose structure 2 - group be cover 2 - group and show that the surface holonomie can be compute via a simple formula in term of path of 1 - dimensional holonomie inspire by early work of Chan Hong - Mo and Tsou Sheung Tsun on magnetic monopole . as a consequence of our work and that of Schreiber and Waldorf , this formula give a rigorous meaning to non - abelian magnetic flux for magnetic monopole . in the process , we discuss gauge covariance of surface holonomie for sphere for any 2 - group , therefore generalize the notion of the reduced group introduce by Schreiber and Waldorf . use these idea , we also prove that magnetic monopole form an abelian group .

title: Intercategories
abstract: we introduce a 3 - dimensional categorical structure which we call intercategory . this be a kind of weak triple category with three kind of arrow , three kind of 2 - dimensional cell and one kind of 3 - dimensional cell . in one dimension , the composition be strictly associative and unitary , whereas in the other two , these law only hold up to coherent isomorphism . the main feature be that the interchange law between the second and third composition do not hold , but rather there be a non - invertible comparison cell which satisfy some coherence condition . we introduce appropriate morphism of intercategory , of which there be three type , and cell relate these . we show that these fit together to produce a strict triple category of intercategorie .

title: Stacks of
abstract: we show that ann - category admit a presentation by crossed bimodule , and prove that morphism between they can be express by special kind span between the presentation . more precisely , we prove the groupoid of morphism between two ann - category be equivalent to that of bimodule butterfly between the presentation . a bimodule butterfly be a specialization of a butterfly , i.e. a special kind of span or fraction , between the underlie complex

title: Generalized covering space theories
abstract: in this paper , we unify various approach to generalized covering space theory by introduce a categorical framework in which covering be define purely in term of unique lifting property . for each category c of path - connect space have the unit disk as an object , we construct a category of c - covering over a give space x that embed in the category of $ \pi_1(x , x_0)$-sets via the usual monodromy action on fiber . when C be extend to its coreflective hull h(c ) , the result category of base h(c)-coverings be complete , have an initial object , and often characterize more of the subgroup lattice of $ \pi_1(x , x_0)$ than traditional covering space . we apply our result to three special coreflective subcategorie : ( 1 ) the category of $ \delta$-covering employ the convenient category of $ \delta$-generated space and be universal in the sense that it contain every other generalized covering category as a subcategory . ( 2 ) in the locally path - connect category , we preserve notion of generalize covering due to Fischer and Zastrow and characterize the topology of such covering use the standard whisker topology . ( 3 ) by employ the coreflective hull fan of the category of all contractible space , we characterize the notion of continuous lifting of path and identify the topology of Fan - covering as the natural quotient topology inherit from the path space .

title: A C-system defined by a universe category
abstract: this be the third paper in a series . in it we construct a c - system cc(c , p ) start from a category c together with a morphism $ p:\tilde{u } \to u$ , a choice of pull - back square base on $ p$ for all morphism to $ u$ and a choice of a final object of C. such a quadruple be call a universe category . we then define universe category functor and construct homomorphism of C - system cc(c , p ) define by universe category functor . in the section before the last section we give , for any C - system cc , three different construction of pair ( ( c , p),h ) where ( c , p ) be a universe category and $ h : cc \to cc(c , p)$ be an isomorphism . in the last section we construct for any ( set ) category C with a choice of a final object and fiber product a C - system and an equivalence between C and the precategory underlie CC .

title: Building a Model Category out of cofibrations and fibrations
abstract: the purpose of this note be to understand the two out of three property of the model category in term of the weak factorization system . we will show that if a category with class of trivial cofibration , cofibration , trivial fibration , and fibration be give a simplicial structure similar to that of the simplicial model category , then the full subcategory of cofibrant and fibrant object have the two out of three property , and we will give a list of necessary and sufficient condition in term of the simplicial structure for the associate canonical " weak equivalence class " to have the two out of three property .

title: A note on transport of algebraic structures
abstract: we study transport of algebraic structure and prove a theorem which subsume result of Comfort and Ross on topological group structure on Stone - Cech compactification , of Chevalley and of Gil de Lamadrid and Jans on topological group and ring structure on universal covering space , and of Gleason on topological group structure on universal locally connect refinement .

title: Decorated cospans
abstract: let $ C$ be a category with finite colimit , write its coproduct + , and let $ ( d , \otimes)$ be a braided monoidal category . we describe a method of produce a symmetric monoidal category from a lax braided monoidal functor $ f : ( c,+ ) \to ( d , \otimes)$ , and of produce a strong monoidal functor between such category from a monoidal natural transformation between such functor . the object of these category , our so - call ` decorated cospan category ' , be simply the object of $ c$ , while the morphism be pair comprise a cospan $ x \rightarrow n \leftarrow y$ in $ c$ together with an element $ 1 \to fn$ in $ d$. moreover , decorate cospan category be hypergraph category - each object be equip with a special commutative Frobenius monoid - and their functor preserve this structure .

title: Cyclic homology arising from adjunctions
authors: Niels Kowalzig, Ulrich Krähmer, and Paul Slevin
abstract: give a monad and a comonad , one obtain a distributive law between they from lift of one through an adjunction for the other . in particular , this yield for any bialgebroid the Yetter - Drinfel'd distributive law between the comonad give by a module coalgebra and the monad give by a comodule algebra . it be this self - dual setting that reproduce the cyclic homology of associative and of Hopf algebra in the monadic framework of Böhm and Stefan . in fact , their approach generate two duplicial object and morphism between they which be mutual inverse if and only if the duplicial object be cyclic . a 2 - categorical perspective on the process of twist coefficient be provide and the role of the two notion of bimonad study in the literature be clarify .

title: Reduced smooth stacks?
abstract: an arbitrary Lie groupoid give rise to a groupoid of germ of local diffeomorphism over its base manifold , know as its effect . the effect of any bundle of Lie group be trivial . all quotient of a give Lie groupoid determine the same effect . it be natural to regard the effect of any two Morita equivalent Lie groupoid as be ` ` equivalent '' . in this paper we shall describe a systematic way of compare the effect of different Lie groupoid . in particular , we shall rigorously define what it mean for two arbitrary Lie groupoid to give rise to ` ` equivalent '' effect . for effective orbifold groupoid , the new notion of equivalence turn out to coincide with the traditional notion of Morita equivalence . our analysis be relevant to the presentation theory of proper smooth stack .

title: Skew-monoidal reflection and lifting theorems
abstract: this paper extend the Day Reflection theorem to skew monoidal category . we also provide condition under which a skew monoidal structure can be lift to the category of Eilenberg - Moore coalgebra for a comonad .

title: Finite categories with pushouts
abstract: let C be a finite category . for an object x of C one have the hom - functor hom(-,x ) of C to set . if G be a subgroup of aut(x ) , one have the quotient functor hom(-,x)/g. we show that any finite product of hom - functor of C be a sum of hom - functor if and only if C have pushout and coequalizer and that any finite product of hom - functor of C be a sum of functor of the form \hom(-,x)/g if and only if C have pushout . these be variation of the fact that a finite category have product if and only if it have coproduct .

title: Deligne groupoid revisited
authors: Paul Bressler, Alexander Gorokhovsky, Ryszard Nest and Boris Tsygan
abstract: we show that for a differential graded Lie algebra g whose component vanish in degree below -1 the nerve of the deligne 2 - groupoid be homotopy equivalent to the simplicial set of g - value differential form introduce by V.~Hinich .

title: On the second cohomology categorical group and a Hochschild-Serre 2-exact sequence
abstract: we introduce the second cohomology categorical group of a categorical group g with coefficient in a symmetric g - categorical group and we show that it classify extension of g with symmetric kernel and a functorial section . moreover , from an essentially surjective homomorphism of categorical group we get 2 - exact sequence a la Hochschild - Serre connect the categorical group of derivation and the first and the second cohomology categorical group .

title: Reflexivity and dualizability in categorified linear algebra
authors: Martin Brandenburg, Alexandru Chirvasitu, and Theo Johnson-Freyd
abstract: the " linear dual " of a cocomplete linear category $ c$ be the category of all cocontinuous linear functor $ c \to vect$. we study the question of when a cocomplete linear category be reflexive ( equivalent to its double dual ) or dualizable ( the pairing with its dual come with a correspond copairing ) . our main result be that the category of comodule for a countable - dimensional coassociative coalgebra be always reflexive , but ( without any dimension hypothesis ) dualizable if and only if it have enough projective , which rarely happen . along the way , we prove that the category $ qcoh(x)$ of quasi - coherent sheaf on a stack $ x$ be not dualizable if $ x$ be the classify stack of a semisimple algebraic group in positive characteristic or if $ x$ be a scheme contain a closed projective subscheme of positive dimension , but be dualizable if $ x$ be the quotient of an affine scheme by a virtually linearly reductive group . finally we prove tensoriality ( a type of tannakian duality ) for affine ind - scheme with countable indexing poset .

title: Internal choice holds in the discrete part of any cohesive topos satisfying stable connected codiscreteness
authors: F. W. Lawvere and M. Menni
abstract: we introduce an apparent strengthening of Sufficient Cohesion that we call Stable Connected Codiscreteness ( SCC ) and show that if $ p : e --&gt ; S$ be cohesive and satisfy SCC then the internal axiom of choice hold in $ s$. moreover , in this case , $ p^ ! : s --&gt ; e$ be equivalent to the inclusion $ e_{\neg\neg } --&gt ; E$.

title: Actions in modified categories of interest with application to crossed modules
authors: Y. Boyaci, J. M. Casas, T. Datuashvili and E. O. Uslu
abstract: the existence of the split extension classifier of a cross module in the category of associative algebra be investigate . accord to the equivalence of category $ xass \simeq cat^1 - ass$ we consider this problem in $ cat^1 - ass$. this category be not a category of interest , it satisfy its all axiom except one . the action theory develop in the category of interest be adapt to the new type of category , which will be call modify category of interest . apply the result obtain in this direction and the equivalence of category we find a condition under which there exist the split extension classifier of a cross module and give the correspond construction .

title: Categories in control
authors: John C. Baez and Jason Erbele
abstract: control theory use ` signal - flow diagram ' to describe process where real - valued function of time be add , multiply by scalar , differentiate and integrate , duplicate and delete . these diagram can be see as string diagram for the symmetric monoidal category FinVectk of finite - dimensional vector space over the field of rational function k = r(s ) , where the variable s act as differentiation and the monoidal structure be direct sum rather than the usual tensor product of vector space . for any field k we give a presentation of FinVectk in term of the generator use in signal - flow diagram . a broad class of signal - flow diagram also include ` cap ' and ` cup ' to model feedback . we show these diagram can be see as string diagram for the symmetric monoidal category FinRelk , where object be still finite - dimensional vector space but the morphism be linear relation . we also give a presentation for FinRelk . the relation say , among other thing , that the 1 - dimensional vector space k have two special commutative dagger - frobenius structure , such that the multiplication and unit of either one and the comultiplication and counit of the other fit together to form a bimonoid . this sort of structure , but with tensor product replace direct sum , be familiar from the ` zx - calculus ' obey by a finite - dimensional hilbert space with two mutually unbiased basis .

title: An algebraic definition of ($\infty$,n)-categories
abstract: in this paper we define a sequence of monad $ t^{(\infty , n ) } ( n\in\mathbb{n})$ on the category $ \infty - gr$ of $ \infty$-graph . we conjecture that algebra for $ \t^{(\infty,0)}$ , which be define in a purely algebraic setting , be model of $ \infty$-groupoids . more generally , we conjecture that $ t^{(\infty , n)}$-algebra be model for $ ( \infty , n)$-categorie . we prove that our $ ( \infty,0)$-categories be bigroupoid when truncate at level 2 .

title: On reflective subcategories of locally presentable categories
abstract: be all subcategorie of locally finitely presentable category that be close under limit and $ \lambda$-filtere colimit also locally presentable ? for full subcategorie the answer be affirmative . Makkai and Pitts prove that in the case $ \lambda = \aleph_0 $ the answer be affirmative also for all iso - full subcategorie , i. e. , those contain with every pair of object all isomorphism between they . we discuss a possible generalization of this from $ \aleph_0 $ to an arbitrary $ \lambda$.

title: Segal group actions
abstract: we define a model category structure on a slice category of simplicial space , call the " Segal group action " structure , whose fibrant - cofibrant object may be view as represent space $ x$ with an action of a fixed Segal group ( i.e. a group - like , reduced Segal space ) . we show that this model structure be Quillen equivalent to the projective model structure on $ g$-space , $ s^bg}$ , where $ g$ be a simplicial group correspond to the Segal group . one advantage of this model be that if we start with an ordinary group action $ x\in s^bg$ and apply a weakly monoidal functor of space $ l : s \to s$ ( such as localization or completion ) on each simplicial degree of its associate Segal group action , we get a new Segal group action of $ LG$ on $ LX$ which can then be rigidify via the above - mention Quillen equivalence .

title: Categories enriched over a quantaloid: Algebras
abstract: give a small quantaloid q with a set of object q_0 , it be prove that complete skeletal q - category , completely distributive skeletal q - category , and q - powerset of q - type set be all monadic over athe slice category of Set over Q_0 .

title: A model structure on internal categories in simplicial sets
abstract: we put a model structure on the category of category internal to simplicial set . the weak equivalence in this model structure be preserve and reflect by the nerve functor to bisimplicial set with the complete Segal space model structure . this model structure be show to be a model for the homotopy theory of infinity category . we also study the homotopy theory of internal presheave over an internal category .

title: The accessibility rank of weak equivalences
abstract: we study the accessibility property of trivial cofibration and weak equivalence in a combinatorial model category and prove an estimate for the accessibility rank of weak equivalence . in particular , we show that the class of weak equivalence between simplicial set be finitely accessible .

title: Extensive categories and the size of an orbit
abstract: it be well known how to compute the number of orbit of a group action . a related problem , apparently not in the literature , be to determine the number of element in an orbit . the theory that address this question lead to orbital extensive category and to combinatorial aspect of such category .

title: Cartesian differential storage categories
authors: R. Blute, J.R.B. Cockett, and R.A.G. Seely
abstract: monoidal differential category provide the framework for categorical model of differential linear logic . the cokleisli category of any monoidal differential category be always a cartesian differential category . cartesian differential category , besides arise in this manner as cokleisli category , occur in many different and quite independent way . thus , it be not obvious how to pass from cartesian differential category back to monoidal differential category . this paper provide natural condition under which the linear map of a cartesian differential category form a monoidal differential category . this be a question of some practical importance as much of the machinery of modern differential geometry be base on model which implicitly allow such a passage , and thus the result and tool of the area tend to freely assume access to this structure . the purpose of this paper be to make precise the connection between the two type of differential category . as a prelude to this , however , it be convenient to have available a general theory which relate the behaviour of " linear " map in cartesian category to the structure of Seely category . the latter be develop to provide the categorical semantic for ( fragment of ) linear logic which use a " storage " modality . the general theory of storage , which underlie the result mention above , be develop in the open section of the paper and be then apply to the case of differential category .

title: Polynomials in categories with pullbacks
abstract: the theory develop by Gambino and Kock , of polynomial over a locally cartesian closed category e , be generalise for E just have pullback . the 2 - categorical analogue of the theory of polynomial and polynomial functor be give , and its relationship with Street 's theory of fibration within 2 - category be explore . Johnstone 's notion of " bagdomain datum " be adapt to the present framework to make it easy to completely exhibit example of polynomial monad .

title: Notes on commutation of limits and colimits
authors: Marie Bjerrum, Peter Johnstone, Tom Leinster, William F. Sawin
abstract: we show that there be infinitely many distinct closed class of colimit ( in the sense of the galois connection induce by commutation of limit and colimit in Set ) which be intermediate between the class of pseudo - filtered colimit and that of all ( small ) colimit . on the other hand , if the correspond class of limit contain either pullback or equalizer , then the class of colimit be contain in that of pseudo - filtered colimit .

title: Slicing sites and semireplete factorization systems
abstract: a factorization system ( e , M ) on a category a give rise to the covariant category - value pseudofunctor p of A send each object to its slice category over M. this article characterize the P so obtain as follow : their object image have terminal object , and they admit bicategorically cartesian lifting , up to equivalence , of slice - category projection . it be clear that , and how , ( e , m ) can be recover from such a P. the correspondence thus describe be actually the second of three similar one between certain ( e , M ) and certain P that the article present . in the first one the characterization of the P have all ultimately bicategorical ingredient replace with their categorical analogue . a category A with such a p be precisely what the author have call a ` slicing site ' . in the article 's term the associate ( e , M ) be again factorization system - but the concept convey extend the standard one by not oblige isomorphism to belong to either factor class - , namely those that be ` right semireplete ' ( isomorphism do belong to M and ` left semistrict ' ( morphism in M be monic relative to E ) . the third correspondence subsume the other two ; here the ( e , M ) be all right - semireplete factorization system .

title: Operadic definitions of weak n-category: coherence and comparisons
abstract: this paper concern the relationship between notion of weak n - category define as algebra for n - globular operad , as well as their coherence property . we focus primarily on the definition due to Batanin and Leinster . a correspondence between the contraction and system of composition use in Batanin 's definition , and the unbiased contraction use in Leinster 's definition , have long be suspect , and we prove a conjecture of Leinster that show that the two notion be in some sense equivalent . we then prove several coherence theorem which apply to algebra for any operad with a contraction and system of composition or with an unbiased contraction ; these coherence theorem thus apply to weak $ n$-categorie in the sense of Batanin , Leinster , Penon and Trimble . we then take some step towards a comparison between Batanin weak n - category and Leinster weak n - category . we describe a canonical adjunction between the category of these , give a construction of the left adjoint , which be applicable in more generality to a class of functor induce by monad morphism . we conclude with some preliminary statement about a possible weak equivalence of some sort between these category .

title: Normalizers, centralizers and action accessibility
abstract: we give several reformulation of action accessibility in the sense of D. Bourn and G. Janelidze . in particular we prove that a pointed exact protomodular category be action accessible if and only if for each normal monomorphism $ \kappa : x\to a$ the normalizer of $ & lt ; \kappa,\kappa&gt ; : x\to a\times a$ exist . this clarify the connection between normalizer and action accessible category establish in a joint paper of D. Bourn and the author , in which it be prove that for pointed exact protomodular category the existence of normalizer imply action accessibility . in addition we prove a pointed exact protomodular category with coequalizer be action accessible if centralizer of normal monomorphism exist , and the normality of union hold .

title: A cocategorical obstruction to tensor products of Gray-categories
abstract: it be argue by Crans that it be too much to ask that the category of Gray - category admit a well behave monoidal biclosed structure . we make this precise by establish undesirable property that any such monoidal biclosed structure must have . in particular we show that there do not exist any tensor product make the model category of Gray - category into a monoidal model category .

title: Lax formal theory of monads, monoidal approach to bicategorical  structures and generalized operads
abstract: generalized operad , also call generalize multicategorie and $ t$-monoid , be define as monad within a Kleisli bicategory . with or without emphasize their monoidal nature , generalized operad have be consider by numerous author in different context , with example include symmetric multicategorie , topological space , globular operad and Lawvere theory . in this paper we study functoriality of the Kleisli construction , and correspondingly that of generalized operad . motivate by this problem we develop a lax version of the formal theory of monad , and study its connection to bicategorical structure .

title: Limit closures of classes of commutative rings
authors: Michael Barr, John F. Kennison, R. Raphael
abstract: we study and , in a number of case , classify completely the limit closure in the category of commutative ring of subcategorie of integral domain .

title: Partial-sup lattices
abstract: the study of sup lattice teach we the important distinction between the algebraic part of the structure ( in this case suprema ) and the coincidental part of the structure ( in this case infima ) . while a sup lattice happen to have all infima , only the suprema be part of the algebraic structure . extend this idea , we look at poset that happen to have all suprema ( and therefore all infima ) , but we will only declare some of they to be part of the algebraic structure ( which we will call join ) . we find that a lot of the theory of complete distributivity for sup lattice can be extend to this context . there be a lot of natural example of completely join - distributive partial lattice complete partial order , include for example , the lattice of all equivalence relation on a set x , and the lattice of all subgroup of a group G. in both case we define the join operation as union . this be a partial operation , because for example , the union of subgroup of a group be not necessarily a subgroup . however , sometimes it be , and keep track of this can help with topic such as the inclusion - exclusion principle . another motivation for the study of sup lattice be as a simplified model for the study of presheaf category . the construction of downset be a form of the Yoneda embedding , and the study of downset lattice can be a useful guide for the study of presheaf category . in this context , partial lattice can be view as a simplified model for the study of sheaf category .

title: Bicategorical homotopy pullbacks
abstract: the homotopy theory of high categorical structure have become a relevant part of the machinery of algebraic topology and algebraic k - theory , and this paper contain contribution to the study of the relationship between Benabou 's bicategorie and the homotopy type of their classifying space . mainly , we state and prove an extension of Quillen 's Theorem B by show , under reasonable necessary condition , a bicategory - theoretical interpretation of the homotopy - fibre product of the continuous map induce on classify space by a diagram of bicategorie $ a\to b \leftarrow a'$. application be give for the study of homotopy pullback of monoidal category and of cross module .

title: Characteristic subobjects in semi-abelian categories
authors: Alan S. Cigoli and Andrea Montoli
abstract: we extend to semi - abelian category the notion of characteristic subobject , which be widely use in group theory and in the theory of Lie algebras . moreover , we show that many of the classical property of characteristic subgroup of a group hold in the general semi - abelian context , or in strong one .

title: Algebraic Kan extensions in double categories
abstract: we study Kan extension in three weakening of the Eilenberg - Moore double category associate to a double monad , that be introduce by Grandis and Paré . to be precise , give a normal oplax double monad t on a double category k , we consider the double category consist of pseudo t - algebra , ` weak ' vertical t - morphism , horizontal t - morphism and t - cell , where ` weak ' mean either ` lax ' , ` colax ' or ` pseudo ' . denote these double category by alg_w(t ) , where w = l , c or ps accordingly , our main result give , in each of these case , condition ensure that ( pointwise ) Kan extension can be lift along the forgetful double functor alg_w(t ) --&gt ; K. as an application we recover and generalise a result by Getzler , on the lifting of pointwise left Kan extension along symmetric monoidal enrich functor . as an application of Getzler 's result we prove , in suitable symmetric monoidal category , the existence of bicommutative Hopf monoid that be freely generate by cocommutative comonoid .

title: Un théorème A de Quillen pour les 2-foncteurs lax
abstract: we generalize Quillen 's Theorem A to triangle of lax 2 - functor which commute up to transformation . it follow from a special case of this result that 2 - category be model for homotopy type .

title: Weak braided monoidal categories and their homotopy colimits
abstract: we show that the homotopy colimit construction for diagram of category with an operad action , recently introduce by Fiedorowicz , Stelzer and Vogt , have the desire homotopy type for diagram of weak braided monoidal category . this provide a more flexible way to realize $ e_2 $ space categorically .

title: Model categories with simple homotopy categories
abstract: in the present article we describe construction of model structure on general bicomplete category . we be motivate by the follow question : give a category C with a suitable subcategory wc , when be there a model structure on C with wC as the subcategory of weak equivalence ? we begin explore this question in the case where wc = f^{-1}(iso d ) for some functor f : c --&gt ; d. we also prove properness of our construction under minor assumption and examine an application to the category of infinite graph .

title: On strong homotopy for quasi-schemoids
abstract: a quasi - schemoid be a small category with a particular partition of the set of morphism . we define a homotopy relation on the category of quasi - schemoid and study its fundamental property . the homotopy set of self - homotopy equivalence on a quasi - schemoid be use as a homotopy invariant in the study . the main theorem enable we to deduce that the homotopy invariant for the quasi - schemoid induce by a finite group be isomorphic to the automorphism group of the give group . % these consideration be the first step to develop homotopy theory for quasi - schemoid .

title: Cosheafification
abstract: it be prove that for any small Grothendieck site x , there exist a coreflection ( call \emph{cosheafification } ) from the category of precosheave on X with value in a category $ k$ , to the full subcategory of cosheave , provide either $ k$ or $ k^{op}$ be locally presentable . if $ k$ be cocomplete , such a coreflection be build explicitly for the ( pre)cosheave with value in the category $ pro(k)$ of pro - object in $ k$. in the case of precosheave on topological space , it be prove that any precosheaf with value in $ pro(k)$ be smooth , i.e. be strongly locally isomorphic to a cosheaf . constant cosheave be construct , and there be establish connection with shape theory .

title: A functorial approach to Dedekind completions and the representation of vector lattices and
authors: G. Bezhanishvili, P. J. Morandi, B. Olberding
abstract: unlike the uniform completion , the Dedekind completion of a vector lattice be not functorial . in order to repair the lack of functoriality of Dedekind completion , we enrich the signature of vector lattice with a proximity relation , thus arrive at the category pdv of proximity Dedekind vector lattice . we prove that the Dedekind completion induce a functor from the category bav of bound archimedean vector lattice to pdv , which in fact be an equivalence . we utilize the result of Dilworth to show that every proximity Dedekind vector lattice d be represent as the normal real - valued function on the compact Hausdorff space associate with D. this yield a contravariant adjunction between pdv and the category KHaus of compact Hausdorff space , which restrict to a dual equivalence between KHaus and the proper subcategory of pdv consist of those proximity Dedekind vector lattice in which the proximity be uniformly close . we show how to derive the classic Yosida Representation , Kakutani - Krein Duality , Stone - Gelfand - Naimark duality , and Stone - Nakano theorem from our approach .

title: Products of families of types and $(\Pi,\lambda)$-structures on C-systems
abstract: in this paper we continue , follow the pioneering work by J. Cartmell and T. Streicher , the study of the most important structure on c - system , the structure that correspond , in the case of the syntactic C - system , to the $ ( \pi,\lambda , app,\beta,\eta)$-system of inference rule . one such structure be introduce by J. Cartmell and later study by T. Streicher under the name of the product of family of type . we introduce the notion of a $ ( \pi,\lambda)$-structure and construct a bijection , for a give c - system , between the set of $ ( \pi,\lambda)$-structure and the set of Cartmell - Streicher structure . in the follow paper we will show how to construct , and in some case fully classify , the $ ( \pi,\lambda)$-structure on the c - system that correspond to universe category . the first section of the paper provide careful proof of many of the property of general c - system . method of the paper be fully constructive , that is , neither the axiom of exclude middle nor the axiom of choice be use .

title: Monads on dagger categories
abstract: the theory of monad on category equip with a dagger ( a contravariant identity - on - object involutive endofunctor ) work well when all structure respect the dagger : the monad and adjunction should preserve the dagger , and the monad and its algebra should satisfy the so - call Frobenius law . then any monad resolve as an adjunction , with extremal solution give by the category of Kleisli and Frobenius - Eilenberg - Moore algebra , which again have a dagger . we characterize the Frobenius law as a coherence property between dagger and closure , and characterize strong such monad as be induce by Frobenius monoid .

title: On Evrard's homotopy fibrant replacement of a functor
keywords: Homotopy fibrant replacement of a functor
abstract: we provide a more economical refined version of Evrard 's categorical cocylinder factorization of a functor . we show that any functor between small category can be factor into a homotopy equivalence follow by a ( co)fibred functor which satisfy the ( dual ) assumption of Quillen 's theorem b.

title: Compositories and gleaves
abstract: sheaf be object of a local nature : a global section be determine by how it look locally . hence , a sheaf can not describe mathematical structure which contain global or nonlocal geometric information . to fill this gap , we introduce the theory of ` ` gleave '' , which be presheave equip with an additional ` ` gluing operation '' of compatible pair of local section . this generalize the conditional product structure of Dawid and Studeny , which correspond to gleave on distributive lattice . our example include the gleaf of metric space and the gleaf of joint probability distribution . a result of Johnstone show that a category of gleave can have a subobject classifier despite not be cartesian closed . gleave over the simplex category $ \delta$ , which we call compositorie , can be interpret as a new kind of high category in which the composition of an m - morphism and an n - morphism along a common k - morphism face result in an ( m+n - k)-morphism . the distinctive feature of this composition operation be that the original morphism can be recover from the composite morphism as initial and final face . example of compositorie include nerve of category and compositorie of high span .

title: On the representations of 2-groups in Baez-Crans 2-vector spaces
authors: Benjamin A. Heredia and Josep Elgueta
abstract: we study the theory of representation of a 2 - group G in Baez - Crans 2 - vector space over a field k of arbitrary characteristic , and the correspond 2 - vector space of intertwiner . we also characterize the irreducible and indecomposable representation . finally , it be show that when the 2 - group be finite and the base field k be of characteristic zero or coprime to the order of the homotopy group of G , the theory essentially reduce to the theory of k - linear representation of the first homotopy group of G , the remain homotopy invariant of G play no role .

title: Tannaka theory over sup-lattices and descent for topoi
authors: Eduardo J. Dubuc and Martin Szyld
