abstract: we consider locale B as algebra in the tensor category sl of sup - lattice . we show the equivalence between the Joyal - Tierney descent theorem for open localic surjection q : shb --&gt ; e in Galois theory and a tannakian recognition theorem over sl for the sl - functor rel ( q^ * ) : rel(e ) --&gt ; rel(shb ) \cong ( b - mod)_0 into the sl - category of discrete b - module . thus , a new Tannaka recognition theorem be obtain , essentially different from those know so far . this equivalence follow from two independent result . we develop an explicit construction of the localic groupoid g associate by Joyal - Tierney to q , and do an exhaustive comparison with the Deligne tannakian construction of the Hopf algebroid L associate to rel(q^ * ) , and show they be isomorphic , that is , l \cong o(g ) . on the other hand , we show that the sl - category of relation of the classify topo of any localic groupoid g , be equivalent to the sl - category of l - comodule with discrete subjacent b - module , where l = o(g ) . } we be force to work over an arbitrary base topos because , contrary to the neutral case which can be develop completely over set , here change of base technique be unavoidable .

title: Projectivity, continuity and adjointness: quantales, Q-posets and  Q-modules
abstract: projectivity , continuity and adjointness : quantale , q - poset and q - module in this paper , projective module over a quantale be characterize by distributivity , continuity , and adjointness condition . it be then show that a morphism q --&gt ; a of commutative quantale be coexponentiable if and only if the correspond q - module be projective , and hence , satisfy these equivalent condition .

title: Enriched Yoneda lemma
abstract: we present a version of the enrich Yoneda lemma for conventional ( not $ \infty$- ) category . we do not require the base monoidal category M to be closed or symmetric monoidal . in the case M have colimit and the monoidal structure in M preserve colimit in each argument , we prove that the Yoneda embed A to p_m(a ) be a universal functor from A to a category with colimit , left - tensored over M.

title: The Fermat functors
abstract: in this paper , we use some basic quasi - topos theory to study two functor : one add infinitesimal of Fermat real to diffeological space ( which generalize smooth manifold include singular space and infinite - dimensional space ) , and the other delete infinitesimal on Fermat space . we study the property of these functor , and calculate some example . these serve as fundamental for develop differential geometry on diffeological space use infinitesimal in a future paper .

title: Strict $\omega$-categories are monadic over polygraphs
abstract: we give a direct proof that the category of strict $ \omega$-categories be monadic over the category of polygraph .

title: Compact closed bicategories
abstract: a compact closed bicategory be a symmetric monoidal bicategory where every object be equip with a weak dual . the unit and counit satisfy the usual ` ` zig - zag '' identity of a compact closed category only up to natural isomorphism , and the isomorphism be subject to a coherence law . we give several example of compact close bicategorie , then review previous work . in particular , Day and Street define compact close bicategorie indirectly via Gray monoid and then appeal to a coherence theorem to extend the concept to bicategorie ; we restate the definition directly . we prove that give a 2 - category t with finite product and weak pullback , the bicategory of object of C , span , and isomorphism class of map of span be compact closed . as corollary , the bicategory of span of set and certain bicategorie of ` ` resistor network '' be compact closed .

title: Homotopy locally presentable enriched categories
abstract: we develop a homotopy theory of category enrich in a monoidal model category V. in particular , we deal with homotopy weight limit and colimit , and homotopy local presentability . the main result , which be know for simplicially - enrich category , link homotopy locally presentable v - category with combinatorial model v - category , in the case where all object of V be cofibrant .

title: The local Joyal model structure
abstract: the Joyal model structure on simplicial set be extend to a model structure on the simplicial presheave on a small site , in which the cofibration be monomorphism and the weak equivalence be local ( or stalkwise ) Joyal equivalence . the model structure be show to be leave proper .

title: The linearity of traces in monoidal categories and bicategories
abstract: we show that in any symmetric monoidal category , if a weight for colimit be absolute , then the result colimit of any diagram of dualizable object be again dualizable . moreover , in this case , if an endomorphism of the colimit be induce by an endomorphism of the diagram , then its trace can be calculate as a linear combination of trace on the object in the diagram . the formal nature of this result make it easy to generalize to trace in homotopical context ( use derivator ) and trace in bicategorie . these generalization include the familiar additivity of the Euler characteristic and Lefschetz number along cofiber sequence , as well as an analogous result for the Reidemeister trace , but also the orbit - counting theorem for set with a group action , and a general formula for homotopy colimit over ei - category .

title: Classical and relative realizability
authors: Jaap van Oosten and Tingxiang Zou
abstract: we show that every abstract krivine structure in the sense of Streicher can be obtain , up to equivalence of the result tripo , from a filter opca ( a , a ' ) and a subobject of 1 in the relative realizability topo rt(a',a ) ; the topos be always a boolean subtopos of rt(a',a ) . we exhibit a range of non - localic boolean subtripose of the Kleene - Vesley tripo .

title: Representation and character theory of finite categorical groups
abstract: we study the gerbal representation of a finite group g or , equivalently , module category over Ostrik 's category $ vec_g^\alpha$ for a 3 - cocycle $ \alpha$. we adapt Bartlett 's string diagram formalism to this situation to prove that the categorical character of a gerbal representation be a representation of the inertia groupoid of a categorical group . we interpret such a representation as a module over the twisted Drinfeld double $ d^\alpha(g)$.

title: Linear structures on locales
authors: Pedro Resende and Joao Paulo Santos
abstract: we define a notion of morphism for quotient vector bundle that yield both a category $ qvbun$ and a contravariant global section functor $ c : qvbun^{op } \to Vect$ whose restriction to trivial vector bundle with fiber f coincide with the contravariant functor $ top^{op } \to Vect$ of f - value continuous function . base on this we obtain a linear extension of the adjunction between the category of topological space and locale : ( i ) a linearized topological space be a spectral vector bundle , by which be mean a mildly restricted type of quotient vector bundle ; ( ii ) a linearized locale be a locale $ \delta$ equip with both a topological vector space a and a $ \delta$-valued support map for the element of A satisfy a continuity condition relative to the spectrum of $ \delta$ and the low Vietoris topology on $ Sub a$ ; ( iii ) we obtain an adjunction between the full subcategory of spectral vector bundle $ QVBun_\Sigma$ and the category of linearized locale $ linloc$ , which restrict to an equivalence of category between sober spectral vector bundle and spatial linearized locale . the spectral vector bundle be classify by a fine topology on $ Sub a$ , call the open support topology , but there be no notion of universal spectral vector bundle for an arbitrary topological vector space a.

title: The snail lemma
abstract: the classical snake lemma produce a six term exact sequence start from a commutative square with one of the edge be a regular epimorphism . we establish a new diagram lemma , that we call snail lemma , remove such a condition . we also show that the snail lemma subsume the snake lemma and we give an interpretation of the snail lemma in term of strong homotopy kernel . our result hold in any pointed regular protomodular category .

title: The morphism axiom for n-angulated categories
authors: Emilie Arentz-Hansen, Petter Andreas Bergh and Marius Thaule
abstract: we show that the morphism axiom for n - angulate category be redundant .

title: Right delocalization of model categories
abstract: model category have long be a useful tool in homotopy theory , allow many generalization of result in topological space to other category . give a localization of a model category provide an additional model category structure on the same base category , which alter what object be be consider equivalent by increase the class of weak equivalence . in some situation , a model category where the class of weak equivalence be restrict from the original one could be more desirable . in this situation we need the notion of a delocalization . in this paper , right Bousfield delocalization be define , we provide example of right Bousfield delocalization as well as an existence theorem . in particular , we show that give two model category structure $ \mo$ and $ \mt$ we can define an additional model category structure $ \mo \cap \mt$ by define the class of weak equivalence to be the intersection of the $ \mo$ and $ \mt$ weak equivalence . in addition we consider the model category on diagram category over a base category ( which be endow with a model category structure ) and show that delocalization be often preserve by the diagram model category structure .

title: Relative internal actions
authors: James Richard Andrew Gray and Tamar Janelidze-Gray
abstract: for a relative exact homological category ( C , e ) , we define relative point over an arbitrary object in C , and show that they form an exact homological category . in particular , it follow that the full subcategory of nilpotent object in an exact homological category be an exact homological category . these nilpotent object be define with respect to a Birkhoff subcategory in C as define by T. Everaert and T. Van der Linden . in addition , we introduce relative internal action and show that , just as in the classical case , there be an equivalence of category between the category of relative point over an object and the category of relative internal action for the same object .

title: Partial linearity and partial natural Mal'tsevness
abstract: we introduce in a previous article a notion of mal'tsevness relative to a specific class $ \sigma$ of split epimorphism . we investigate here the induce relative notion of natural mal'tsevness , with a special attention to the example of quandle .

title: Construction of categorical bundles from local data
authors: Saikat Chatterjee,  Amitabha Lahiri, and  Ambar N. Sengupta
abstract: a categorical principal bundle be a structure comprise of category that be analogous to a classical principal bundle ; example arise from geometric context involve bundle over path space . we show how a categorical principal bundle can be construct from local datum specify through transition functor and natural transformation .

title: A cotriple construction of a simplicial algebra used in the definition of higher Chow groups
abstract: we present a brief and simple cotriple description of the simplicial algebra use in Bloch 's construction of the high Chow group .

title: Spectra of compact regular frames
authors: Guram Bezhanishvili, David Gabelaia, Mamuka Jibladze
abstract: by Isbell duality , each compact regular frame l be isomorphic to the frame of open of a compact Hausdorff space X. in this note we study the spectrum spec(l ) of prime filter of a compact regular frame l. we prove that X be realize as the minimum of spec(l ) and the Gleason cover of X as the maximum of spec(l ) . we also characterize zero - dimensional , extremally disconnected , and scatter compact regular frame by mean of spec(l ) .

title: Stacks and sheaves of categories as fibrant objects, II
abstract: we revisit what we call the fibred topology on a fibred category over a site and we prove a few basic result concern this topology . we give a general result concern the invariance of a 2 - category of stack under change of base .

title: Some insights on bicategories of fractions: representations and compositions of 2-morphisms
abstract: in this paper we investigate the construction of bicategorie of fraction originally describe by D.~Pronk : give any bicategory $ c$ together with a suitable class of morphism $ w$ , one can construct a bicategory $ c[w^{-1}]$ , where all the morphism of $ W$ be turn into internal equivalence , and that be universal with respect to this property . Most of the description lead to this construction be long and heavily base on the axiom of choice . in this paper we considerably simplify the description of the equivalence relation on 2 - morphism and the construction of associator , vertical and horizontal composition in $ c[w^{-1}]$ , thus prove that the axiom of choice be not need under certain condition . the simplified description of associator and composition will also play a crucial role in two forthcoming paper about pseudofunctor and equivalence between bicategorie of fraction .

title: On biadjoint triangles
abstract: we prove a biadjoint triangle theorem and its strict version , which be 2 - dimensional analogue of the adjoint triangle theorem of Dubuc . similarly to the 1 - dimensional case , we demonstrate how we can apply our result to get the pseudomonadicity characterization ( due to Le Creurer , Marmolejo and Vitale ) . furthermore , we study application of our main theorem in the context of the 2 - monadic approach to coherence . as a direct consequence of our strict biadjoint triangle theorem , we give the construction ( due to Lack ) of the left 2 - adjoint to the inclusion of the strict algebra into the pseudoalgebra . in the last section , we give two brief application on lift biadjunction and pseudo - kan extension .

title: A characterization of central extensions in the variety of quandles
authors: Valérian Even, Marino Gran and Andrea Montoli
abstract: the category of symmetric quandle be a Mal'tsev variety whose subvariety of abelian symmetric quandle be the category of abelian algebra . we give an algebraic description of the quandle extension that be central for the adjunction between the variety of quandle and its subvariety of abelian symmetric quandle .

title: Transfinite limits in topos theory
abstract: for a coherent site we construct a canonically associate enlarged coherent site , such that cohomology of bound below complex be preserve by the enlargement . in the topo associate to the enlarge site transfinite composition of epimorphism be epimorphism and a weak analog of the concept of the algebraic closure exist . the construction be a variant of the work of Bhatt and Scholze on the pro - etale topology .

title: On the magnitude of a finite dimensional algebra
authors: Joseph Chuang, Alastair King and Tom Leinster
abstract: there be a general notion of the magnitude of an enrich category , define subject to hypothesis . in topological and geometric context , magnitude be already know to be closely related to classical invariant such as Euler characteristic and dimension . here we establish its significance in an algebraic context . specifically , in the representation theory of an associative algebra $ a$ , a central role be play by the indecomposable projective $ a$ -module , which form a category enrich in vector space . we show that the magnitude of that category be a know homological invariant of the algebra : write $ \chi_A$ for the Euler form of $ a$ and $ s$ for the direct sum of the simple $ a$ -module , it be $ \chi_a(s , S)$.

title: Relative symmetric monoidal closed categories I: Autoenrichment and change of base
abstract: symmetric monoidal close category may be relate to one another not only by the functor between they but also by enrichment of one in another , and it be know to G. M. Kelly in the 1960 that there be a very close connection between these phenomenon . in this first part of a two - part series on this subject , we show that the assignment to each symmetric monoidal closed category $ v$ its associate $ v$-enriche category $ underline{v}$ extend to a 2 - functor value in an op-2 - fibred 2 - category of symmetric monoidal closed category enrich over various basis . for a fixed $ v$ , we show that this induce a 2 - functorial passage from symmetric monoidal close category over $ V$ ( i.e. , equip with a morphism to $ V$ ) to symmetric monoidal closed $ v$-categorie over $ underline{v}$. as a consequence , we find that the enrich adjunction determine a symmetric monoidal close adjunction can be obtain by apply a 2 - functor and , consequently , be an adjunction in the 2 - category of symmetric monoidal closed $ v$-categorie .

title: Enriched algebraic theories and monads for a system of arities
abstract: under a minimum of assumption , we develop in generality the basic theory of universal algebra in a symmetric monoidal closed category $ v$ with respect to a specify system of arity $ j : j \hookrightarrow v$. Lawvere 's notion of algebraic theory generalize to this context , result in the notion of single - sorted $ v$-enriche $ j$-cotensor theory , or $ j$-theory for short . for suitable choice of $ v$ and $ j$ , such $ j$-theorie include the enriched algebraic theory of Borceux and Day , the enrich Lawvere theory of Power , the equational theory of Linton 's 1965 work , and the $ v$-theories of Dubuc , which be recover by take $ j = v$ and correspond to arbitrary $ v$-monad on $ v$. we identify a modest condition on $ j$ that entail that the $ v$-category of $ t$-algebra exist and be monadic over $ v$ for every $ j$-theory $ t$ , even when $ t$ be not small and $ v$ be neither complete nor cocomplete . we show that $ j$ satisfy this condition if and only if $ j$ present $ v$ as a free cocompletion of $ j$ with respect to the weight for left Kan extension along $ j$ , and so we call such system of arity eleutheric . we show that $ j$-theorie for an eleutheric system may be equivalently describe as ( i ) monad in a certain one - object bicategory of profunctor on $ j$ , and ( ii ) $ v$-monad on $ V$ satisfy a certain condition . we prove a characterization theorem for the category of algebra of $ j$-theorie , consider as $ v$-categorie $ a$ equip with a specified $ v$-functor $ a \rightarrow v$.

title: A two-dimensional Birkhoff's theorem
abstract: Birkhoff 's variety theorem from universal algebra characterise equational subcategorie of variety . we give an analogue of Birkhoff 's theorem in the setting of enrichment in category . for a suitable notion of an equational subcategory we characterise these subcategorie by their closure property in the ambient algebraic category .

title: The heart of a combinatorial model category
abstract: we show that every small model category that satisfy certain size condition can be complete to yield a combinatorial model category , and conversely , every combinatorial model category arise in this way . we will also see that these construction preserve right properness and compatibility with simplicial enrichment . along the way , we establish some technical result on the index of accessibility of various construction on accessible category , which may be of independent interest .

title: The Euler characteristic of an enriched category
abstract: we develop the homotopy theory of Euler characteristic ( magnitude ) of a category enrich in a monoidal model category . if a monoidal model category $ v$ be equip with an Euler characteristic that be compatible with weak equivalence and fibration in $ v$ , then our Euler characteristic of $ v$-enriche category be also compatible with weak equivalence and fibration in the canonical model structure on the category of $ v$-enriche category . in particular , we focus on the case of topological category ; i.e. , category enrich in the category of topological space . as its application , we obtain the ordinary Euler characteristic of a cellular stratified space $ x$ by compute the Euler characteristic of the face category $ c(x)$.

title: A characterization of the Huq commutator
abstract: we study a categorical commutator , introduce by Huq , define for a pair of coterminal morphism . we show that in a normal unital category C with finite colimit , the normal closure of the regular image of the Huq commutator of a pair of subobject under an arbitrary morphism be the same as the Huq commutator of their respective regular image . then we use this property to characterize the Huq commutator as the large commutator satisfy certain property .

title: Stability properties characterising n-permutable categories
abstract: the purpose of this paper be two - fold . a first and more concrete aim be to characterise n - permutable category through certain stability property of regular epimorphism . these characterisation allow we to recover the ternary term and the ( n+1)-ary term describe n - permutable variety of universal algebra . a second and more abstract aim be to explain two proof technique , by use the above characterisation as an opportunity to provide explicit new example of their use : - an embedding theorem for n - permutable category which allow we to follow the varietal proof to show that an n - permutable category have certain property ; - the theory of unconditional exactness property which allow we to remove the assumption of the existence of colimit , in particular when we use the approximate co - operation approach to show that a regular category be n - permutable .

title: Mal'tsev objects, $R_1$-spaces and ultrametric spaces
abstract: in this paper we introduce a notion of Mal'tsev object , and the dual notion of co - Mal'tsev object , in a general category . in particular , a category C be a Mal'tsev category if and only if every object in C be a Mal'tsev object . we show that for a well - power regular category C which admit coproduct , the full subcategory of Mal'tsev object be coreflective in C. we show that the co - Mal'tsev object in the category of topological space and continuous map be precisely the $ r_1$-space , and that the co - Mal'tsev object in the category of metric space and short map be precisely the ultrametric space .

title: Approximate categorical structures
abstract: we consider notion of metrize category , and then approximate categorical structure define by a function of three variable generalize the notion of 2 - metric space . we prove an embedding theorem give sufficient condition for an approximate categorical structure to come from an inclusion into a metrize category .

title: Action representability via spans and prefibrations
abstract: we give several reformulation of action representability of a category as well as action representability of its category of morphism . in particular we show that for a semi - abelian category C , its category of morphism be action representable if and only if the functor from the category of split extension in C to C , send a split extension to its kernel , be a prefibration . to obtain these reformulation we show that certain condition be equivalent for right regular span of category .

title: Operads and phylogenetic trees
authors: John C. Baez and Nina Otter
abstract: we construct an operad Phyl whose operation be the edge - label tree use in phylogenetic . this operad be the coproduct of Com , the operad for commutative semigroup , and $ [ 0,\infty)$ , the operad with unary operation correspond to nonnegative real number , where composition be addition . we show that there be a homeomorphism between the space of n - ary operation of Phyl and $ \t_n\times [ 0,\infty)^{n+1}$ , where $ \t_n$ be the space of metric n - tree introduce by Billera , Holmes and Vogtmann . furthermore , we show that the Markov model use to reconstruct phylogenetic tree from genome datum give coalgebra of Phyl . these always extend to coalgebra of the large operad Com + $ [ 0,\infty]$ , since Markov process on finite set converge to an equilibrium as time approach infinity . we show that for any operad O , its coproduct with $ [ 0,\infty]$ contain the operad w(o ) construct by Boardman and Vogt . to prove these result , we explicitly describe the coproduct of operad in term of label tree .

title: Kan's combinatorial spectra and their sheaves revisited
authors: Ruian Chen, Igor Kriz and Ales Pultr
abstract: we define a right Cartan - Eilenberg structure on the category of Kan 's combinatorial spectrum , and the category of sheaf of such spectrum , assume some condition . in both structure , we use the geometric concept of homotopy equivalence as the strong equivalence . in the case of sheaf , we use local equivalence as the weak equivalence . this paper be the first step in a large - scale program of investigate sheaf of spectrum from a geometric viewpoint .

title: Fibered multiderivators and (co)homological descent
abstract: the theory of derivator enhance and simplify the theory of triangulate category . in this article a notion of fibered ( multi)derivator be develop , which similarly enhance fibration of ( monoidal ) triangulate category . we present a theory of cohomological as well as homological descent in this language . the main motivation be a descent theory for Grothendieck 's six operation .

title: Hopf polyads, Hopf categories and Hopf group monoids viewed as Hopf monads
abstract: we associate , in a functorial way , a monoidal bicategory Span|V to any monoidal bicategory V. two example of this construction be of particular interest : Hopf polyad of Bruguieres can be see as Hopf monad in Span|Cat while Hopf group monoid in the spirit of Zunino and Turaev in a braided monoidal category v , and Hopf category of Batista - Caenepeel - Vercruysse over V both turn out to be Hopf monad in Span|V. Hopf group monoid and Hopf category be Hopf monad on a distinguished type of monoidale fit the framework of Bohm - Lack . these example be relate by a monoidal pseudofunctor v -&gt ; Cat .

title: Localization of enriched categories and cubical sets
abstract: the invertibility hypothesis for a monoidal model category S ask that localize an S - enrich category with respect to an equivalence result in an weakly equivalent enrich category . this be the most technical among the axiom for S to be an excellent model category in the sense of Lurie , who show that the category cat_s of S - enrich category then have a model structure with characterizable fibrant object . we use a universal property of cubical set , as a monoidal model category , to show that the invertibility hypothesis be a consequence of the other axiom .

title: A Dold-Kan theorem for simplicial Lie algebras
abstract: we introduce and study hypercrossed complex of Lie algebra , that is , non - negatively graded chain complex of Lie algebra $ l=(l_n,\partial_n)$ endow with an additional structure by mean of a suitable set of bilinear map $ l_r\times l_s\rightarrow l_n$. the Moore complex of any simplicial Lie algebra acquire such a structure and , in this way , we prove a Dold - Kan type equivalence between the category of simplicial Lie algebra and the category of hypercrossed complex of Lie algebra . several consequence of examine particular class of hypercrossed complex of Lie algebra be present .

title: Coexponentiability and  Projectivity: Rigs, Rings, and Quantales
abstract: we show that a commutative monoid a be coexponentiable in cmon(v ) if and only if $ -\otime a : v \to v$ have a left adjoint , when v be a cocomplete symmetric monoidal closed category with finite biproduct and in which every object be a quotient of a free . use a general characterization of the latter , we show that an algebra over a rig or ring r be coexponentiable if and only if it be finitely generate and projective as an r - module . omit the finiteness condition , the same result ( and proof ) be obtain for algebra over a quantale .

title: Combinatorics of past-similarity in higher dimensional transition systems
abstract: the key notion to understand the left determined Olschok model category of star - shaped Cattani - Sassone transition system be past - similarity . two state be past - similar if they have homotopic past . an object be fibrant if and only if the set of transition be close under past - similarity . a map be a weak equivalence if and only if it induce an isomorphism after the identification of all past - similar state . the last part of this paper be a discussion about the link between causality and homotopy .

title: Free objects over posemigroups in the category PoSgr_v
authors: Shengwei Han, Changchun Xia, Xiaojuan Gu
abstract: as we all know , the complete lattice i_d(s ) of all d - ideal of a meet - semilattice s be precisely the injective hull of S in the category of meet - semilattice . in this paper , we consider sm - ideal of posemigroup which can be regard as a generalization of d - ideal of meet - semilattice . unfortunately , the quantale r(s ) of all sm - ideal of a posemigroup S be in general not an injective hull of S. however , r(s ) can be see as a new type of quantale completion of S. far , we can see that r(s ) be also a free object over S in the category posgr_v of posemigroup with sm - distributive join homomorphism .

title: Classifiers for monad morphisms and adjunction morphisms
abstract: we provide an explicit model for the free 2 - category contain n composable adjunction morphism , comparable to the Schanuel and Street model for the free adjunction . we can extract from it an explicit model for the free 2 - category contain n composable lax monad morphism . a careful proof be give , which go through presentation of the hom - category of our model . we use one of these hom - category as an indexing category to construct an extended Artin - Mazur codiagonal , whose underlie bisimplicial set have the classical Artin - Mazur codiagonal as its first column .

title: The canonical 2-gerbe of a holomorphic vector bundle
abstract: for each holomorphic vector bundle we construct a holomorphic bundle 2 - gerbe that geometrically represent its second Beilinson - Chern class . apply to the cotangent bundle , this may be regard as a high analogue of the canonical line bundle in complex geometry . moreover , we exhibit the precise relationship between holomorphic and smooth gerbe . for example , we introduce an Atiyah class for gerbe and prove a Koszul - Malgrange type theorem .

title: A bicategory of decorated cospans
abstract: if C be a category with pullback then there be a bicategory with the same object as C , span as morphism , and map of span as 2 - morphism , as show by Benabou . Fong have develop a theory of ` decorated cospan ' , which be cospan in C equip with extra structure . this extra structure arise from a symmetric lax monoidal functor f : C --&gt ; d ; we use this functor to ` decorate ' each cospan with apex n in C with an element of f(n ) . use a result of Shulman , we show that when C have finite colimit , decorate cospan be morphism in a symmetric monoidal bicategory . we illustrate our construction with example from electrical engineering and the theory of chemical reaction network .

title: Biextensions, bimonoidal functors, multilinear functor calculus, and categorical rings
abstract: we associate to a bimonoidal functor , i.e. a bifunctor which be monoidal in each variable , a nonabelian version of a biextension . we show that such a biextension satisfy additional triviality condition which make it a bilinear analog of the kind of span know as butterfly and , conversely , these datum determine a bimonoidal functor . we extend this result to n - variable , and prove that , in a manner analogous to that of butterfly , these multi - extension can be compose . this be phrase in term of a multilinear functor calculus in a bicategory . as an application , we study a bimonoidal category or stack , treat the multiplicative structure as a bimonoidal functor with respect to the additive one . in the context of the multilinear functor calculus , we view the bimonoidal structure as an instance of the general notion of pseudo - monoid . we show that when the structure be ring - like , i.e. the pseudo - monoid be a stack whose fiber be categorical ring , we can recover the classification by the third Mac ~ Lane cohomology of a ring with value in a bimodule .

title: A Urysohn type lemma for groupoids
abstract: start from the observation that through groupoid we can express in a unified way the notion of fundamental system of entourage of a uniform structure on a space x , respectively the system of neighborhood of the unity of a topological group that determine its topology , we introduce in this paper a notion of g - uniformity for a groupoid g. the topology induce by a g - uniformity turn g into a topological locally transitive groupoid . we also prove a Urysohn type lemma for groupoid and obtain metrization theorem for groupoid unify in two way the Alexandroff - Urysohn Theorem and Birkhoff - Kakutani Theorem .

title: Connections in tangent categories
abstract: connection be an important tool of differential geometry . this paper investigate their definition and structure in the abstract setting of tangent category . at this level of abstraction we derive several classically important result about connection , include the Bianchi identity , identity for curvature and torsion , almost complex structure , and parallel transport .

title: Topological properties of non-Archimedean approach spaces
authors: Eva Colebunders and Karen Van Opdenbosch
abstract: in this paper we give an isomorphic description of the category of non - archimedian approach space as a category of lax algebra for the ultrafilter monad and an appropriate quantale . non - archimedean approach space be characterise as those approach space have a tower consist of topology . we study topological property p , for p compactness and Hausdorff separation along with low - separation property , regularity , normality and extremal disconnectedness and link these property to the condition that all or some of the level topology in the tower have p. a compactification technique be develop base on Shanin 's method .

title: A unifying approach to the acyclic models method and other lifting lemmas
abstract: we prove a fundamental lemma of homological algebra and show how it set a framework for many different lift ( or comparison ) theorem of homological algebra and algebraic topology . among these be different version of the acyclic model method .

title: Metric spaces and SDG
abstract: we present an axiomatic theory , base on the notion of metric space and space with a ( first order ) neighbour relation . the axiomatic imply a synthetic proof of Huygens ' principle of wave front , as envelope of a family of sphere . a model of the axiomatic be present in term of synthetic differential geometry ( SDG ) .

title: Levi categories and graphs of groups
authors: Mark V. Lawson and Alistair R. Wallis
abstract: we define a Levi category to be a weakly orthogonal category equip with a suitable length functor and prove two main theorem about they . first , skeletal cancellative Levi category be precisely the categorical version of graph of group with a give orientation . second , the universal groupoid of a skeletal cancellative Levi category be the fundamental groupoid of the correspond graph of group . these two result can be view as a co - ordinate - free refinement of a classical theorem of Philip Higgins .

title: A property of effectivization and its uses in categorical logic
abstract: we show that a fully faithful and cover regular functor between regular category induce a fully faithful ( and cover ) functor between their respective effectivization . such a functor between effective category be know to be an equivalence . we exploit this result in order to give a constructive proof of conceptual completeness for regular logic . we also use it in analyze what it mean for a morphism between effective category to be a quotient in the 2 - category of effective category and regular functor between they .

title: Lax distributive laws for topology, II
authors: Hongliang Lai, Lili Shen and Walter Tholen
abstract: for a small quantaloid Q we consider four fundamental 2 - monad t on Q - Cat , give by the presheaf 2 - monad P and the copresheaf 2 - monad p^{\dagger } , as well as by their two composite 2 - monad , and establish that they all laxly distribute over P. these four 2 - monad therefore admit lax extension to the category Q - Dist of q - category and their distributor . we characterize the correspond ( t , q)-categorie in each of the four case , lead we to both known and novel categorical structure .

title: Closure operators in abelian categories and spectral spaces
abstract: we give several new way of construct spectral space start with object in abelian category satisfy certain condition which apply , in particular , to Grothendieck category . for this , we consider the space of invariant of closure operator act on subobject of a give object . the key to our result be a newly discover criterion of Finocchiaro that use ultrafilter to identify spectral space along with subbase of quasi - compact open set .

title: A presentation of bases for parametrized iterativity
authors: Jiri Adamek, Stefan Milius and Jiri Velebil
abstract: finitary monad on a locally finitely presentable category a be well - know to possess a presentation by signature and equation . here we prove that , analogously , basis on A , i.e. , finitary functor from A to the category of finitary monad on A , possess a presentation by parametrize signature and equation .

title: Frobenius algebras and homotopy fixed points of group actions on bicategories
authors: Jan Hesse, Christoph Schweigert, and Alessandro Valentino
abstract: we explicitly show that symmetric Frobenius structure on a finite - dimensional , semi - simple algebra stand in bijection to homotopy fix point of the trivial so(2)-action on the bicategory of finite - dimensional , semi - simple algebra , bimodule and intertwiner . the result be motivate by the 2 - dimensional Cobordism Hypothesis for orient manifold , and can hence be interpret in the realm of topological Quantum Field Theory .

title: Algebraic databases
authors: Patrick Schultz, David I. Spivak, Christina Vasilakopoulou, and Ryan Wisnesky
abstract: database have be study category - theoretically for decade . while mathematically elegant , previous categorical model have typically struggle withrepresente concrete datum such as integer or string . in the present work , we propose an extension of the early set - value functor model , make use of multi - sorted algebraic theory ( a.k.a . Lawvere theory ) to incorporate concrete datum in a principled way . this approach easily handle miss information ( null value ) , and also allow constraint and query to make use of operation on datum , such as multiplication or comparison of number , help to bridge the gap between traditional database and programming language . we also show how all of the component of our model - include schema , instance , change - of - schema functor , and query fit into a single double categorical structure call a proarrow equipment ( a.k.a . framed bicategory ) .

title: The two out of three property in ind-categories and a convenient model category of spaces
abstract: the author and Tomer Schlank study a much weak homotopical structure than a model category , which we call a " weak cofibration category " . we show that a small weak cofibration category induce in a natural way a model category structure on its ind - category , provide the ind - category satisfy a certain two out of three property . the main purpose of this paper be to give sufficient intrinsic condition on a weak cofibration category for this two out of three property to hold . we consider an application to the category of compact metrizable space , and thus obtain a model structure on its ind - category . this model structure be define on a category that be closely related to a category of topological space and have many convenient formal property . a more general application of these result , to the ( opposite ) category of separable $ c^*$-algebra , appear in a paper by the author , Michael Joachim and Snigdhayan Mahanta .

title: Building a model category out of multiplier ideal sheaves
abstract: we will construct a Quillen model structure out of the multiplier ideal sheaf on a smooth quasi - projective variety use early work of Isaksen and Barnea and Schlank . we also show that fibrant object of this model category be make of kawamata log terminal pair in birational geometry .

title: A categorical approach to Picard-Vessiot theory
abstract: Picard - Vessiot ring be present in many setting like differential Galois theory , difference Galois theory and Galois theory of artinian simple module algebra . in this article we set up an abstract framework in which we can prove theorem on existence and uniqueness of Picard - Vessiot ring , as well as on Galois group correspond to the Picard - Vessiot ring . as the present approach restrict to the categorical property which all the category of differential module resp.~difference module etc.~share , it give unify proof for all these Galois theory ( and maybe more general one ) .

title: Epireflective subcategories and formal closure operators
authors: Mathieu Duckerts-Antoine, Marino Gran, and Zurab Janelidze
abstract: on a category $ \mathscr{c}$ with a designate ( well - behaved ) class $ \mathcal{m}$ of monomorphism , a closure operator in the sense of D.~Dikranjan and E.~Giuli be a pointed endofunctor of $ \mathcal{m}$ , see as a full subcategory of the arrow - category $ \mathscr{c}^\mathbf{2}$ whose object be morphism from the class $ \mathcal{m}$ , which ` ` commute '' with the codomain functor $ \mathsf{cod}\colon \mathcal{m}\to \mathscr{c}$. in other word , a closure operator consist of a functor $ c\colon \mathcal{m}\to\mathcal{m}$ and a natural transformation $ c\colon 1_\mathcal{m}\to c$ such that $ \mathsf{cod } \cdot c = c$ and $ \mathsf{cod}\cdot c=1_\mathsf{cod}$. in this paper we adapt this notion to the domain functor $ \mathsf{dom}\colon \mathcal{e}\to\mathscr{c}$ , where $ \mathcal{e}$ be a class of epimorphism in $ \mathscr{c}$ , and show that such closure operator can be use to classify $ \mathcal{e}$-epireflective subcategorie of $ \mathscr{c}$ , provide $ \mathcal{e}$ be closed under composition and contain isomorphism .

title: Monoid-like definitions of cyclic operad
abstract: guide by the microcosm principle of Baez - Dolan and by the algebraic definition of operad of Kelly and Fiore , we introduce two ` ` monoid - like '' definition of cyclic operad , one for the original , ` ` exchangable - output '' characterisation of Getzler - Kapranov , and the other for the alternative ` ` entry - only '' characterisation , both within the category of Joyal 's specie of structure . rely on a result of Lamarche on descent for specie , we use these " monoid - like " definition to prove the equivalence between the ` ` exchangable - output '' and ` ` entry - only '' point of view on cyclic operad .

title: Classifying tangent structures using Weil algebras
abstract: at the heart of differential geometry be the construction of the tangent bundle of a manifold . there be various abstraction of this construction , and of particular interest here be that of Tangent Structures . Tangent Structure be define via give an underlie category M and a tangent functor T along with a list of natural transformation satisfy a set of axiom , then detail the behaviour of T in the category End(M ) . however , this axiomatic definition at first seem somewhat disjoint from other approach in differential geometry . the aim of this paper be to present a perspective that address this issue . more specifically , this paper highlight a very explicit relationship between the axiomatic definition of Tangent Structure and the Weil algebra ( which have a well establish place in differential geometry ) .

title: Corelations are the prop for extraspecial commutative Frobenius monoids
abstract: just as binary relation between set may be understand as jointly monic span , so too may equivalence relation on the disjoint union of set be understand as jointly epic cospan . with the ensue notion of composition inherit from the pushout of cospan , we call these equivalence relation corelation . we define the category of corelation between finite set and prove that it be equivalent to the prop for extraspecial commutative Frobenius monoid . dually , we show that the category of relation be equivalent to the prop for special commutative bimonoid . throughout , we emphasise how corelation model interconnection .

title: KZ-monadic categories and their logic
abstract: give an order - enrich category , it be know that all its KZ - monadic subcategorie can be describe by Kan - injectivity with respect to a collection of morphism . we prove the analogous result for Kan - injectivity with respect to a collection h of commutative square . a square be call a Kan - injective consequence of H if by add it to H Kan - injectivity be not change . we present a sound logic for Kan - injectivity consequence and prove that in ` ` reasonable " category ( such as $ \pos$ or $ \top_0 $ ) it be also complete for every set h of square .

title: Witt vectors and truncation posets
abstract: one way to define Witt vector start with a truncation set $ s \subset n$. we generalize Witt vector to truncation poset , and show how three type of map of truncation poset can be use to encode the follow six structure map on Witt vector : addition , multiplication , restriction , Frobenius , Verschiebung and norm .

title: A note on injective hulls of posemigroups
authors: Changchun Xia, Shengwei Han, Bin Zhao
abstract: in this note , we prove the existence of $ e_\leq$-injective hull in the category $ posgr_\leq$ of posemigroup and their submultiplicative order - preserve map ; here $ e_\leq$ denote the class of those morphism $ h : a \to b$ for which $ h(a_1) ... h(a_n)\leq h(a)$ always imply $ a_1 ... a_n\leq a$. the result of this note subsume the result give by Lambek et al . ( 2012 ) and by Zhang and Laan ( 2014 ) .

title: Bourn-normal monomorphisms in regular Mal'tsev categories
abstract: normal monomorphism in the sense of Bourn describe the equivalence class of an internal equivalence relation . although the definition be give in the fairly general setting of a category with finite limit , later investigation on this subject often focus on protomodular setting , where normality become a property . this paper clarify the connection between internal equivalence relation and Bourn - normal monomorphism in regular Mal'tesv category with pushout of split monomorphism along arbitrary morphism , whereas a full description be achieve for quasi - pointed regular Mal'tsev category with pushout of split monomorphism along arbitrary morphism .

title: Homotopy theory for algebras over polynomial monads
authors: M. A. Batanin and C. Berger
abstract: we study the existence and left properness of transfer model structure for ` ` monoid - like '' object in monoidal model category . these include genuine monoid , but also all kind of operad as for instance symmetric , cyclic , modular , high operad , properad and PROP ' . all these structure can be realise as algebra over polynomial monad . we give a general condition for a polynomial monad which ensure the existence and ( relative ) left properness of a transfer model structure for its algebra . this condition be of a combinatorial nature and single out a special class of polynomial monad which we call tame polynomial . many important monad be show to be tame polynomial .

title: The $(\Pi,\lambda)$-structures on the C-systems defined by universe categories
abstract: we define the notion of a $ ( p,\tilde{p})$-structure on a universe $ p$ in a locally cartesian closed category category with a binary product structure and construct a $ ( \pi,\lambda)$-structure on the c - system $ cc(c , p)$ from a $ ( p,\tilde{p})$-structure on $ p$. we then define homomorphism of C - system with $ ( \pi,\lambda)$-structure and functor of universe category with $ ( p,\tilde{p})$-structures and show that our construction be functorial relative to these definition .

title: C-systems defined by universe categories: presheaves
abstract: the main result of this paper may be state as a construction of " almost representation " $ \mu_n$ and $ \tilde{\mu}_n$ for the presheave $ \ob_n$ and $ \tilde{Ob}_n$ on the c - system define by locally cartesian closed universe category with binary product structure and the study of the behavior of these " almost representation " with respect to the universe category functor . in addition , we study a number of construction on presheave on c - system and on universe category that be use in the proof of our main result , but be expect to have other application as well .

title: Simplicial Nerve of an $A_\infty$-category
abstract: we introduce a functor call the simplicial nerve of an $ a_\infty$-category define on the category of $ a_\infty$-categorie with value in simplicial set . we show that the nerve of an $ a_\infty$-category be an $ ( \infty,1)$-category in the sense of J. Lurie . this construction generalize the nerve construction for differential grade category give by Lurie . we prove that if a differential grade category be pretriangulate in the sense of A.I. Bondal and M. Kapranov then its nerve be a stable $ ( \infty,1)$-category in the sense of J. Lurie .

title: On finitely aligned left cancellative small categories, Zappa-Szep products and Exel-Pardo algebras
authors: Erik Bedos, S. Kaliszewski, John Quigg, and Jack Spielberg
abstract: we consider Toeplitz and Cuntz - Krieger $ c^*$-algebra associate with fin\-itely align left cancellative small category . we pay special attention to the case where such a category arise as the Zappa - Szep product of a category and a group link by a one - cocycle . as our main application , we obtain a new approach to Exel - Pardo algebra in the case of row - finite graph . we also present some other way of construct $ c^*$-algebra from left cancellative small category and discuss their relationship .

title: Coarse-graining open Markov processes
authors: John C. Baez and Kenny Courser
abstract: coarse - graining be a standard method of extract a simple Markov process from a more complicated one by identify state . here we extend coarse - graining to ` open ' Markov process : that be , those where probability can flow in or out of certain state call ` input ' and ` output ' . one can build up an ordinary Markov process from small open piece in two basic way : composition , where we identify the output of one open Markov process with the input of another , and tensoring , where we set two open Markov process side by side . in previous work , Fong , Pollard and the first author show that these construction make open Markov process into the morphism of a symmetric monoidal category . here we go far by construct a symmetric monoidal double category where the 2 - morphism include way of coarse - grain open Markov process . we also extend the already know ` black - boxing ' functor from the category of open Markov process to our double category . black - boxing send any open Markov process to the linear relation between input and output datum that hold in steady state , include nonequilibrium steady state where there be a nonzero flow of probability through the process . to extend black - boxing to a functor between double category , we need to prove that black - boxing be compatible with coarse - grain .

title: The localic isotropy group of a topos
abstract: it have be show by J.Funk , P.Hofstra and B.Steinberg that any Grothendieck topos $ t$ be endow with a canonical group object , call its isotropy group , which act functorially on every object of the topos . we show that this group be in fact the group of point of a localic group object , call the localic isotropy group , which also act on every object , and in fact also on every internal locale and on every $ t$-topos . this new localic isotropy group have well functoriality and stability property than the original version and shed some light on the phenomenon of high isotropy observe for the ordinary isotropy group . we prove in particular use a localic version of the isotropy quotient that any geometric morphism can be factor uniquely as a connect atomic geometric morphism follow by a so call ` ` essentially anisotropic '' geometric morphism , and that connect atomic morphism be exactly the quotient by open isotropy action , hence provide a form of Galois theory for general ( unpointed ) connect atomic geometric morphism .

title: Category theory for genetics I:mutations and sequence alignments
abstract: the present article be the first of a series whose goal be to define a logical formalism in which it be possible to reason about genetic . in this paper , we introduce the main concept of our language whose domain of discourse consist of a class of limit - sketch and their associate model . while our program will aim to show that different phenomenon of genetic can be model by change the category in which the model take their value , in this paper , we study model in the category of set to capture mutation mechanism such as insertion , deletion , substitution , duplication and inversion . we show how the propose formalism can be use for construct multiple sequence alignment with an emphasis on mutation mechanism .

title: Linear Distributivity With Negation, Star-Autonomy, and Hopf Monads
authors: Masahito Hasegawa and Jean-Simon P. Lemay
abstract: we show that a Hopf monad on a * -autonomous category lift * -autonomous structure to the category of algebra precisely when there be an algebra structure on the dualize object . our proof be base on Pastro 's characterization of * -autonomous ( co)monad as linearly distributive ( co)monad with negation .

title: Polynomials, fibrations and distributive laws
abstract: we study the structure of the category of polynomial in a locally cartesian closed category . formalize the conceptual view that polynomial be construct from sum and product , we characterize this category in term of the composite of the pseudomonad which freely add fibred sum and product to fibration . the composite pseudomonad structure correspond to a pseudo - distributive law between these two pseudomonad , which exist if and only if the base category be locally cartesian closed .

title: A tangent category alternative to the Faa di Bruno construction
abstract: the Faa di Bruno construction , introduce by Cockett and Seely , construct a comonad Faa whose coalgebra be precisely cartesian differential category . in other word , for a cartesian left additive category x , faa(x ) be the cofree cartesian differential category over X. composition in these cofree cartesian differential category be base on the Faa di Bruno formula , and correspond to composition of differential form . this composition , however , be somewhat complex and difficult to work with . in this paper we provide an alternative construction of cofree cartesian differential category inspire by tangent category . in particular , composition define here be base on the fact that the chain rule for cartesian differential category can be express use the tangent functor , which simplify the formulation of the high order chain rule .

title: $T_0$ topological spaces and $T_0$ posets in the topos of M-sets
authors: M.M. Ebrahimi, M. Mahmoudi, and A.H. Nejah
abstract: in this paper , we introduce the concept of a topological space in the topos M - Set of M - set , for a monoid M. we do this by replace the notion of open " subset " by open " subobject " in the definition of a topology . we prove that the result category have an open subobject classifier , which be the counterpart of the Sierpinski space in this topos . we also study the relation between the give notion of topology and the notion of a poset in this universe . in fact , the counterpart of the specialization pre - order be give for topological space in M - Set , and it be show that , similar to the classic case , for a special kind of topological space in M - Set , namely $ t_0 $ one , it be a partial order . furthermore , we obtain the universal $ t_0 $ space , and give the adjunction between topological space and $ t_0 $ poset , in M - Set .

title: On a higher structure on operadic deformation complexes
abstract: in this paper , we prove that there be a canonical homotopy ( n+1)-algebra structure on the shift operadic deformation complex $ \def(e_n\to\mathcal{p})[-n]$ for any operad $ \mathcal{p}$ and a map of operad $ f\colon e_n\to\mathcal{p}$. this result generalize a result of Tamarkin , who consider the case $ \mathcal{p}=\end_\op(x)$. another more computational proof of the same result be recently sketch by Calaque and Willwacher . our method combine the one of Tamarkin , with the categorical algebra on the category of symmetric sequence , introduce by Rezk and far develop by Kapranov - Manin and Fresse . we define suitable deformation functor on n - coalgebra , which be consider as the " non - commutative " base of deformation , prove their representability , and translate property of the functor to the correspond property of the represent object . a new point , which make the method more powerful , be to consider the argument of our deformation theory as an object of the category of symmetric sequence of dg vector space , not as just a single dg vector space .

title: Coalgebroids in monoidal bicategories and their comodules
abstract: quantum category have be recently study because of their relation to bialgebroid , small category , and skew monoidale . this be the first of a series of paper base on the author 's phd thesis in which we examine the theory of quantum category develop by Day , Lack , and Street . a quantum category be an opmonoidal monad on the monoidale associate to a biduality $ r\dashv r^{o}$ , or enveloping monoidale , in a monoidal bicategory of module $ \mod(v})$ for a monoidal category $ v$. Lack and Street prove that quantum category be in equivalence with right skew monoidale whose unit have a right adjoint in $ \mod(v)$. our first important result be similar to that of Lack and Street . it be a characterisation of opmonoidal arrow on envelop monoidale in term of a new structure name oplax action . we then provide three different notion of comodule for an opmonoidal arrow , and use a similar technique we prove that they be equivalent . finally , when the opmonoidal arrow be an opmonoidal monad , we be able to provide the category of comodule for a quantum category with a monoidal structure such that the forgetful functor be monoidal .

title: Tube representations and twisting of graded categories
abstract: we study deformation of tube algebra under twisting of grade monoidal category . when a tensor category $ c$ be grade over a group $ \gammaa$ , a torus - value 3 - cocycle on $ \gammaa$ can be use to deform the associator of $ c$ . we show that it induce a 2 - cocycle on the groupoid of the adjoint action of $ \gammaa$. combine with the natural Fell bundle structure of tube algebra over this groupoid , we show that the tube algebra of the twist category be a 2 - cocycle twisting of the original one .

title: Crossed products of crossed modules of Hopf monoids
authors: J.N. Alonso Alvarez, J.M. Fernandez Vilaboa, and R. Gonzalez Rodriguez
abstract: in this paper we consider a cross product of two cross module of Hopf monoid in a strict symmetric monoidal category $ { \mathcal c}$ and give necessary and sufficient condition to get a new cross module of Hopf monoid in $ { \mathcal c}$. moreover we introduce the notion of projection of cross module of Hopf monoid and show that with additional hypothesis , any of these projection define a new cross module of Hopf monoid and allow we to construct an example of this kind of cross product . finally , we develop the explicit computation of a cross product associate to a projection of cross module in group .

title: On the geometric notion of connection and its expression in tangent categories
abstract: tangent category provide an axiomatic approach to key structural aspect of differential geometry that exist not only in the classical category of smooth manifold but also in algebraic geometry , homological algebra , computer science , and combinatoric . generalize the notion of \textit{(linear ) connection } on a smooth vector bundle , Cockett and Cruttwell have define a notion of connection on a differential bundle in an arbitrary tangent category . herein , we establish equivalent formulation of this notion of connection that reduce the amount of specify structure require . far , one of our equivalent formulation substantially reduce the number of axiom impose , and other provide useful abstract conceptualization of connection . in particular , we show that a connection on a differential bundle $ e$ over $ m$ be equivalently give by a single morphism $ k$ that induce a suitable decomposition of $ TE$ as a biproduct . we also show that a connection be equivalently give by a vertical connection $ k$ for which a certain associate diagram be a limit diagram .

title: The Ehresmann-Schein-Nambooripad Theorem for inverse categories
abstract: the Ehresmann - Schein - Nambooripad ( ESN ) theorem assert an equivalence between the category of inverse semigroup and the category of inductive groupoid . in this paper , we consider the category of inverse category and functor - a natural generalization of inverse semigroup and semigroup homomorphism - and extend the ESN Theorem to an equivalence between this category and the category of locally complete inductive groupoid and locally inductive functor . from the proof of this extension , we also generalize the ESN Theorem to an equivalence between the category of inverse semicategorie and the category of locally inductive groupoid and to an equivalence between the category of inverse category with oplax functor and the category of locally complete inductive groupoid and ordered functor .

title: A structure theorem for quasi-Hopf bimodule coalgebras
abstract: let H be a quasi - hopf algebra . we show that any H - bimodule coalgebra c for which there exist an h - bimodule coalgebra morphism n : c -&gt ; h be isomorphic to what we will call a smash product coalgebra . to this end , we use an explicit monoidal equivalence between the category of two - sided two - cosided Hopf module over H and the category of left Yetter - Drinfeld module over H. this categorical method allow also to reobtain the structure theorem for a quasi - hopf ( bi)comodule algebra give by Panaite and Van Oystaeyen , and by Dello et al .

title: A compositional framework for passive linear networks
authors: John C. Baez and Brendan Fong
abstract: passive linear network be use in a wide variety of engineering application , but the well study be electrical circuit make of resistor , inductor and capacitor . we describe a category where a morphism be a circuit of this sort with marked input and output terminal . in this category , composition describe the process of attach the output of one circuit to the input of another . we construct a functor , dub the ` black box functor ' , that take a circuit , forget its internal structure , and remember only its external behavior . two circuit have the same external behavior if and only if they impose same relation between current and potential at their terminal . the space of these current and potential naturally have the structure of a symplectic vector space , and the relation impose by a circuit be a lagrangian linear relation . thus , the black box functor go from our category of circuit to a category with lagrangian linear relation as morphism . we prove that this functor be symmetric monoidal and indeed a hypergraph functor . we assume the reader be familiar with category theory , but not with circuit theory or symplectic linear algebra .

title: Props in network theory
authors: John C. Baez, Brandon Coya, Franciscus Rebro
abstract: long before the invention of Feynman diagram , engineer be use similar diagram to reason about electrical circuit and more general network contain mechanical , hydraulic , thermodynamic and chemical component . we can formalize this reasoning use prop : that be , strict symmetric monoidal category where the object be natural number , with the tensor product of object give by addition . in this approach , each kind of network correspond to a prop , and each network of this kind be a morphism in that prop . a network with $ m$ input and $ n$ output be a morphism from $ m$ to $ n$ , put network together in series be composition , and set they side by side be tensoring . here we work out the detail of this approach for various kind of electrical circuit , start with circuit make solely of ideal perfectly conductive wire , then circuit with passive linear component , and then circuit that also have voltage and current source . each kind of circuit correspond to a mathematically natural prop . we describe the ` behavior ' of these circuit use morphism between prop . in particular , we give a new construction of the black - boxing functor of Fong and the first author ; unlike the original construction , this new one easily generalize to circuit with nonlinear component . we also use a morphism of prop to clarify the relation between circuit diagram and the signal - flow diagram in control theory . technically , the key tool be the Rosebrugh - Sabadini - Walters result relate circuit to special commutative Frobenius monoid , the monadic adjunction between prop and signature , and a result say which symmetric monoidal category be equivalent to prop .

title: Spark complexes on good effective orbifold atlases categorically
authors: Cheng-Yong Du, Lili Shen and Xiaojuan Zhao
abstract: good atlas be define for effective orbifold , and a spark complex be construct on each good atlas . it be prove that this process be 2 - functorial with compatible system play as morphism between good atlas , and that the spark character 2 - functor factor through this 2 - functor .

title: Spheres as Frobenius objects
authors: Djordje Baralic, Zoran Petric and Sonja Telebakovic
abstract: follow the pattern of the Frobenius structure usually assign to the 1 - dimensional sphere , we investigate the Frobenius structure of sphere in all other dimension . start from dimension d=1 , all the sphere be commutative Frobenius object in category whose arrow be ( d+1)-dimensional cobordism . with respect to the language of Frobenius object , there be no distinction between these sphere - they be all free of additional equation formulate in this language . the correspond structure make out of the 0 - dimensional sphere not a commutative but a symmetric Frobenius object . this sphere be map to a matrix Frobenius algebra by a 1 - dimensional topological quantum field theory , which correspond to the representation of a class of diagrammatic algebra give by Richard Brauer .

title: Decorated corelations
abstract: let $ C$ be a category with finite colimit , and let $ ( e , M)$ be a factorisation system on $ c$ with $ m$ stable under pushout . write $ c;m^{\op}$ for the symmetric monoidal category with morphism cospan of the form $ \stackrel{c}\to \stackrel{m}\leftarrow$ , where $ c \in c$ and $ m \in m$ , we give a method for construct a category from a symmetric lax monoidal functor $ f : ( c ; \mc m^{\op},+ ) \to ( set,\times)$. a morphism in this category , term a decorate corelation , comprise ( i ) a cospan $ x \to n \leftarrow y$ in $ c$ such that the canonical copairing $ x+y \to n$ lie in $ e$ , together with ( ii ) an element of $ fn$. functor between decorate corelation category can be construct from natural transformation between the decorate functor $ f$. this provide a general method for construct hypergraph category - symmetric monoidal category in which each object be a special commutative Frobenius monoid in a coherent way - and their functor . such category be useful for model network language , for example circuit diagram , and such functor be useful for model their semantic .

title: A parallel section functor for 2-vector bundles
abstract: we associate to a 2 - vector bundle over an essentially finite groupoid a 2 - vector space of parallel section , or , in representation theoretic term , of high invariant , which can be describe as homotopy fix point . our main result be the extension of this assignment to a symmetric monoidal 2 - functor $ Par : 2vecbungrpd \to 2vect$. it be define on the symmetric monoidal bicategory $ 2vecbungrpd$ whose morphism arise from span of groupoid in such a way that the functor $ par$ provide pull - push map between 2 - vector space of parallel section of 2 - vector bundle . the direct motivation for our construction come from the orbifoldization of extended equivariant topological field theory .

title: Theory of interleavings on categories with a flow
authors: V. de Silva, E. Munch, A. Stefanou
abstract: the interleave distance be originally define in the field of Topological Data Analysis ( TDA ) by Chazal et al . as a metric on the class of persistence module parametrize over the real line . Bubenik et al . subsequently extend the definition to category of functor on a poset , the object in these category be regard as ` generalized persistence module ' . these metric typically depend on the choice of a lax semigroup of endomorphism of the poset . the purpose of the present paper be to develop a more general framework for the notion of interleave distance use the theory of ` actegorie ' . specifically , we extend the notion of interleave distance to arbitrary category equip with a flow , i.e. a lax monoidal action by the monoid $ [ 0,\infty)$. in this way , the class of object in such a category acquire the structure of a Lawvere metric space . functor that be colax $ [ 0,\infty)$-equivariant yield map that be 1 - Lipschitz . this lead to concise proof of various know stability result from TDA , by consider appropriate colax $ [ 0,\infty)$-equivariant functor . along the way , we show that several common metric , include the Hausdorff distance and the $ l^\infty$-norm , can be realize as interleave distance in this general perspective .

title: New exactness conditions involving split cubes in protomodular categories
authors: J. R. A. Gray and N. Martins-Ferreira
abstract: we introduce and compare several new exactness condition involve what we call split cube . these condition be motivate by their special case , some which become familiar , in the pointed context , once we reformulate they with split cube replace with split extension .

title: Higher isotropy
authors: J. Funk, P. Hofstra, and S. Khan
abstract: this paper be about an invariant of small category call \emph{isotropy } . every small category C have associate with it a presheaf of group on C , call its isotropy group , which in a sense solve the problem of make the assignment c |-&gt ; aut(c ) functorial . consequently , every category have a canonical congruence that annihilate the isotropy ; however , it turn out that the result quotient may itself have non - trivial isotropy . this phenomenon , which we term high order isotropy , be the subject of our investigation . we show that with each category C we may associate a sequence of group call its high isotropy group , and that these give rise to a sequence of quotient of C. this sequence lead we to an ordinal invariant for small category , which we call isotropy rank : the isotropy rank of a small category be the ordinal at which the sequence of quotient stabilize . our main result state that each small category have a well - define isotropy rank , and moreover , that for each small ordinal one may construct a small category with precisely that rank . it happen that isotropy rank of a small category be an instance of the same concept for Grothendieck toposes , for which corresponding statement hold . Most of the technical work in the paper be concern with the development of tool that allow we to compute ( high ) isotropy group of category in term of those of certain suitable subcategorie .

title: Stability for inner fibrations revisited
abstract: in this paper we prove a stability result for inner fibration in term of the wide , or fat join operation on simplicial set . we also prove some additional result on inner anodyne morphism that may be of independent interest .

title: Regularity vs. constructive complete (co)distributivity
abstract: it be well know that a relation $ \phi$ between set be regular if , and only if , $ k\phi$ be completely distributive ( cd ) , where $ k\phi$ be the complete lattice consist of fixed point of the Kan adjunction induce by $ \phi$. for a small quantaloid Q , we investigate the Q - enrich version of this classical result , i.e. , the regularity of q - distributor versus the constructive complete distributivity ( ccd ) of q - category , and prove that ` ` the dual of $ k\phi$ be ( ccd ) imply $ \phi$ be regular imply $ k\phi$ be ( ccd ) '' for any q - distributor $ \phi$. although the converse implication do not hold in general , in the case that Q be a commutative integral quantale , we show that these three statement be equivalent for any $ \phi$ if , and only if , q be a Girard quantale .

title: Double power monad preserving adjunctions are Frobenius
abstract: we give a direct proof that between two topos , f and e , bound over a base topos s , adjunction l -| r : loc_f -&gt ; loc_e over loc_s be Frobenius if and only if R commute with the double power locale monad and finite coproduct . the proof use only certain categorical property of the category of locale , Loc . this imply that between category axiomatize to behave like category of locale , it do not make a difference whether map be define as structure preserve adjunction ( i.e. those that commute with the double power monad ) or Frobenius adjunction .

title: Lax pullback complements and pullbacks of spans
authors: Seyed Naser Hosseini, Walter Tholen, and Leila Yeganeh
abstract: the formation of the " strict " span category Span(C ) of a category c with pullback be a standard organizational tool of category theory . unfortunately , limit or colimit in Span(C ) be not easily compute in term of construction in C. this paper show how to form the pullback in Span(C ) for many , but not all , pair of span , give the existence of some specific so - call lax pullback complement in C of the " left leg " of at least one of the two give span . for some type of span we require the ambient category to be adhesive to be able to form at least a weak pullback in Span(C ) . the existence of all lax pullback complement in C along a give morphism be equivalent to the exponentiability of that morphism . since exponentiability be a rather restrictive property of a morphism , the paper first develop a comprehensive framework of rule for individual lax pullback complement diagram , which resemble the set of pasting and cancellation rule for pullback diagram , include their behaviour under pullback . we also present example of lax pullback complement along non - exponentiable morphism , obtain via lift along a fibration .

title: Pseudo-Kan extensions and descent theory
abstract: there be two main construction in classical descent theory : the category of algebra and the descent category , which be know to be example of weight bilimit . we give a formal approach to descent theory , employ formal consequence of commute property of bilimit to prove classical and new theorem in the context of Janelidze - Tholen ` ` facet of Descent II '' , such as Benabou - Roubaud Theorems , a Galois theorem , embed result and formal way of get effective descent morphism . in order to do this , we develop the formal part of the theory on commute bilimit via pseudomonad theory , study idempotent pseudomonad and prove a 2 - dimensional version of the adjoint triangle theorem . also , we work out the concept of pointwise pseudo - kan extension , use as a framework to talk about bilimit , commutativity and the descent object . as a subproduct , this formal approach can be an alternative perspective / guide template for the development of high descent theory .

title: Revisiting the canonicity of canonical triangulations
abstract: stable derivator provide an enhancement of triangulated category as be indicate by the existence of canonical triangulation . in this paper we show that exact morphism of stable derivator induce exact functor of canonical triangulation , and similarly for arbitrary natural transformation . this 2 - categorical refinement also provide a uniqueness statement concern canonical triangulation . these result rely on a more careful study of morphism of derivator and this study be of independent interest . we analyze the interaction of morphism of derivator with limit , colimit , and Kan extension , include a discussion of invariance and closure property of the class of Kan extension preserve by a fix morphism .

title: On the normally ordered tensor product and duality for Tate objects
authors: O. Braunling, M. Groechenig, A. Heleodoro, J. Wolfson
abstract: this paper generalize the normally order tensor product from Tate vector space to Tate object over arbitrary exact category . we show how to lift bi - right exact monoidal structure , duality functor , and construct external hom . we list some application : ( 1 ) adele of a flag can be write as order tensor product ; ( 2 ) intersection number can be interpret via these tensor product ; ( 3 ) Pontryagin duality uniquely extend to n - Tate object in locally compact abelian group .

title: A characterization of final functors between internal groupoids in exact categories
abstract: this paper provide three characterization of final functor between internal groupoid in an exact category ( in the sense of Barr ) . in particular , it be prove that a functor between internal groupoid be final if and only if it be internally full and essentially surjective .

title: Nearly locally presentable categories
abstract: we introduce a new class of category generalize locally presentable one . the distinction do not manifest in the abelian case and , assume Vopenka 's principle , the same happen in the regular case . the category of complete partial order be the natural example of a nearly locally finitely presentable category which be not locally presentable .

title: A Brauer-Clifford-Long group for the category of dyslectic Hopf Yetter-Drinfel'd (S,H)-module algebras
abstract: Brauer - Clifford group be equivariant Brauer group for which a Hopf algebra act or coact nontrivially on the base ring .
