Brauer - Clifford group have be establish previously in the category of module for a skew group ring S#G , the category of module for the smash product S#H over a cocommutative Hopf algebra H , and its dual category of ( S , H)-Hopf module over a commutative Hopf algebra H. in this article the author introduce a Brauer - Clifford group for the category of dyslectic Hopf Yetter - Drinfel'd ( S , h)-modules for an h - commutative base ring s and quantum group h. this be the first such example in a category of module for a quantum group , and it give a new example of an equivariant Brauer group in a braided monoidal category .

title: Generating the algebraic theory of C(X): the case of partially ordered compact spaces
authors: Dirk Hofmann, Renato Neves, and Pedro Nora
abstract: it be know since the late 1960 's that the dual of the category of compact Hausdorff space and continuous map be a variety - not finitary , but bound by $ \aleph_1$. in this note we show that the dual of the category of partially order compact space and monotone continuous map be an $ \aleph_1$-ary quasivariety , and describe partially its algebraic theory . base on this description , we extend these result to category of vietoris coalgebra and homomorphism on ordered compact space . we also characterise the $ \aleph_1$-copresentable partially ordered compact space .

title: A construction of certain weak colimits and an exactness property of the 2-category of categories
authors: Descotte M.E., Dubuc E.J., Szyld M.
abstract: give a 2 - category $ a$ , a 2 - functor $ f : a \to cat$ and a distinguished 1 - subcategory $ \sigma \subset a$ contain all the object , a $ \sigma$-cone for $ f$ ( with respect to $ \sigma$ ) be a lax cone such that the structural 2 - cell correspond to the arrow of $ \sigma$ be invertible . the conical $ \sigma$-limit } be the universal ( up to isomorphism ) $ \sigma$-cone . the notion of $ \sigma$-limit generalize the well know notion of pseudo and lax limit . we consider the fundamental notion of $ \sigma$-filtered pair $ ( a , \sigma)$ which generalize the notion of 2 - filter 2 - category . we give an explicit construction of $ \sigma$-filtered $ \sigma$-colimit of category , a construction which allow computation with these colimit . we then state and prove a basic exactness property of the 2 - category of category , namely , that $ \sigma$-filtered $ \sigma$-colimit commute with finite weighted pseudo ( or bi ) limit . an important corollary of this result be that a $ \sigma$-filtered $ \sigma$-colimit of exact category value 2 - functor be exact . this corollary be essential in the 2 - dimensional theory of flat and pro - representable 2 - functor , that we develop elsewhere .

title: Regular patterns, substitudes, Feynman categories and operads
authors: Michael Batanin, Joachim Kock, and Mark Weber
abstract: we show that the regular pattern of Getzler ( 2009 ) form a 2 - category biequivalent to the 2 - category of substitude of Day and Street ( 2003 ) , and that the Feynman category of Kaufmann and Ward ( 2013 ) form a 2 - category biequivalent to the 2 - category of coloured operad ( with invertible 2 - cell ) . these biequivalence induce equivalence between the correspond category of algebra . there be three main ingredient in establish these biequivalence . the first be a strictification theorem ( exploit Power 's General Coherence Result ) which allow to reduce to the case where the structure map be identity - on - object functor and strict monoidal . second , we subsume the Getzler and Kaufmann - Ward hereditary axiom into the notion of Guitart exactness , a general condition ensure compatibility between certain left Kan extension and a give monad , in this case the free - symmetric - monoidal - category monad . finally we set up a biadjunction between substitude and what we call pin symmetric monoidal category , from which the result follow as a consequence of the fact that the hereditary map be precisely the counit of this biadjunction .

title: Spans of cospans
abstract: we study span of cospan in a category C and explain how to horizontally and vertically compose these . when C be a topos and the leg of the span be monic , these two form of composition satisfy the interchange law . in this case there be a bicategory of object , cospan , and ` monic - legged ' span of cospan in C. one motivation for this construction be an application to graph rewriting .

title: Contravariance through enrichment
abstract: we define strict and weak duality involution on 2 - category , and prove a coherence theorem that every bicategory with a weak duality involution be biequivalent to a 2 - category with a strict duality involution . for this purpose we introduce " 2 - category with contravariance " , a sort of enhance 2 - category with a basic notion of " contravariant morphism " , which can be regard either as generalize multicategorie or as enrich category . this enable a universal characterization of duality involution use absolute weight colimit , lead to a conceptual proof of the coherence theorem .

title: Dualizing cartesian and cocartesian fibrations
authors: Clark Barwick, Saul Glasman and Denis Nardin
abstract: in this technical note , we proffer a very explicit construction of the dual cocartesian fibration of a cartesian fibration , and we show they be classify by the same functor to the $ \infty$-category of $ \infty$-categories .

title: On fibrant objects in model categories
abstract: in this paper , we study property of map between fibrant object in model category . we give a characterization of weak equivalence between fibrant object . if every object of a model category be fibrant , then we give a simple description of a set of generate cofibration . we show that to construct such a model structure it be enough to check some relatively simple condition .

title: Actor of a crossed module of Leibniz algebras
authors: José Manuel Casas, Rafael Fernández-Casado, Xabier García-Martínez, Emzar Khmaladze
abstract: we extend to the category of cross module of Leibniz algebras the notion of biderivation via the action of a Leibniz algebra . this result into a pair of Leibniz algebra which allow we to construct an object which be the actor under certain circumstance . additionally , we give a description of an action in the category of cross module of Leibniz algebras in term of equation . finally , we check that , under the aforementioned condition , the kernel of the canonical map from a cross module to its actor coincide with the center and we introduce the notion of cross module of inner and outer biderivation .

title: Spans of cospans in a topos
abstract: for a topos T , there be a bicategory MonicSp(Csp(T ) ) whose object be those of T , morphism be cospan in T , and 2 - morphism be isomorphism class of monic span of cospan in T. use a result of Shulman , we prove that MonicSp(Csp(T ) ) be symmetric monoidal , and moreover , that it be compact closed in the sense of stay . we provide an application which illustrate how to encode double pushout rewrite rule as 2 - morphism inside a compact closed sub - bicategory of MonicSp(Csp(Graph ) ) .

title: Categories of weak fractions
abstract: give a set $ \Sigma$ of morphism in a category c , we construct a functor f which send element of $ \sigma$ to split monomorphism . moreover , we prove that F be weakly universal with that property when consider in the world of locally posetal 2 - category . besides , we also use locally posetal 2 - category in order to construct weak left adjoint to those functor for which any object in the codomain admit a weak reflection . we then apply these two result in order to restate the Injective Subcategory Problem for $ \sigma$ into the existence of some kind of weak right adjoint for F.

title: Models of Linear Logic based on the Schwartz $\varepsilon$-product
abstract: from the interpretation of Linear Logic multiplicative disjunction as the epsilon product define by Laurent Schwartz , we construct several model of Differential Linear Logic base on the usual mathematical notion of smooth map . this improve on previous result by Blute , Ehrhard and Tasson base on convenient smoothness where only intuitionist model be build . we isolate a completeness condition , call k - quasi - completeness , and an associate notion which be stable under duality call k - reflexivity , allow for a star - autonomous category of k - reflexive space in which the dual of the tensor product be the reflexive version of the epsilon - product . we adapt Meise 's definition of smooth map into a first model of Differential Linear Logic , make of k - reflexive space . we also build two new model of Linear Logic with conveniently smooth map , on category make respectively of Mackey - complete Schwartz space and Mackey - complete Nuclear Spaces ( with extra reflexivity condition ) . vary slightly the notion of smoothness , one also recover model of DiLL on the same star - autonomous category . throughout the article , we work within the setting of Dialogue category where the tensor product be exactly the epsilon - product ( without reflexivization ) .

title: The dual of compact ordered spaces is a variety
abstract: in a recent paper ( 2018 ) , D. Hofmann , R. Neves and P. Nora prove that the dual of the category of compact ordered space and monotone continuous map be a quasi - variety -not finitary , but bound by $ \aleph_1$. an open question be : be it also a variety ? we show that the answer be affirmative . we describe the variety by mean of a set of finitary operation , together with an operation of countably infinite arity , and equational axiom . the dual equivalence be induce by the dualize object [ 0,1 ] .

title: Products and coequalizers in pointed categories
abstract: in this paper , we investigate the property ( p ) that binary product commute with arbitrary coequalizer in pointed category . example of such category include any regular unital or ( pointed ) majority category with coequalizer , as well as any pointed factor permutable category with coequalizer . we establish a Mal'tsev term condition characterize pointed variety of universal algebra satisfy ( p ) . we then consider category satisfy ( p ) locally , i.e. , those category for which every fibre of the fibration of point satisfy ( P ) . example include any regular Mal'tsev or majority category with coequalizer , as well as any regular Gumm category with coequalizer . variety satisfy ( p ) locally be also characterize by a Mal'tsev term condition , which turn out to be equivalent to a variant of Gumm 's shift lemma . furthermore , we show that the variety satisfy ( p ) locally be precisely the variety with normal local projection in the sense of Z. Janelidze .

title: A unified framework for notions of algebraic theory
abstract: universal algebra uniformly capture various algebraic structure , by express they as equational theory or abstract clone . the ubiquity of algebraic structure in mathematic and relate field have give rise to several variant of universal algebra , such as theory of symmetric operad , non - symmetric operad , generalised operad , prop , pro , and monad . these variant of universal algebra be call { notion of algebraic theory } . in this paper , we develop a unified framework for they . the key observation be that each notion of algebraic theory can be identify with a monoidal category , in such a way that algebraic theory correspond to monoid object therein . to incorporate semantic , we introduce a categorical structure call { metamodel } , which formalise a definition of model of algebraic theory . we also define morphism between notion of algebraic theory , which be a monoidal version of profunctor . every strong monoidal functor give rise to an adjoint pair of such morphism , and provide a uniform method to establish isomorphism between category of model in different notion of algebraic theory . a general structure - semantic adjointness result and a double categorical universal property of category of model be also show .

title: Free globularly generated double categories I
abstract: this be the first part of a two paper series study free globularly generate double category . in this first installment we introduce the free globularly generate double category construction . the free globularly generate double category construction canonically associate to every bicategory together with a possible category of vertical morphism , a double category fix this set of initial datum in a free and minimal way . we use the free globularly generate double category to study length , free product , and problem of internalization . we use the free globularly generate double category construction to provide formal functorial extension of the Haagerup standard form construction and the Connes fusion operation to inclusion of factor of not - necessarily finite Jones index .

title: Distributive laws between the Three Graces
abstract: by the Three Graces we refer , follow J.-L. Loday , to the algebraic operad Ass , Com , and Lie , each generate by a single binary operation ; algebra over these operad be respectively associative , commutative associative , and Lie . we classify all distributive law ( in the categorical sense of Beck ) between these three operad . some of our result depend on the computer algebra system Maple , especially its package LinearAlgebra and Groebner .

title: The Zassenhaus lemma in star-regular categories
authors: Olivette Ngaha Ngaha and Florence Sterck
abstract: the Noether Isomorphism Theorems and the Zassenhaus Lemma from group theory have a non - pointed version in a suitable categorical context first consider by W. Tholen in his phd thesis . this article lead to a unification of these result with the one in the pointed categorical context previously consider by O.~Wyler , by work in the framework of \emph{star - regular } category introduce by M.~Gran , Z.~Janelidze and A.~Ursini . some concrete example of category where these result hold be examine in detail .

title: Finitely Presentable Algebras For Finitary Monads
authors: J. Adamek, S. Milius, L. Sousa and T. Wissmann
abstract: for finitary regular monad t on locally finitely presentable category we characterize the finitely presentable object in the category of t - algebra in the style know from general algebra : they be precisely the algebra presentable by finitely many generator and finitely many relation .

title: A model structure on prederivators for (∞,1)-categories
authors: D. Fuentes-Keuthan, M. Kedziorek and M. Rovelli
abstract: by theorem of Carlson and Renaudin , the theory of ( ∞,1)-categorie embed in that of prederivator . the purpose of this paper be to give a two - fold answer to the inverse problem : understand which prederivator model ( ∞,1)-categorie , either strictly or in a homotopical sense . first , we characterize which prederivator arise on the nose as prederivator associate to quasicategorie . next , we put a model structure on the category of prederivator and strict natural transformation , and prove a Quillen equivalence with the Joyal model structure for quasicategorie .

title: A note on internal object action representability of 1-cat groups and  crossed modules
abstract: the category of 1 - cat group , which be equivalent to the category of cross module , have internal object action which be representable ( by internal automorphism group ) . moreover , it be know that the cross module , correspond to the represent object [ x ] = aut(x ) $ associate with a 1 - cat group x , must be isomorphic to the Norrie actor of the cross module correspond to X. we recall the description of Aut(X ) from the author 's phd thesis , and construct that isomorphism explicitly .

title: On Finitary Functors
authors: Jiri Adamek, Stefan Milius, Lurdes Sousa and Thorsten Wissmann
abstract: a simple criterion for a functor to be finitary be present : we call F finitely bound if for all object x every finitely generate subobject of fx factorize through the F - image of a finitely generate subobject of X. this be equivalent to F be finitary for all functor between ` reasonable ' locally finitely presentable category , provide that F preserve monomorphism . we also discuss the question when that last assumption can be drop . the answer be affirmative for functor between category such as Set , K - Vec ( vector space ) , boolean algebra , and action of any finite group either on Set or on K - Vec for field k of characteristic 0 . all this generalize to locally $ \lambda$-presentable category , $ \lambda$-accessible functor and $ \lambda$-presentable algebra . as an application we obtain an easy proof that the Hausdorff functor on the category of complete metric space be $ \aleph_1$-accessible .

title: Weak $\infty$-categories via terminal coalgebras
abstract: high categorical structure be often define by induction on dimension , which a priori produce only finite - dimensional structure . in this paper we show how to extend such definition to infinite dimension use the theory of terminal coalgebra , and we apply this method to Trimble 's notion of weak n - category . Trimble 's definition make explicit the relationship between n - category and topological space ; our extend theory produce a definition of Trimble $ \infty$-category and a fundamental $ \infty$-groupoid construction . furthermore , terminal coalgebra be often construct as limit of a certain type . we prove that the theory of Batanin - Leinster weak $ \infty$-categories arise as just such a limit , justify our approach to Trimble $ \infty$-categories . in fact we work at the level of monad for $ \infty$-categorie , rather than $ \infty$-categorie themselves ; this require more sophisticated technology but also provide a more complete theory of the structure in question .

title: The tangent bundle of a model category
authors: Yonatan Harpaz, Joost Nuiten, Matan Prasma
abstract: this paper study the homotopy theory of parametrize spectrum object in a model category from a global point of view . more precisely , for a model category $ m$ satisfy suitable condition , we construct a map of model category $ tm \to m$ , call the tangent bundle , whose fiber over an object in $ m$ be a model category for spectrum in its over - category . we show that the tangent bundle be a relative model category and present the $ \infty$-categorical tangent bundle , as construct by Lurie . moreover , the tangent bundle $ tm$ inherit an enriched model structure from $ M$. this additional structure be use in subsequent work to identify the tangent bundle of algebra over an operad and of enrich category , but may be of independent interest .

title: Characterization of left coextensive varieties of universal algebras
abstract: an extensive category can be define as a category C with finite coproduct such that for each pair x , y of object in C , the canonical functor $ + : c / x \times c / y \to c/(x + y)$ be an equivalence . we say that a category C with finite product be leave coextensive if the dual canonical functor $ \times : x / c \times y / c \to ( x \times y)/c$ be fully faithful . we then give a syntactical characterization of leave coextensive variety of universal algebra .

title: Adjunction up to automorphism
abstract: we say a set - value functor on a category be nearly representable if it be a quotient of a representable functor by a group of automorphism . a distributor be a set - value functor in two argument , contravariant in one argument and covariant in the other . we say a distributor be slicewise nearly representable if it be nearly representable in either of the argument whenever the other argument be fix . we consider such a distributor a weak analogue of adjunction . under a finiteness assumption on the domain category , we show that every slicewise nearly representable functor be a composite of two distributor , each of which may be consider as a weak analogue of ( co-)reflective adjunction .

title: Biproducts and commutators for noetherian forms
abstract: noetherian form provide an abstract self - dual context in which one can establish homomorphism theorem ( Noether isomorphism theorem and homological diagram lemma ) for group , ring , module and other group - like structure . in fact , any semi - abelian category in the sense of G. Janelidze , L. M\arki and W. Tholen , as well as any exact category in the sense of M. Grandis ( and hence , in particular , any abelian category ) , can be see as an example of a noetherian form . in this paper we generalize the notion of a biproduct of object in an abelian category to a noetherian form and apply it do develop commutator theory in noetherian form . in the case of semi - abelian category , biproduct give usual product of object and our commutator coincide with the so - call Huq commutator ( which in the case of group be the usual commutator of subgroup ) . this paper thus show that the structure of a noetherian form allow for a self - dual approach to product and commutator in semi - abelian category , similarly as have be know for homomorphism theorem .

title: Weak units, universal cells, and coherence via universality for bicategories
abstract: Poly - bicategorie generalise planar polycategorie in the same way as bicategorie generalise monoidal category . in a poly - bicategory , the existence of enough 2 - cell satisfy certain universal property ( representability ) induce coherent algebraic structure on the 2 - graph of single - input , single - output 2 - cell . a special case of this theory be use by Hermida to produce a proof of strictification for bicategorie . no full strictification be possible for higher - dimensional category , seemingly due to problem with 2 - cell that have degenerate boundary ; it be conjecture by C. Simpson that semi - strictification exclude unit may be possible . we study poly - bicategorie where 2 - cell with degenerate boundary be bar , and show that we can recover the structure of a bicategory through a different construction of weak unit . we prove that the existence of these unit be equivalent to the existence of 1 - cell satisfy lower - dimensional universal property , and study the relation between preservation of unit and universal cell . then , we introduce merge - bicategorie , a variant of poly - bicategorie with more composition operation , which admit a natural monoidal closed structure , give access to high morphism . we derive equivalence between morphism , transformation , and modification of representable merge - bicategorie and the correspond notion for bicategorie . finally , we prove a semi - strictification theorem for representable merge - bicategorie with a choice of composite and unit .

title: Homotopy theory with *-categories
abstract: we construct model category structure on various type of ( marked ) * -categorie . these structure be use to present the infinity category of ( marked ) * -categorie obtain by invert ( marked ) unitary equivalence . we use this presentation to explicitly calculate the $ \infty$-categorical g - fix point and g - orbit for g - equivariant ( marked ) * -categorie .

title: The genuine operadic nerve
abstract: we construct a generalization of the operadic nerve , provide a translation between the equivariant simplicially enrich operadic world to the parametrized $ \infty$-categorical perspective . this naturally factor through genuine equivariant operad , a model for ` ` equivariant operad with norm up to homotopy '' . we introduce the notion of an op - fibration of genuine equivariant operad , extend Grothendieck op - fibration , and characterize fibrant operad as the image of genuine equivariant symmetric monoidal category . moreover , we show that under the operadic nerve , this image be send to G - symmetric monoidal g-$\infty$-categories . finally , we produce a functor compare the notion of algebra over an operad in each of these two context .

title: Monic skeleta, Boundaries, Aufhebung, and the meaning of `one-dimensionality'
abstract: let E be a topos . if l be a level of E with monic skeleta then it make sense to consider the object in E that have l - skeletal boundary . in particular , if p : e \to s be a pre - cohesive geometric morphism then its centre ( that may be call level 0 ) have monic skeleta . let level 1 be the Aufhebung of level 0 . we show that if level 1 have monic skeleta then the quotient of 0 - separate object with 0 - skeletal boundary be 1 - skeletal . we also prove that in several example ( such as the classifier of non - trivial boolean algebra , simplicial set and the classifier of strictly bipointed object ) every 1 - skeletal object be of that form .

title: A universal characterisation of codescent objects
abstract: in this work we define a 2 - dimensional analogue of extranatural transformation and use these to characterise codescent object . they will be see as universal object amongst pseudo - extranatural transformation in a similar manner in which coend be universal object amongst extranatural transformation . some composition lemma concern these transformation be introduce and a Fubini theorem for codescent object be prove use the universal characterisation description .

title: Strictification tensor product of 2-categories
abstract: give 2 - category c and d , let Lax ( c , d ) denote the 2 - category of lax functor , lax natural transformation and modification , and [ c , d]_lnt its full sub-2 - category of ( strict ) 2 - functor . we give two isomorphic construction of a 2 - category c \boxtimes d satisfy lax ( c , lax(d , e ) ) \cong [ c \boxtime d , e}_lnt , hence generalise the case of the free distributive law 1 \boxtimes 1 . we also discuss dual construction .

title: Left-invariant vector fields on a Lie 2-group
abstract: a Lie 2 - group G be a category internal to the category of Lie group . consequently it be a monoidal category and a Lie groupoid . the Lie groupoid structure on G give rise to the Lie 2 - algebra x(g ) of multiplicative vector field . the monoidal structure on G gives rise to a left action of the 2 - group G on the Lie groupoid G , hence to an action of g on the Lie 2 - algebra x(g ) . as a result we get the Lie 2 - algebra x(g)^g of left - invariant multiplicative vector field . on the other hand there be a well - know construction that associate a Lie 2 - algebra g to a Lie 2 - group G : apply the functor Lie : LieGp -&gt ; LieAlg to the structure map of the category G. we show that the Lie 2 - algebra g be isomorphic to the Lie 2 - algebra x(g)^g of left invariant multiplicative vector field .

title: Coequalizers and free triples, II
authors: Michael Barr, John Kennison, and R. Raphael
abstract: this paper study a category x with an endofunctor t : x \to X. a t - algebra be give by a morphism tx \to x in X. we examine the related question of when T freely generate a triple ( or monad ) on X ; when an object x in X freely generate a t - algebra ; and when the category of t - algebra have coequalizer and other colimit . the paper define a category of ` ` t - horn '' which effectively contain x as well as all t - algebra . it be assume that xs be cocomplete and have a factorization system ( e , m ) satisfy reasonable property . an ordinal - indexed sequence of t - horn be then define which provide successive approximation to a free t - algebra generate by an object x in X , as well as approximation to coequalizer and other colimit for the category of t - algebra . use the notion of an m - cone and a separate t - horn it be show that if X be m - well - power , then the ordinal sequence stabilize at the desire free algebra or coequalizer or other colimit whenever they exist . this paper be a successor to a paper write by the first author in 1970 that show that T generate a free triple when every x in X generate a free t - algebra . we also consider colimit in triple algebra and give some example of functor t for which no x in X generate a free t - algebra .

title: Fibred pseudo double categories for game semantics
abstract: we unify previous construction from our work on concurrent game semantic into a single categorical framework . from an operational description of position and move in some game , call a \emph{signature } , we produce a pseudo double category , in which object be position and vertical morphism be play . the consider game be multi - player , so it make sense to consider embedding of position : these be the horizontal morphism . finally , cell may be think of as embedding of play preserve initial and final position . in order to be suitable for game semantic , the obtain pseudo double category should enjoy a certain fibredness property . under suitable hypothesis , we show that our construction actually produce such a \emph{fibred } pseudo double category , from which we can define relevant category of play , and thus of strategy . we give a first necessary and sufficient criterion for this to hold and then a sufficient criterion that can be check more easily .

title: A note on the categorical congruence distributivity
abstract: having give a characterization of the categorical congruence modularity getting rid of the assumption that the ground category be regular , we give now a characterization of the categorical congruence distributivity . we have a look as well at the case where the congruence distributivity be only involve , in some sense , for a subclass $ \gamma$ of equivalence relation .

title: Quotient categories and phases
abstract: we study property of a category after quotiente out a suitable choose group of isomorphism on each object . coproduct in the original category be describe in its quotient by our new weak notion of a ` phased coproduct ' . we examine these and show that any suitable category with they arise as such a quotient of a category with coproduct . motivation come from projective geometry , and also quantum theory where they describe superposition in the category of hilbert space and continuous linear map up to global phase . the quotient we consider also generalise those induce by categorical isotropy in the sense of Funk et al .

title: Limits in dagger categories
abstract: we develop a notion of limit for dagger category , that we show be suitable in the following way : it subsume special case know from the literature ; dagger limit be unique up to unitary isomorphism ; a wide class of dagger limit can be build from a small selection of they ; dagger limit of a fix shape can be phrase as dagger adjoint to a diagonal functor ; dagger limit can be build from ordinary limit in the presence of polar decomposition ; dagger limit commute with dagger colimit in many case .

title: Colimits  of monoids
abstract: if C be a monoidal category with reflexive coequalizer which be preserve by tensore from both side , then the category MonC of monoid over C have all coequalizer and these be regular epimorphism in C. this imply that MonC have all colimit which exist in C , provide that C in addition have ( regular epi , jointly monomorphic)-factorizations of discrete cone and admit arbitrary free monoid . a further application be a lift theorem for adjunction with a monoidal right adjoint whose left adjoint be not necessarily strong to adjunction between the respective category of monoid .

title: Well-closed subschemes of noncommutative schemes
abstract: Van den Bergh have define the blowup of a noncommutative surface at a point lie on a commutative divisor . we study one aspect of the construction , with an eventual aim of define more general kind of noncommutative blowup . our basic object of study be a quasi - scheme x ( a Grothendieck category ) . give a closed subcategory Z , in order to define a blowup of X along Z one first need to have a functor f_z which be an analog of tensoring with the define ideal of Z. follow Van den Bergh , a closed subcategory z which have such a functor be call well - close . we show that well - closedness can be characterize by the existence of certain projective effacement for each object of x , and that the need functor f_z have an explicit description in term of such effacement . as an application , we prove that closed point be well - close in quite general quasi - scheme .

title: Affine geometric spaces in tangent categories
authors: R. F. Blute, G. S. H. Cruttwell,  and R. B. B. Lucyshyn-Wright
abstract: we continue the program of structural differential geometry that begin with the notion of a tangent category , an axiomatization of structural aspect of the tangent functor on the category of smooth manifold . in classical geometry , have an affine structure on a manifold be equivalent to have a flat torsion - free connection on its tangent bundle . this equivalence allow we to define a category of affine object associate to a tangent category and we show that the result category be also a tangent category , as be several related category . as a consequence of some of these idea we also give two new characterization of flat torsion - free connection . we also consider 2 - categorical structure associate to the category of tangent category and demonstrate that assignment of the tangent category of affine object to a tangent category induce a 2 - comonad .

title: On spans with right fibred right adjoints
abstract: we introduce a new condition on an abstract span of category which we refer to as have right fibred right adjoint , rfra for short . we show that : ( a ) the span of split extension of a semi - abelian category C have rfra if and only if C be action representable ; ( b ) the reverse span to the one consider in ( a ) have rfra if and only if C be locally algebraically cartesian closed ; ( c ) the span of split extension of the category of morphism of C have rfra if and only if C be action representable and have normalizer ; ( d ) the reverse span to the one consider in ( c ) have rfra if and only if C be locally algebraically cartesian closed . we also examine our condition for the span of monoid action ( of monoid in a monoidal category c on object in a give category on which C act ) , and for various other span .

title: The operadic nerve, relative nerve and the Grothendieck construction
authors: Jonathan Beardsley and Liang Ze Wong
abstract: we relate the relative nerve $ n_f(d)$ of a diagram of simplicial set $ f : d \to sset$ with the Grothendieck construction $ gr f$ of a simplicial functor $ f : d \to scat$ in the case where $ f = n f$. we far show that any strict monoidal simplicial category $ c$ give rise to a functor $ c^\bullet : \delta^\op \to scat$ , and that the relative nerve of $ \n c^\bullet$ be the operadic nerve $ \n^\otimes(c)$. finally , we show that all the above construction commute with appropriately define opposite functor .

title: The formal theory of multimonoidal monads
abstract: certain aspect of Street 's formal theory of monad in 2 - category be extend to multimonoidal monad in symmetric strict monoidal 2 - category . namely , any symmetric strict monoidal 2 - category M admit a symmetric strict monoidal 2 - category of pseudomonoid , monoidal 1 - cell and monoidal 2 - cell in M. dually , there be a symmetric strict monoidal 2 - category of pseudomonoid , opmonoidal 1 - cell and opmonoidal 2 - cell in M. extend a construction due to Aguiar and Mahajan for M = Cat , we may apply the first construction p - time and the second one q - time ( in any order ) . it yield a 2 - category m_{pq } . a 0 - cell therein be an object a of M together with p+q compatible pseudomonoid structure ; it be term a ( p+q)-oidal object in M. a monad in m_{pq } be call a ( p , q)-oidal monad in M ; it be a monad t on A in M together with p monoidal , and q opmonoidal structure in a compatible way . if M have monoidal Eilenberg - Moore construction , and certain ( Linton type ) stable coequalizer exist , then a ( p+q)-oidal structure on the Eilenberg - Moore object a^t of a ( p , q)-oidal monad ( a , t ) be show to arise via a symmetric strict monoidal double functor to Ehresmann 's double category sqr(m ) of square in M , from the double category of monad in sqr(m ) in the sense of Fiore , Gambino and Kock . while q one of the pseudomonoid structure of a^t be lift along the ` forgetful ' 1 - cell a^t -&gt ; a , the other p one be lift along its left adjoint . in the particular example when M be an appropriate 2 - subcategory of Cat , this yield a conceptually different proof of some recent result due to Aguiar , Haim and Lopez Franco .

title: Topoi of parametrized objects
abstract: we give necessary and sufficient condition on a presentable $ \infty$-category $ c$ so that family of object of $ c$ form an $ \infty$-topos . in particular , we prove a conjecture of Joyal that this be the case whenever $ c$ be stable .

title: Categorification of pre-Lie Algebras and solutions of 2-graded classical Yang-Baxter equations
abstract: in this paper , we introduce the notion of a pre - lie 2 - algebra , which be the categorification of a pre - lie algebra . we prove that the category of pre - lie 2 - algebra and the category of 2 - term pre - lie$_\infty$-algebras be equivalent . we classify skeletal pre - lie 2 - algebra by the third cohomology group of a pre - lie algebra . we prove that cross module of pre - lie algebra be in one - to - one correspondence with strict pre - lie 2 - algebra . O - operator on Lie 2 - algebra be introduce , which can be use to construct pre - lie 2 - algebra . as an application , we give solution of 2 - grade classical Yang - Baxter equation in some semidirect product Lie 2 - algebra .

title: Majority categories
abstract: we introduce the notion of a majority category - the categorical counterpart of variety of universal algebra admit a majority term . this notion can be think to capture property of the category of lattice , in a way that parallel how Mal'tsev category capture property of the category of group . among algebraic majority category be the category of lattice , boolean algebra and Heyting algebra . many geometric category such as the category of topological space , metric space , order set , any topo , etc . , be comajority category ( i.e.~their dual be majority category ) , and we show that , under mild assumption , the only category which be both majority and comajority , be the preorder . Mal'tsev majority category provide an alternative generalization of arithmetical category to protoarithmetical category in the sense of Bourn . we show that every Mal'tsev majority category be protoarithmetical , provide a counter - example for the converse implication , and show that in the Barr - exact context , the converse implication also hold . we can then conclude that a category be arithmetical if and only if it be a Barr - exact Mal'tsev majority category , recover in the varietal context a well know result of Pixley .

title: A probability monad as the colimit of spaces of finite samples
abstract: we define and study a probability monad on the category of complete metric space and short map . it assign to each space the space of Radon probability measure on it with finite first moment , equip with the Kantorovich - Wasserstein distance . this monad be analogous to the Giry monad on the category of polish space , and it extend a construction due to van Breugel for compact and for 1 - bounded complete metric space . we prove that this Kantorovich monad arise from a colimit construction on finite power - like construction , which formalize the intuition that probability measure be limit of finite sample . the proof rely on a criterion for when an ordinary left Kan extension of lax monoidal functor be a monoidal Kan extension . the colimit characterization allow the development of integration theory and the treatment of measure on space of measure , without measure theory . we also show that the category of algebra of the Kantorovich monad be equivalent to the category of closed convex subset of Banach space with short affine map as morphism .

title: Cluster-tilting subcategories in extriangulated categories
abstract: let $ ( c , e , s)$ be an extriangulate category . we show that certain quotient category of extriangulate category be equivalent to module category by some restriction of functor $ e$ , and in some case , they be abelian . this result can be regard as a simultaneous generalization of Koenig - Zhu and Demonet - Liu . in addition , we introduce the notion of maximal rigid subcategorie in extriangulate category . cluster tilting subcategorie be obviously strongly functorially finite maximal rigid subcategorie , we prove that the converse be true if the 2 - Calabi - Yau extriangulate category admit a cluster tilting subcategorie , which generalize a result of Buan - Iyama - Reiten - Scott and Zhou - Zhu .

title: Six operations formalism for generalized operads
abstract: this paper show that generalization of operad equip with their respective bar / cobar duality be relate by a six operation formalism analogous to that of classical context in algebraic geometry . as a consequence of our construction , we prove intertwine theorem which govern derive Koszul duality of push - forward and pull - back .

title: Distributors and the comprehensive factorization system for internal groupoids
abstract: in this note we prove that distributor between groupoid in a Barr - exact category e form the bicategory of relation relative to the comprehensive factorization system in gpd(e ) . the case e = Set be of special interest .

title: Lifting bicategories into double categories: The globularily generated condition
abstract: this be the first part of a series of paper study the problem of existence of double category for which horizontal bicategory and object category be give . we refer to this problem as the problem of existence of internalization for decorate bicategorie . motivate by this we introduce the condition of a double category be globularily generate . we prove that the problem of existence of internalization for a decorate bicategory admit a solution if and only if it admit a globularily generate solution , and we prove that the condition of a double category be globularily generate be precisely the condition of a solution to the problem of existence of internalization for a decorate bicategory be minimal in a sense which we will make precise . the study of the condition of a double category be globularily generate will thus be pivotal in our study of the problem of existence of internalization .

title: On the relative projective space
abstract: let $ ( c,\otimes,1)$ be an abelian symmetric monoidal category satisfy certain exactness condition . in this paper we define a presheaf $ proj{c}$ on the category of commutative algebra in $ c$ and we prove that this functor be a $ c$ -scheme in the sense of B. Toen and M. Vaquie . we give another definition and prove that they give isomorphic $ c$ -scheme . this construction give we a context of non - associative relative algebraic geometry . the most important example of the construction be the octonionic projective space .

title: Lifting PIE limits with strict projections
abstract: we give a unify direct proof of the lifting of PIE limit to the 2 - category of algebra and ( pseudo ) morphism , which specify precisely which of the projection of the lift limit be strict and detect strictness . in the literature , these limit be lift one by one , so as to keep track of these projection in each case . we work in the more general context of weak algebra morphism , so as to include lax morphism as well . PIE limit be also all simultaneously lift in this case , provide some specify arrow of the diagram be pseudo morphism . again , this unify the previously know lifting of many particular PIE limit , which be also treat separately .

title: Involutive categories, colored *-operads and quantum field theory
authors: Marco Benini, Alexander Schenkel and Lukas Woike
abstract: involutive category theory provide a flexible framework to describe involutive structure on algebraic object , such as anti - linear involution on complex vector space . motivate by the prominent role of involution in quantum ( field ) theory , we develop the involutive analog of color operad and their algebra , name colored * -operad and * -algebra . central to the definition of colored * -operad be the involutive monoidal category of symmetric sequence , which we obtain from a general product - exponential 2 - adjunction whose right adjoint form involutive functor category . for * -algebra over * -operad we obtain involutive analog of the usual change of color and operad adjunction . as an application , we turn the color operad for algebraic quantum field theory into colored * -operad . the simple instance be the associative * -operad , whose * -algebra be unital and associative * -algebra .

title: An intrinsic approach to the non-abelian tensor product via internal crossed squares
authors: Davide di Micco and Tim Van der Linden
abstract: we explain how , in the context of a semi - abelian category , the concept of an internal cross square may be use to set up an intrinsic approach to the Brown - Loday non - abelian tensor product .

title: Segal enriched categories and applications
abstract: in this paper we develop a theory of Segal enrich category . our motivation be to generalize the notion of up - to - homotopy monoid in a monoidal category , introduce by Leinster . our formalism generalize the classical theory of Segal category and extend the theory of category enrich over a 2 - category . we introduce Segal dg - category which do not exist so far . we show that the homotopy transfer problem for algebra lead directly to a Leinster - Segal algebra .

title: Exponentiability in Double Categories  and the Glueing Construction
abstract: we consider pre - exponentiable object of a pre - cartesian double category d , i.e. , object y such that the lax functor - x y : d --&gt ; d have a right adjoint in the 2 - category lxdbl of double category and lax functor . when d have 2 - glueing , we show that Y be pre - exponentiable in D if and only if Y be exponentiable in d_0 and - x y be an oplax functor . thus , such a D be pre - cartesian closed as a double category if and only if d_0 be a cartesian closed category . application include the double category cat , po , space , loc , and topo , whose object be small category , poset , topological space , locale , and topos , respectively .

title: On the construction of limits and colimits in ∞-categories
abstract: in previous work , we introduce an axiomatic framework within which to prove theorem about many variety of infinite - dimensional category simultaneously . in this paper , we establish criterion imply that an ∞-category --- for instance , a quasi - category , a complete Segal space , or a Segal category --- be complete and cocomplete , admit limit and colimit index by any small simplicial set . our strategy be to build ( co)limit of diagram index by a simplicial set inductively from ( co)limit of restricted diagram index by the piece of its skeletal filtration . we show directly that the module that express the universal property of ( co)limit of diagram of these shape be reconstructible as limit of the module that express the universal property of ( co)limit of the restrict diagram . we also prove that the Yoneda embedding preserve and reflect limit in a suitable sense , and deduce our main theorem as a consequence .

title: Cohesive toposes of sheaves on monoids of continuous endofunctions of the unit interval
abstract: we determine the large submonoid of the monoid of continuous endomorphism of the unit interval [ 0,1 ] on which the finite partition form the basis of a Grothendieck topology , and thus determine a cohesive topos over set . we analyze some of the sheaf theoretic aspect of this topos . furthermore , we adapt the construction of Menni to include another model of axiomatic cohesion . we conclude the paper with a proof of the fact that a sufficiently cohesive topos of presheave do not satisfy the continuity axiom .

title: Monoidal Grothendieck Construction
abstract: we lift the standard equivalence between fibration and index category to an equivalence between monoidal fibration and monoidal index category , namely lax monoidal pseudofunctor to the 2 - category of category . furthermore , we investigate the relation between this ` global ' monoidal version where the total category be monoidal and the fibration strictly preserve the structure , and a ` fibrewise ' one where the fibre be monoidal and the reindexe functor strongly preserve the structure , first hint by Shulman . in particular , when the domain be cocartesian monoidal , we show how lax monoidal structure on a pseudofunctor to Cat bijectively correspond to lift of the pseudofunctor to MonCat . finally , we give some example where this correspondence appear , span from the fundamental and family fibration to network model and system .

title: Classification of Constructible Cosheaves
abstract: in this paper we prove an equivalence theorem originally observe by Robert MacPherson . on one side of the equivalence be the category of cosheave that be constructible with respect to a locally cone - like stratification . our constructibility condition be new and only require that certain inclusion of open set be send to isomorphism . on the other side of the equivalence be the category of functor from the entrance path category , which have point for object and certain homotopy class of path for morphism . when our constructible cosheave be value in Set we prove an additional equivalence with the category of stratified covering .

title: Higher Segal spaces via higher excision
abstract: we show that the various high Segal condition of Dyckerhoff and Kapranov can all be characterize in purely categorical term by high excision condition ( in the spirit of Goodwillie -- Weiss manifold calculus ) on the simplex category Δ and the cyclic category Λ.

title: A recipe for black box functors
abstract: the task of construct compositional semantic for network - style diagrammatic language , such as electrical circuit or chemical reaction network , have be dub the black boxing problem , as it give semantic that describe the property of each network that can be observe externally , through composition , while discard the internal structure . one way to solve these problem be to formalise the diagram and their semantic use hypergraph category , with semantic interpretation a hypergraph functor , call the black box functor , between they . build on a previous method for construct hypergraph category and functor , know as decorate corelation , in this paper we construct a category of decorate datum , and show that the decorate corelation method be itself functorial , with a universal property characterise by a left Kan extension . we then show that any hypergraph category can be present in term of decorate datum , and hence argue that the category of decorate datum be a good setting in which to construct any hypergraph functor . as an example , we give a new construction of Baez and Pollard 's black box functor for reaction network .

title: Lax limits of model categories
abstract: for a diagram of simplicial combinatorial model category , we show that the associate lax limit , endow with the projective model structure , be a presentation of the lax limit of the underlie ∞-categorie . our approach can also allow for the indexing category to be simplicial , as long as the diagram factor through its homotopy category . analogous result for the associate homotopy limit ( and other intermediate limit ) directly follow .

title: Weak model categories in classical and constructive mathematics
abstract: we introduce a notion of " weak model category " which be a weakening of the notion of Quillen model category , still sufficient to define a homotopy category , Quillen adjunction , Quillen equivalence , and most of the usual construction of categorical homotopy theory . both left and right semi - model category be weak model category , and the opposite of a weak model category be again a weak model category . the main advantage of weak model category be that they be easy to construct than Quillen model category . in particular we give some simple criterion on two weak factorization system for they to form a weak model category . the theory be develop in a very weak constructive , even predicative , framework and we use it to give constructive proof of the existence of weak version of various standard model category , include the Kan - Quillen model structure , Lurie 's variant of the Joyal model structure on mark simplicial set , and the Verity model structure for weak complicial set . we also construct semi - simplicial version of all these .

title: A localization of bicategories via homotopies
authors: Descotte M.E., Dubuc E.J., and Szyld M.
abstract: give a bicategory C and a family w of arrow of C , we give condition on the pair ( c , w ) that allow we to construct the bicategorical localization with respect to W by deal only with the 2 - cell , that be without add object or arrow to C. we show that in this case , the 2 - cell of the localization can be give by the homotopie with respect to W , a notion define in this article which be closely relate to Quillen 's notion of homotopy for model category but depend only on a single family of arrow . this localization result have a natural application to the construction of the homotopy bicategory of a model bicategory , which we develop elsewhere , as the pair ( c_{fc},w ) give by the weak equivalence between fibrant - cofibrant object satisfy the condition give in the present article .

title: Cocompletion of restriction categories
abstract: restriction category be introduce as a way of generalise the notion of partial map category . in this paper , we define a notion of cocompleteness for restriction category , and describe the free cocompletion of a small restriction category as a suitably define category of restriction presheave . we also consider free cocompletion in the case where our restriction category be only locally small .

title: The folk model category structure on strict ω-categories is monoidal
abstract: we prove that the folk model category structure on the category of strict ω - category , introduce by Lafont , Métayer and Worytkiewicz , be monoidal , first , for the Gray tensor product and , second , for the join of ω - category , introduce by the first author and Maltsiniotis . we moreover show that the Gray tensor product induce , by adjunction , a tensor product of strict ( m , n)-categorie and that this tensor product be also compatible with the folk model category structure . in particular , we get a monoidal model category structure on the category of strict ω - groupoid . we prove that this monoidal model category structure satisfy the monoid axiom , so that the category of Gray monoid , study by the second author , bear a natural model category structure .

title: The 2-Chu-Dialectica construction and the polycategory of multivariable  adjunctions
abstract: Cheng , Gurski , and Riehl construct a cyclic double multicategory of multivariable adjunction . we show that the same information be carry by a poly double category , in which opposite category be polycategorical dual . moreover , this poly double category be a full substructure of a double Chu construction , whose object be a sort of polarize category , and which be a natural home for 2 - categorical duality . we obtain the double Chu construction use a general " Chu - Dialectica " construction on polycategorie , which include both the Chu construction and the categorical Dialectica construction of de Paiva . the Chu and Dialectica construction each impose additional hypothesis make the result polycategory representable ( hence * -autonomous ) , but for different reason ; this lead to their apparent difference .

title: Network Models
authors: John C. Baez, John Foley, Joe Moeller, and Blake S. Pollard
abstract: network can be combine in various way , such as overlay one on top of another or set two side by side . we introduce ` network model ' to encode these way of combine network . different network model describe different kind of network . we show that each network model give rise to an operad , whose operation be way of assemble a network of the give kind from small part . such operad , and their algebra , can serve as tool for design network . technically , a network model be a lax symmetric monoidal functor from the free symmetric monoidal category on some set to Cat , and the construction of the corresponding operad proceed via a symmetric monoidal version of the Grothendieck construction .

title: Completely distributive enriched categories  are not always continuous
abstract: in contrast to the fact that every completely distributive lattice be necessarily continuous in the sense of Scott , it be show that complete distributivity of a category enrich over the closed category obtain by endow the unit interval with a continuous t - norm do not imply its continuity in general . necessary and sufficient condition for the implication be present .

title: Braided skew monoidal categories
abstract: we introduce the notion of a braiding on a skew monoidal category , whose curious feature be that the define isomorphism involve three object rather than two . example be show to arise from 2 - category theory and from bialgebra . in order to describe the 2 - categorical example , we take a multicategorical approach . we explain how certain braid skew monoidal structure in the 2 - categorical setting give rise to braided monoidal bicategorie . for the bialgebraic example , we show that , for a skew monoidal category arise from a bialgebra , braiding on the skew monoidal category be in bijection with cobraiding ( also know as coquasitriangular structure ) on the bialgebra .
